Reviews.Title: “Holiday to New York”
Reviews.Author: rhona9710
Reviews.Content: I booked six nights at the Jolly Madison Towers, having read some reviews i was a little worried however I found the hotel to be clean comfortable and friendly. I was in budget accomodation, and I knew what I had booked, so didnt expect more than the basics.if you ask first you can pay the security deposit in cash with no problem, but you do need a credit / debit card to get online. The hotel is a few minutes walk from Times square, Grand Central Station and the Empire State. I was on the 7th floor facing Madison Ave and had a view of the Empire State Building. I would go back iin a heart beat. Just accross the street is the Moonstruck Diner which was great for breakfast, lunch or dinner including take out. 72 hour Grey Line hop on hop off bus, with tickets for attractions was well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for most interesting places”
Reviews.Author: keirta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Jolly for three days in February . We found it ideal for our visit just a few minute walk from the theaters and times square ,Grand Cental station and the Rckerfeller Center (Top of the Roc ) well worth a visit.Staff pleasant and helpfull .would go back

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable and Top Location for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Xzanti
Reviews.Content: I have very few complaints about this Hotel. For the price we paid we got an excellent location, the room was cleaned every day and fresh towels and bedding were provided. I requested a good view and I wasn't disappointed, we were given a corner room and had views of the Empire State Building on one side of us and a breathtaking view down Madison Avenue on the other. There was a well stocked mini bar which we dipped into on a couple of occasions.. a Gray Goose vodka was $8 and a can of Coke was $4.. sounds a little pricey but to be honest I was expecting them to be more expensive, so we weren't too shocked when we got the bill. The room, if a little on the dated side, was very comfortable.. the bed was quite big and very comfy and the bedding was nice and warm, we slept great all week. We were provided with an iron and ironing board and a hair dryer and there was no shortage of complimentary toiletries. The residents bar is a little on the pricey side, $11 for a (quite small) glass of wine, in my books is a little dear, you would expect to pay that up on Times Square. If you're looking for a nightcap and don't fancy venturing very far, Blaggards Irish Bar is just 5 minutes walk up on 38th and Fifth.. We found this a very good little pub. The staff were always helpful and friendly. Like many others who have reviewed this Hotel, we didn't not eat breakfast here, we went across the road to the Moonstruck Diner most days and ate here.. very reasonable and good food. I will be recommending this Hotel to Friends and Family and should I go back to New York I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “awesome weekend!!”
Reviews.Author: twighill395
Reviews.Content: went with my daughter had a really good time got the 48 hour hop on hop off tickets for the bus tour a must for new York very informative guides we even had a lady who sang songs on the way round! when you book into this hotel they ask for your credit card and take out $100 straight away failing that you have to give them a deposit in case you have any extras, we didn't as out in room mini bar was locked!! the radiator was hot all night this was a bit disturbing as the radiator was unplugged! every thing else was grand we had breakfast at a restaurant across the road called moonstruck it was very reasonable and rather large portions! my advice to any one going to new York who wants to see the sights pre book on-line before you go especially for the empire state building saves nearly two hour wait in queues

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, clean, friendly hotel ideally located in the city”
Reviews.Author: tynebandits
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on 38th and 4th. The location is ideal for city centre attractions yet far enough out of the action to be quiet for a good nights sleep. The lobby is tastefully decorated and you'll be welcomed by the friendly team at the Jolly Hotel. There is concierge & bell services available as well as free use of safety deposit boxes, which you can secure upon check in. There is also left luggage available free of charge, although a tip will be expected when you collect - which is fair enough, we left $5. Rooms are tastefully decorated, with TV, mini bar, desk, telephone & radio alarm clock. There is also iron and ironing board in the wardrobe and plenty hangers in there too. The bathroom was large (in NY terms) bath, with shower over, shower screen, loo and large basin with mirror and hairdryer. Also a sash window which was lovely to open after a hot shower. Jergen toiletries are available for your use and restocked daily. Rooms cleaned daily and towels also changed daily. Beds are very comfortable as are the pillows - I like a nice comfy bed and wasn't disappointed, slept like a baby the entire trip! We used the concierge to book a couple of trips and they also gave us some hints of where to eat in the vicinity of the hotel. The hotel has "jolly hour" 5 - 7 every night with half price drinks -although we never actually managed to make it back from our trips to take advantage. If you chose to stay here, there is a little diner called Moonstruck on the corner of 38th & 4th, its gorgeous and serves delicious food and drinks. This is a reasonably priced hotel in a good location, if I return to NY I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, regular service”
Reviews.Author: IGX
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the Jolly Madison (now NH) from the 19 to 22 March. The location is superb, you can walk to Grand Central Station, Times Square, Fifth Av., Empire State, even to Central Park. You can't beat that. The personnel on the reception was not friendly and not eager to help. We had made reservations thru NH World and we had some trouble with it (it was prepaid) and they didn't even bother to call them, because it was a long distance call. In the mean time we called NH and after they received a call from the corporate office, everything was solved. The breakfast buffet is good, european style, bread, cheese and ham. Good quality food. Of course, you don't expect a lot of fresh food, but is very good. The seating for parties of 3 or more is difficult because the room is small and they only have 3 big tables. Very good before going to walk the city. The rooms are small and old. My room was clean, very small space for the luggage, and the bathroom was clean. I know that NY hotels are this way, but as I am used to bigger rooms, it felt odd, but hey.. you are here to know the city, so I wasn't very worried about this. In general, this hotel has great location, you can rest and have breakfast and get to know the city at your own pace. We took the shuttle from the airport to Grand Central and we walked the 2 blocks and saved on the taxi.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: backbarrow
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 6 night the service was very good all the staff went out off there way to make us welcome. moonstuck across the road was very nice for breakfast. we will stay here again.......

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Angela B
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on here we were slightly concerned about staying in this hotel. However we're glad we did - it was spotlessly clean, we had a large room & the hotel in general was very quiet. It was approx a 10 min walk to Empire State Building & Central Station, 15 mins to Times Sq. Reception staff not the friendliest I've came across, they gave the impression they just didn't want to be there! The 'bell boy' (Roy) was great, very welcoming and chatty. We didn't use the hotel bar or restaurant, however did try the Moonstruck diner across the street and would recommend it for food... It was hot, fresh & great value for money. They don't have a licence to serve alcohol however the manager told us we could go to the Store and bring our own beer/wine in to have with our food! All in all, would 100% recommend this hotel and wouldn't hesitate in staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Regretted staying here”
Reviews.Author: Larry F
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, we got the immediate sense that we were not welcomed. The staff is cold and not willing lend a helping hand with anything. They did not seem too happy being there. The only exception was the bellman(didn't catch his name) who was very friendly and funny at times and made the check in process more tolerable. The rooms are badly in need of renovation as well as the lobby. Carpet in the room was shredded in some places and just plain smelled bad. We did not try the breakfast in the hotel but did go to Moonstruck across the street which was delicious and a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: Emma D
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the New York Half Marathon excellent location near tourist attractions and grand central station which is the gateway to their great subway system ! Rooms albeit small were clean and surprisingly quiet for New York staff were very helpful and the Moonstruck diner accross the road was great for breakfast lunch and dinner ! If you are taking the air train from the airport connect at Jamaica and then onto to grand central station grand total of $7.00 as opposed to the $50 for a cab and no hassle at all ! Would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: MeishaT
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews on this hotel myself & my boyfriend were abit worried to cancel & book a different hotel although in the end we decided not to & we are glad we didn't. I am a 21 fussy high expectation type of girl & only expe t the best and believe you me this hotel is fantastic! The hotel is a fantastic location 10 minuit walk to empire state, 20 mins to times square & 30 mins walk to central park. The hotel itself is lovely, very clean & tidy! NO bedbugs!!!! Obviously the person who said this is a compulsive liar & probably didn't wash properly. All of the staff are really helpful & friendly. A guy who worked there arranged our hotel transfer from the hotel back to the newark airport & he gave us a fantastic deal of €90 including tips & he said he will give us a nice car. Not only was it a nice car he arranged a black stretch limo!! What a end to leave newyork in style! Anyone reading this please ignore the horrible reviews, this is a fab hotel & has fab staff!! Also i would suggest to try moonstruck cafe really cheap food! & does amazing pancakes & muffins :D..have a fab time in NYC we sure did.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great stay”
Reviews.Author: FelixFosters
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Jolly Madison over the Xmas period, the main feature is it's location. You are never far from most tourist attractions from this hotel. Grand Central Station is a short walk and gets you to other places you can't get to by walking (cheaper than yellow cabs - although you should also give this a go. We booked a cab with the hotel to take us back to the airport upon our departure and we got a limo - what a way to leave New York! This was certainly better than our inward travel. Got a transfer just outside the airport and spent 45 minutes driving between terminals collecting other fares before arriving back at our original terminal and heading off to our hotel. Our room was on a top floor high which was great as it meant less traffic and street noise. We had some problems with the heater in our room but the reception staff eventually resolved this by providing us with a portable heater. We did not eat at the hotel at all because diners and deli's are available in close proximity. The best meals we found were in China Town and at Planet Holywood. If you are planning to go to Planet Hollywood negotiate a travel within the main section of the restaurant before being shown to your table otherwise you may end up like us on the top floor overlooking the action and not in it. We took part in typical tourist activities such as Ripleys and the CSI Experience. Disappointed with both unfortunately. Had hoped to see a broadway play but we left it to late and the only available tickts were $199 each. If you ant to get to the to of the Empire State bilding would suggest going early as the queue by mid-day will take at least an hour. The boat trips around New York are great and the best way to see the Statue of Liberty, The Brooklyn Bridge etc. Make sure you book the 9/11 Memorial at reception. Although very emotional it gives you a true understanding of the events which took place and an appreciation for life and the spirit of New Yorkers. The store window displays, Xmas trees and ice skating rings are just amazing over Xmas. Ice skating on Xmas Eve on Xmas day was definetely a highlight and the Hot Chocolate with marshmallows and whipped cream is wonderful. Do be careful if paying for a padlock for the lockers. I forgot where ours was and soehow managed to gain access to someone elses ;-( Stumbling across Times Square one evening whilst taking a stroll was enlightening literally. All of a sudden he colour of the sky was bright. There are so many illuminated signs and this area has a real buzz at night time. Didn't care too much for the hoards of people here during the day though. We did use the hotel bar on our last evening. The bar man was nice and friendly. The bar room was a little odd and resembled a chapel or such like. We were surprised at just how many people there were and how many shops remained open on Xmas day. This really is the town that does not sleep. Our only regret was not having longer than 5 days but there is always next time.

Reviews.Title: “Best by a mile for the price”
Reviews.Author: andy61-28-50
Reviews.Content: Before we left we were worried about some of the negative reviews this hotel attracted. Well i am here to say they are all wrong and this hotel is a lovely place well located with staff that do care. The room was on the 10th floor and was not one of the renovated rooms, nevertheless it was clean, with a large bathroom and a massive comfortable bed. There was a little traffic noise but thats New York and one of the wonders of our stay. The hotel is right in the middle of everything with Times Square just a 5 minute walk away. You can see the Emipre State building from the room and you are graced by a number of diners on the main street. Breakfast let the hotel down a little, $22 for cold meats and cheese but go across the road to Moonstruck and have the best 'Irish' breakfast for a lot less money. Draw back is the wi-fi but to be fair America is already on 4G and its our phone roaming costs that are idiotic bearing in mind the technology available. Having said that there are plenty of free wi-fi connections about. Starbucks is a good one to mention. Will we go again.... Yes Would we stay here again... Yes Would i recommend it to you ... Yes If you want posh stay at the Waldorf Astoria. Otherwise you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Jolly Madison”
Reviews.Author: jslaff
Reviews.Content: Smallish room, but a queen for $109 in New York is unbeatable. Very nice bathroom, comfortable bed, great location near midtown and Fifth Avenue. Helpful staff held our bags for a few hours after checkout. Only downside--paid Wifi Internet. I understand the rates are low, but you'd think in this day and age, in New York, you wouldn't have to pay for Wifi. And even worse--it's per device, not per room or account. Oh well. For $109, you can't ask more. Overall, very satisfied, with just that one inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Jolly Hotel Madison Towers”
Reviews.Author: lghlancaster
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Feb 18 2012. The staff at the desk accomodated us at 1030am and allowed us to valet park our car and lock our luggage until we could check in later in the day. The gentleman storing our luggage was very friendly. We then came back and had a smooth check in process. Our room was on the 11 floor. the room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was newly remodeled and clean. there were no bed bugs. after reading all the mixed reviews, I was a bit concerned but I would stay there again. It is in a great location, clean, the price is right. The moonstruck dinner across the street has a great breakfast for 8 dollars! There is lots to do in walking distance. Again nothing fancy but clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Expect a Jolly Attitude...”
Reviews.Author: Cabinetofcuriosities
Reviews.Content: It seemed like we were inconveniencing the staff by staying there. We are two younger ladies and didn't get the respect that some of the older guests were receiving. The Doormen/Bellmen were definitely the rudest people we encountered, they didn't open the doors for us and snidely scoffed at the tips we gave. I work in a hotel in Toronto and you have to earn your tips - you don't expect to just get them for socializing with your co-workers in the lobby. We had won a contest, so thank goodness we didn't have to pay for our stay or I would have been even more disappointed with the service. However, the room was nicely furnished and the bathroom was luxurious (we had a Deluxe Room). Our toilet ran incessantly and the engineer that came to fix it was annoyed more and more each time he came to help us. Internet access was a bit of a hassle, was on the phone with tech support for +30 minutes as their service didn't support my device (HP Touch Pad) and had to initially try to get access on my cell phone which lead me to being charged for roaming. Housekeeping was a little pushy but our rooms were kept with the maximum amount of care and attention. We had a package sent to the hotel a week before our arrival but it got lost somewhere along the way, the staff did very little to help us track it down, although one front desk clerk tried his best to show empathy. We were very close to the Fashion and Garment District which was great as our stay was centered around NY Fashion Week.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again at this hotel on my next visit to NYC”
Reviews.Author: ScouseFella
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many NYC hotels. This is the best so far for location,comfort,cleanliness and especially the price booked with an online site. Quiet neighborhood with good restaurant bars close by, especially an Irish bar a few blocks away that serves good food.

Reviews.Title: “Will only return when no other option is available”
Reviews.Author: siranouche
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we were completely ignored at the reception desk whilst the man was just standing there in the doorway of the back office, chatting to a colleague. No one offered to carry our luggage to the 10th floor. The room was NOT one of the refurbished ones that are displayed on the website. Bedroom walls are not exactly soundproof. Air conditioning unit was also quite loud. Bedsheets were quite thin for the time of year (winter). Room was clean, though. Breakfast ($22,-) & internet ($10,-) are not included. No printer available at the hotel; there is a copy & print shop on the corner, diner Moonstruck is across the road. One our next to last day, the security passes to our hotel room were somehow de-activated. No apologies were made at the reception desk, just a ''may I see a passport" and they re-actived the passes. Upon checking out no one at the reception desk asked if we needed transport to the airport nor did any of the staff ask if our stay at the hotel was a pleasant one. Eventually the bellman did, but only after we had stalled our bags with him for a few hours. Mind you, the hotel charges about $100,- dollars for a transfer to the airport; buses from Grand Central will take you there for about $12-15 dollars. While the hotel is in a top location (and a quiet one) from where most city sights are within walking distance, we will only consider returning to this hotel when no other option is available. This is a hotel asking top dollar for outdated hotel rooms and terrible (customer) service.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and restful stay”
Reviews.Author: E S
Reviews.Content: I've never stayed in a quieter hotel in New York. The renovated rooms and the bathroom in particular are clean and well appointed, and I was very happy with the room and the staff. I think it also depends on your expectations and the price. I booked my room through a fantastic online site with bargains, and I booked it about 2-3 weeks ahead of time. For the right price, it is a great spot-quiet neighborhood, a huge Duane Reade conveniently across the street, as well as a few cute restaurants and cafes surrounding the area. It's not Park Avenue, but it's steps away from everything without being so out of the way.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ncasalini
Reviews.Content: Wasn't sure what to expect due to mixed reviews but had a good stay at the Jolly Madison. The rooms are not all like what you see on the website as only half the hotel has been refurbished but the standard rooms are small but clean and serve there purpose. Once in New York you wont be spending much more time in the room. The hotel offers breakfast but there is a great American dinner (Moonstruck) across the road which offers a great breakfast menu which you can get for about $20 for 2 people. The hotel is in a great location 5 min to Grand Central Station, 10 min to the Empire State and Macys, 15 minutes to Times square and 25 min to the bottom of Central park A cab to downtown from here is about $15 Due to its great location I think its real value for money!! I would stay there again when visiting New York

Reviews.Title: “Delightful European ambiance”
Reviews.Author: oscar3217
Reviews.Content: Great service, lovely room with large bed - closet with lots of hangers! Ultra modern bathroom, 2 shower heads - smart design. Breakfast in the mezzanine salon is outstanding: cold cuts, home made breads, eggs to order, fresh fruit and interesting fruit juices, spectacular capuccino. My hotel of choice for our weekend stays in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay again without thinking twice”
Reviews.Author: GoodtravelerSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel. My room nicely renovated with a big bathroom and street view. Well located. Friendly people at the front desk. I'll stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again in a minute”
Reviews.Author: chgo919
Reviews.Content: I didn't see any major concerns with this hotel at all. I have to say, for the money, it was the best stay I've had in NYC. Had two days there...recently renovated room was lovely. HUGE bathroom. Tub could have fit two (but we didn't try). Spotless. Maid service was great. We had a problem with the TV volume and told the front desk. Someone arrived in FIVE minutes and fixed it! Very professional staff. This is a GREAT hotel for location...walking distance to Grand Central Station will get you ANYWHERE you want to go. Decent Chinese food and deli in the neighborhood. Already trying to figure out when to get time to go to NYC again...and will book again. Do take advantage of the car service...if it's two people or more, you actually SAVE money by getting the town car to/from LaGuardia rather than if you take the GO! bus. Ask the front desk about it.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: John T
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel just after Christmas and was a bit disappointed. The lobby of the hotel is absolutely horrible, they need a massive reno job here. I was lucky enough to get one of the renovated rooms so that was fairly nice but the HVAC system was not working properly and felt quite warm throughout the night. They still have the old CRT TVs which baffles me since you can get new 32" LCD TVs for $200-$300. There was no view from the window, just a view of the other rooms and brick walls of the hotel...but might you this hotel if very very old. The staff was okay for the exception of the Accounting Department - the lady running that department I found to be not too friendly, she should not be conversing with customers - I requested a copy of my invoice because I saw a discrepancy on my credit card. I left her a voice message and waited 4 days and I still did not hear back from her, so I contact the hotel manager and voilà, she called me back with a rude tone in her voice. It is not my problem that she can't do her job properly. There are also no amenities at this hotel, so if you're a business traveller that likes to workout you'd be staying at the wrong place. There was what used to be a restaurant at the base of the hotel which has gone out of business, so I'm not sure why they don't make this area into a fitness facility. The location of the hotel is excellent but watch out for the hotel parking fees. They charge $37 per 24 hour period for a car and $10 more for an SUV. If you have the car parked for 25 hours you will get dinged for two full days no exceptions so be careful. I gave this an average rating due to the hotel location and city it was in; and also considering the time of year it was but I would not stay here again, I'd rather pay a bit more and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “My 2nd visit. A solid mid-town choice. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: mjohns7861
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Jolly Madison for the 2nd time last week and had a pleasant stay. My prior stay at the Jolly was in 2008. Overall, for a clean, basic room on a budget, this is a great mid-town choice. First, the hotel is supurbly located on the corner of 38th and Madison. You can walk most anywhere in mid-town from this location and you are just a few blocks away from Grand Central Station. As we arrived, the hotel for the most part appeared to be the same as my 2008 visit. The lobby is pleasant but nothing fancy and our check-in was with no problem. There is a bar in the lobby (The Whaler) but did not try it. Our room (we had the standard room) on the 11th floor was small, basic, but had everything we needed. The bathroom was well appointed with a nice pedastal sink, and a shower with plenty of hot water and good water pressure. The room is small but no different than 10 other hotels in NYC that I have stayed in. The bed was comfortable with the only real minus being an awful motel quality bed spread we had to peel off each day. The furniture in the room was dated but everything worked great was very clean. Somewhat notably the room got VERY warm each day (we could not figure out given the cold temps outside) and kept the individual climate control unit by the window on COOL HI, to keep the room at a reasonable temperature. Our room was very quiet and despite the hotel being sold out I did not hear a single peep from an adjoining room in three days. Wireless internet service was $9.99 a day and worked great for us. For food, we very much enjoyed the diner across the street, Moonstruck, for our breakfast needs. The maid service did a great job and we left the appropriate tip for them, acknowledging their great work. As my last stay, my sense is this hotel is closely linked with travel agencies in Europe that book a lot of Italian and tourists from other parts of Europe. Overall, I like Jolly Hotel Madison Towers and would stay here again. If you are a fussy, high-maintenance traveller, used to having the red carpet rolled out for you upon arrival and need extensive concierage support during your stay - this may not be the choice for you. This is a basic, clean, no frills hotel. However, if you are on a budget and see a great rate here and are looking for a basic place to stay - this is a nice and reliable choice.

Reviews.Title: “Poor amenities”
Reviews.Author: Sherry G
Reviews.Content: Great location and clean but not much else to offer. The storage in the room consisted of a 4'high, 14" wide and 12" deep unit placed in the one closet. The bar fridge didn't open/work, basic TV channels. When I sent an e-mail to report an item left behind I did not receive an answer. Will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - would come back”
Reviews.Author: Greingo
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night so I can't say much. What I can say is that the location is super for the price, only a 20 minute walk to Time Square and has a nice little breakfast place called Moonstruck right across the street. Room was small but again 'one night' and pleasantly clean. Only real negative is the price for hotel breakfast, charged $22 per person for a buffet and I loathe buffets, so they recommended me to Moonstruck. Took a while for somebody to ring me up because there was only one concierge and he was working with somebody else. Though it might have been nice for them offer to hold our luggage so we didn't have to lug it around for the next 4 hours for our bus to arrive...

Reviews.Title: “good location - not bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: alexontour
Reviews.Content: this was one of the only mid-range priced hotels available in the 1st week of December. Great location. Room was ok, as was the service.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE HOTEL...Never going back”
Reviews.Author: tina s
Reviews.Content: The great thing about this hotel is the location...It is a few blocks from Grand Central Station and about a 15 minute walk from Saks 5th Ave. However, I will NEVER stay there again. The front desk people are rude. I was supposed to pay $330 per night and ended up paying $380 because I wanted 2 double beds instead of 2 twins. They wanted to charge me an extra $80 on top of that for each extra person I had so I just lied and told them there was only 2 of us staying there. Anyway, so you think if you spend almost $400 for one night in a hotel, it would be a pretty nice room right? WRONG. The room was mediocre at best. I didn't bring my hair dryer because most hotels come with it but this one didnt have a hair dryer. I was thirsty so I wanted to try and find a vending machine but the hotel doesnt have a single vending machine. I wanted to use the WI-FI and you had to pay to use their internet. My mother wanted a shower cap and they didn't have it. Parking is not included...you have to pay an extra $37... the valet guy was really nice though. He was the only good part of the stay. I'll never stay there ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good price”
Reviews.Author: buddy m
Reviews.Content: Great location - just three blocks from Grand Central Station and many choices for ground transportation throughout the city and to airports. Room was adequate, very clean. Staff was courteous and provided an early check in.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: AC312
Reviews.Content: There are definitely two types of floors at this hotel - some are renovated and others look extremely worn. A few friends and I booked this hotel through a discount site (I think Priceline). Lobby is very nice, but our first room was on a floor that looked extremely worn (black marks on the walls, old carpet, etc.) Our room was decent size with two double beds, but again the room looked worn and old (seemed like 1990s furnishings) with an old tube TV. Bathroom was on the small side but still manageable. Windows looked out on to the brick wall of the next building. Unfortunately, on day two of our stay, we came back to discover one large cockroach in the bathtub. We did not like this and went down to the lobby - management was extremely nice and understanding, and they immediately upgraded us to a new room. Next room was great - hallways and rooms recently renovated. Large clean beds and huge room along with a flat screen TV. Bathroom was also spacious, but it was weird because the door was a sliding frosted glass door with no lock. Rest of the stay was uneventful, and both rooms were clean besides our one mishap. Best part of this hotel is the location. Extremely cheap for being in the middle of the city, so it was very easy to get around. Stayed at this hotel in August 2010

Reviews.Title: “Grateful for free upgrade”
Reviews.Author: CarrieBradshaw3
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were given a fre upgrade to the 15th floor which I was really pleased about. From reading the reviews here I understood these rooms had been refurbished. I was lucky and got a corner room (1516) which had lots of space, 3 windows and a large bathroom The room and bathroom were both clean, and the bed was ok. I would have preferred a mattress topper as the mattress was quite hard. The bed linen was thin, and with holes. No sign of any bed bugs though! The heating/cooling system wasn't very efficient and was quite noisy. My room was very very hot and the air con was blowing out warm air despite being set to 16 degrees. The maintenance chap quickly came up and sorted it by adjusting the bathroom radiator. The water from the sink ran brown initially which was off putting, but aparently down to the room having not been used for a few days. I would advise letting the taps run for a while before you think about making a drink or cleaning your teeth! Location wise it was great, I didn't eat breakfast there but my friends did the first morning. Apparently it was over priced and not great so for the remainder of our stay we ate the Moonstruck Diner opposite. The staff at the hotel were a little odd, plenty of them around but don't expect them to open the door for you! We also got the hard sell on their car service back to the airport. We politely declined and said we were happy to get a cab and were given lots of scaremongering over how difficult it would be to get a cab. As you can imagine, we had no problem at all, and a cab is cheaper than the hotel car. There was no free wifi in the room, and the wifi that I paid for was temperamental. There was also no free internet access in the reception so we had to pay to get online to do our online flight check in. Little things like this really let hotels down in my opinion. The location is good, and the room ok for the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Room and Bathroom Fine, watch out for bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: vickiw88
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel was good, despite lack of free wifi. Room was clean and bathroom was modern and nice. Half way into the trip, i was eaten alive in my sleep. Concierge told that the rooms were checked daily, and that they were not bites from them, but I am pretty sure they are as mosquitos in November is pretty unlikely. Also heating/cooling system is very loud and situated right under the curtains so blew the curtains all the time. Location was great for shopping on 5th Avenue and a good breakfast place opposite.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: chiltern1000
Reviews.Content: We booked on a deal so no great expectations, but our room was clean and more than adequate. The location is super because you are in easy reach of everything midtown - and Grand Central subway links. Staff were fine but breakfast very expensive when you can eat very well in several diners within a block's walk.

Reviews.Title: “It was not terrible”
Reviews.Author: JeffZee
Reviews.Content: The Jolly Madison has seen better days and they were probably about 40 years ago, because the furnishings look like they were purchased in the early 1970s. On the plus side, the location is convenient to many things mid-town, the bathroom was large and much nicer than the bedroom, the air-conditioning was loud, but worked, and for Manhattan the room was a pretty good (but not great) deal. This is part of an Italian chain and it reminded me of some two and three star pensions I stayed in long ago in Italy (except it's about 20 stories). Despite what others have written, I found the staff to be fine. Not particularly helpful, but fine. The sheets were a little short for the beds, but of acceptable quality and the mattress was comfortable enough. You can hear when other doors open and close on your floor, so I'd not recommend it for light sleepers. In truth, I could not recommend it at all, unless you needed a place to sleep in that part of town and it was the only option at a price you could afford. In many ways, just a depressing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fair price for location.”
Reviews.Author: shy_joe
Reviews.Content: Very close to grand central station. Very comfy bed in small room. Close to tourist areas but u can also wander east for a more locals neighborhood and better priced dining. Big plus was 24 hour valet parking for $37. So even if u check out they will hold ur bags until ur 24 hours is up.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel only has 2 singles in a standard room?”
Reviews.Author: MRICHICKY
Reviews.Content: Booked a standard room online, expected a room with 2 double beds or maybe even 2 queens. BUT, I was informed on the phone when I called to ask about parking, that the standard room ONLY has 2 single beds!! Who has a hotel with 2 single beds??? For a room that small and two single beds, it is SEVERLY over priced!!! They should put that information on the website as well as on such sites as Priceline and Hotwire. This 2 single beds as a standard room is POOR customer service! I have NEVER EVEN heard of such a thing!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Ccfc28
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews leading up to our stay at the jolly Madison towers NYC we were quite concerned of what we might expect of our stay there, well we were pleasantly surprised, the rooms were perfect the beds were very comfortable, the staff were extremely friendly, central location. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Go on your own opinions not everyone elses”
Reviews.Author: Denise B
Reviews.Content: I was very worried about going to stay at this hotel because of all the negative comments on trip advisor. But my husband and I were very impressed with everything about the hotel, yes it could do with modernising but I could not find fault with any of the facilities we used. We had maid service daily, everything was clean, there was ample room for our clothes. The staff were very approachable and polite. The location was excellent, 5 minutes walk from Empire State Building, 10 minute walk from Time Square. If and when I get the chance to go to New York again I would definately choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The beds are a problem”
Reviews.Author: removeyourshoes
Reviews.Content: I had a room with two twin beds. Both beds were so mushy that I felt like I was going to roll off the side at night. The furniture was old and the room was pretty warn. The television was also old with poor reception. The bathroom had been renovated and was in good condition. The shower had very low water pressure. The room was too warm at night.

Reviews.Title: “First impression was that it looked tired and dirty”
Reviews.Author: Timmysmum
Reviews.Content: Arrived in the evening and was given room 766. Well I wanted to turn around and walk out, it looked cramped and very shabby. There was just room to walk around the bed but not if you put the cases on the floor. There was one set of drawers to put your clothes in but that was shut away in a cupboard with the ironing board and couldn't get at it. There were dirty handprints on the Walls, the curtains and nets looked filthy. I checked the bedsheets and at least they were clean, the bathroom was tiny but it was clean. We got the room changed the next day, this was better although was still grubby looking. The aircon was so noisy we could not use it. I would not return to this hotel I would go to one that is not so central and take notice of online reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay”
Reviews.Author: misskaty44
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September, and although we were always out and about, I felt that the room was a little bit small and basic. The staff were all in all friendly.However not too over friendly. Location wise it was just about right. Next time in New York I would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Great location”
Reviews.Author: Humphriesout
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights following a cruise. Fantastic location. Nice room, although if this was a superior, Im glad we didnt stay in a standard! Stefano on reception was first class and helpful and got us into our room by 9am on the first day. we asked to keep the room on for three hours before we left. We were quoted a half days rate!!! The bells on duty on the Monday,3rd Oct put our bags into a store but then acted like beggars for tips. Guys we were always going to tip you. You didnt need to go the extra 5000 miles with your requests.

Reviews.Title: “Everything fine but not internet”
Reviews.Author: Almireta
Reviews.Content: I got an early check in for free. The hotel's location is just perfect. The room I got was fabulous: big, super clean, full of amenities...and the view was unbelivable-The Empire States. The only thing was that they had told me that the hotel's wi-fi was free of charge, but it was not, it was super expensive!!! I did not tried the breakfast. The service was ok. In general everything was super good!

Reviews.Title: “Jolly Madison - Customer Service could be improved”
Reviews.Author: Kirby1981
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Jolly Madison Towers from 14 September for 5 nights. I travelled with 5 friends to celebrate my 30th birthday. The main reception looks nice apart from some of the furniture is a bit shabby. The staff on reception were ok but not overly friendly. The concierge/bellmen were friendly. The member of staff who booked our return taxi to the sirport was not very friendly and did not seem happy to have to call and arrange this. Our room was on the 7th floor which did not have great floors, The four others were on the 12th floor and had much better views. The rooms were quite small but perfectly adequate. The bathroom was nice but the rest of the room could have done with a bit of re-decorating. The air conditioning worked well but was noisy, The bar was good for happy hour with half price drinks but about the same price as other bars outside of this ($7 for fruit juice and $12 for vodka and orange). The barman who was there on our first two nights was really friendly and gave us good advice on where to go for food and drink. The barman who was on the other nights was not that friendly. The location of the hotel is excellent as is only 5 minutes walk from the Empire State Building and Grand Central Station. Times Square is only about 10 - 15 minutes walk. As for New York itself I loved it and would defintiely go back. Not sure if I would go back to this hotel as although the location is very good the reception staff and some of the bar staff could do with some customer service training.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but staff lacking in the customer service skills!”
Reviews.Author: Belfastgal1984
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the last leg of our honeymoon. Great location and the entrance is quite grand. However as we were checking in we overheard another couple complaining about the size of their room and how the pictures did not do them justice; we decided to make up our own minds. Our room was on the 4th floor, had two double sized beds and seemed to be clean enough. Yes its a bit shabby in places but it was ok for not being in the room much. Our problem was with a member of the reception staff who was quite rude when we had a problem.The maintenance staff were lovely and almost made up for the rudeness of the reception staff. Would recommend this hotel for budget sightseeing but dont expected to be treated well by the reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “A good New York option”
Reviews.Author: rabcaz007
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Jolly Madison for 4 nights at the early part of September. We'd read some of the reviews of the Jolly Madison and were a bit unsure of what to expect. The entrance is quite grand with a large marble staircase facing you as you enter. But beyond this, the overall first impression was disappointing with the hotel lobby being a bit shabby - the paintwork and furnishings need a bit of freshening up and the reception area in general being not very welcoming. The room was very small and even for two people, there was not a lot of room to move about and a lack of storage facilities. Again the bedroom decor was a bit shabby but the bathroom appeared to have been given a facelift recently and was very nice. The room was clean and was well serviced daily Some of the other bedrooms appeared to be larger and it is worth asking for a street view room if that is important. There is free broadband access in the rooms is you enquire about it. In general the rooms were fairly typical of those in other NY hotels we have stayed in with the exception of the size. The biggest problem we had with the room was that we struggled to get the air conditioning to cool the room down to any great extent. New York in September is very humid and this was a problem. Depite all of that, the hotel is in a fantastic location just a few minutes walk away from Grand Central station for the subways and about 10-15 minutes from Times Square. There are plenty of bars and eating places along 38th Street and Maidison and 5th Avenues. The 38th Street diner was full of locals which is always a good sign and was very good. If you are staying in your hotel room for any length of time in New York then you are not doing the city justice and for that reason the Jolly Madison is a perfectly adequate as a base. If decent value for money and a good location are your priorities, the the Jolly Madison fits the bill well. If you are looking for a bit more in the way of luxury then perhaps it would be worthwhile shopping around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Micklefielder
Reviews.Content: This is the third time that my wife and I have stayed at this hotel during the last two and a half years and I simply cannot understand some of the more negative reviews that are sometimes directed towards it. As a regular visitor to Manhattan, I think that you would be hard pressed to find many other hotels of a similar rating that can offer the same standards as well as being in the same location. On our previous stays here we have only ever had standard rooms. However, we've always found these rooms to be perfectly okay with excellent bathroom facilities. This time, though, we decided to upgrade to a de luxe room and it was absolutely superb. As far as the hotel staff are concerned, I cannot fault them. And that goes from the reception staff to the cleaners right down to the hotel porters, who are always cheery and willing to assist. And, I would like to take this opportunity to thank all of them for making us feel very welcome during all of our stays.

Reviews.Title: “A great budget option for doing exploring...”
Reviews.Author: Sara G
Reviews.Content: Came over from England in April 2011 to celebrate my partner's 30th birthday. When staying in Central Manhattan on a not enormous budget your options are a tad limited, as most of the hotels in central manhattan are 4 or 5 star. So you have a bit of a decision to make when you visit, which is either to use your money to stay in a really nice hotel out of central Manhattan and nearer JFK airport, or stay in a budget hotel like this one in the centre. Personally as we go on holiday to explore, central location was more important to us than the hotel per se. The location of this one for exploring really is brilliant, as you are only a few minutes away from various things, not least Grand Central station which is a huge bonus if you intend to travel around Mahattan a lot, as Grand Central is connected to nearly every Subway line. The hotel itself really is okay as well. The rooms are clean (if pretty small), but if you just want a base site to go off exploring from like us and don't intend to spend too much time in the hotel, then you shouldn't have any real issues. We only really used the staff to check-in / check-out but they were friendly and courteous when we did. As with many hotels though, they make their money back on extras like Wi-fi, phone calls, etc, so just be wary if you use these things. As for breakfast, it's not included in the cost of your room, and frankly the hotel charges silly prices for it if you want it for an extra. I recomend doing what we did and visit the diner across the road from the hotel instead, which has plenty of good value breakfast options. Overall though I'd definately recomend this to people who want a really central hotel and aren't too fussed about luxury extras.

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel. We'd stay again!”
Reviews.Author: potnoodlegirl
Reviews.Content: We weren't expecting much from all the negative reviews but we really enjoyed our 5 night stay (during Hurricane Irene!). The room was really large, on the corner of the building, with a view of Madison and 38th St. Despite this there was no traffic noise. Air con worked within seconds, staff were really friendly and polite, and the location was amazing. Bed huge and comfortable, with a large bathroom and good shower. What more could you want as a base?

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Decent budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bourgan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for six nights in August 2011. Check in/out was efficient. I found the hotel staff friendly and helpful. Hotel foyer is impressive but our room was very dated and the bedding old. The duvet had a cigarette burn on it. But the best thing about this hotel is the location. Five minutes walk from Times Square, Empire State Building and other attractions. Never used used the restaurant. There are good diners and restaurants around the hotel .Noise at night wasn't a problem. Overall the hotel was better than we expected and the price was excellent. .

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location!”
Reviews.Author: Jas310
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel recently. Having stayed at other hotels around Times Sqaure, we were very impressed with this hotel. The price was reasonable and the location was great. The rooms were not huge, but bigger than other NYC hotels we have stayed in. I would recommend this hotel and plan in staying there next time we visit the city.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: Higherlove
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself and the location (near grand central) are really great. The Staff unfortunately disappointed us when we had a small request (blowing 10 balloons in our room due to our wedding anniversary and sursprise my husband when we come back) but they had lots of excuses :( We had to call the front desk few times due to defective tv and a broken drain in the the bathtub.....but untill we left (after 14 nights), nothing much did change :( WORST EVER!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ripped a new one on parking - and more!”
Reviews.Author: BarryZ
Reviews.Content: We arrived in May, 2011 for our two day stay with a car for which we had committed to pay a daily parking fee of $37.00. Check-in was courteous. Bell service fine. The room was tiny, but that was as expected. The beds were worn out and hard, which wasn't really a surprise, either. Bathroom was similarly small, with a puzzling sheet of glass across half of the tub in lieu of a shower curtain. It worked exactly as you'd expect. Lone ice machine located on the fourth floor. Not much of an inconvenience, really. We got a good laugh perusing the room service prices. We knew it was New York, but we were still able to laugh at their obviously grandiose opinion of the value of their offerings. Luckily, there is a small grocery store around the corner in the same building for food, drinks, etc. and a really nice diner with reasonable (for New York City) prices right across the street. We wouldn't be eating their overpriced room’s service items or using their similarly overpriced breakfast buffet. Didn't try the bar. Can't say whether it is overpriced or not. We can, however use our imaginations. Air conditioner on one of the coolest Mays in record could barely keep the room comfortable. We felt sticky and uncomfortable most of the time that we were in the room. Fortunately, the instinct to flee the room at every opportunity kept us out of it for a good part of our stay. The hotel description mentions "city or courtyard views." Well we knew we didn't have a city view but "courtyard?" "Courtyard" must be Italian for "three dark walls and a rank of industrial air conditioners." A darker, more depressing scene would be hard to imagine. The complimentary shampoo and shower gel was colorful and effective. (The fruitiness of the flavors made me feel just like a lollipop after showering!) The bottles that I managed to cram into my suitcase are going to make great stocking-stuffers for Xmas, I'm sure. The big surprise came on check-out when they charged us not two, but FOUR DAYS of parking charges! The desk clerk said, “But you used your car.” Admittedly, I had for one day, in order to move my daughter’s things from her apartment to a storage facility. He explained that every time you use your car, you incur a NEW 24 hours of parking charges. (Indeed, buried in their web site is the language, “There are no in/out privileges. If you take your car out, the 24 hours starts over when you return.”) I accepted that policy, yet he couldn’t explain how the fourth parking charge was added to the bill. The more I inquired, the heavier his accent got until we simply couldn’t communicate. I paid the entire bill with my credit card and left, vowing never to return. To add further injury, when my credit card bill arrived, they had added another $49.00 in unexplained charges, which American Express had removed after disputing them. I’m used to small, dark, hot, uncomfortable accommodations in New York, but to have a series of continual charges added to your bill is more than even an out-of-towner ought to have to bear. Never again!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a 1 night stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: dana9880
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything I expected it to be. Its in a great location. 20 minute walk from Rockefeller Center/Radio City Music Hall. Less than that to Time's Square. Check in/Check out was easy. The lobby and entrance of the hotel is very nice. Our room was average. The bedspread definitely could stand to be replaced (iron burn on it). Peeling wallpaper. The room is just old fashioned but I honestly didnt expect much more. Ice machines only on the 4th floor. We went to the hotel bar for happy hour (1/2 priced drinks...still $6 each but its ny!). I really liked the bar...kind of haunted mansion like! Overall, I recommend this hotel for a 1 or 2 night place to sleep in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest!!”
Reviews.Author: jeneflower
Reviews.Content: My family has traveled extensively throughout the U.S., Europe and Asia and this is my worst experience with customer service ever. I rarely write reviews for hotels. In fact I have only written one other hotel review on trip advisor and it was a positive review, so this is significant. The hotel is dishonest. When we arrived we expected a four star hotel. It is not. They told us when we checked in that parking was $37 a day. They didn't say anything else about the parking. They also told us that they didn't have any adjacent rooms except for those right next to the street that were very noisy. Otherwise the rooms would be far apart. Since we had children we had to have them close together. After complaining about the noisy room they reluctantly admitted that they really did have two adjacent rooms on the 4th floor and they gave them to us. The rooms were OK nothing nice. But I was shocked when I went to my children's room in the morning to find the door wasn't locked all night. It was shut but it didn't auto lock! We found that we had to slam it shut hard to get it to lock. At the end of the 2 days we checked out on time, paid our bill with the 2 days parking and went outside to get the car from the valet. They told us that we had to walk down to the parking garage to get our car. We waited for at least 10 minutes and then they brought it to us. We had parked a Mazda 5 which is classified as a midsize wagon. We commented on a sign in the parking garage that listed 1 hr of parking $15 and discussed how ridiculous that price was for 1 hr. We went home. Later we received our credit card statement. There was an extra charge of $47 from this hotel. When I enquired about it they said that we had stayed 20 minutes over the allotted time in the parking garage and was therefore charged for a whole extra day of parking. I asked where it stated that and he told me that there is no information about this in the hotel room - the only clue is that on the valet ticket you get it says in small print at the bottom $37 for 24 hrs. parking plus $10 for SUVs. When I said we didn't park an SUV he said that the parking garage decided that it was an SUV. I asked why they didn't tell us about this at the time, why they didn't give us a receipt and an explanation at the time we picked up the car and he said there was no way they could do that after we had already checked out of the hotel. This does not make any sense to me- there was a cash register inside the parking garage. I believe that the whole business is underhanded and deceitful and I would never recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome everytime”
Reviews.Author: MMSenator
Reviews.Content: I usually spend several weeks in NY for business during the year and I always confirm my stay at Jolly Madison . De Luxe rooms are perfectly dressed with confortable size bathrooms . If you can choose est view rooms are very quite and in the morning the sun is on your room for a warm wake up . At the front desk the help of Deniz and the others Stefano ............ is always at their best . Do not forget to have breakfast in Hotel , real Italian Espresso guaranteed and european choice . Felice is always ready to help who doesn't speak a fluent English

Reviews.Title: “A Jolly Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Davidstandard
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and don't mind admitting that I was nervous, having never heard of it or stayed here before. After all, it was NYC and if you're not spending upwards of $250 - $300 a night for a room, you never can be sure of what you're going to get (small, dirty and bedbugs are all things that come to mind!). Plus, some of the reviews I'd read here about this place were less than flattering. However, I must say that I was pleasantly surprised and had a very enjoyable stay and experience here. The location is PERFECT. You're within a very short walking distance of the heart of midtown and the Times Sq/Theater District and all the attractions therein. The hotel itself, while not "fancy" was quite nice and well above average. I didn't eat there although they do offer a buffet breakfast. But there's lots of great (and no doubt cheaper) eating places close by. My room was on the 6th floor on the Madison Ave side. It was moderate sized and spacious; plenty big for one, and big enough for two. I had a very comfy kingsized bed. The furnishings were in great shape, the room was very clean and everything worked. There was a big desk and wireless internet access. The room was also quiet with virtually no street noise reaching the 6th floor (Madison Ave is not a huge or extremely busy street), and not a sound from the surrounding rooms. The bathroom was very nice--spacious, super clean with updated/modern appointments and lots of tile and stone surfaces along with a window facing Madison Ave too. The staff was efficient, helpful and friendly, although in all honesty I was a very low maintenance guest and so I had little interaction with them. I did have a car though and the hotel does offer valet parking. The $48/night charge (this included a $10 surcharge because I had an SUV) did raise my eyebrows. I did check with a couple-three public garages within a block or two of the hotel, and their rate for 24hrs was exactly the same as the hotel (including the $10 SUV surcharge), so I knew I wasn't being (additionally) ripped off. The only catch is that there's no in and out privileges, so each time you go out and come back, it's $48. Fortunately I needed my car only once in 2 days, so I didn't pay anything extra. But this was a really good hotel and an exceptionally good value for a prime (and safe) location in midtown Manhattan. I'd definitely stay here again, and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “good location, bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: my_hair_is_on_fire
Reviews.Content: my brother and i stayed here as it's in such a great location and is affordable (at least by new york standards). other than location, this place is definitely one to avoid. the beds were old and lumpy and the blanket was stained. our room faced onto the centre of the hotel, which meant less street noise. however, there was machinery (air conditioners?) noises all night and a bad smell when we opened the window. next time i'll definitely pay a little extra to avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in prime location at the right price”
Reviews.Author: MicknAnnDoncaster
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights, the hotel is in a great location, on Maddison Avenue,one block from Fifth Ave. It is only a ten minute walk to Times Square, and many popular locations and attractions. It is clean and staff are pleasant and helpful. However it is fair to say if you want to hold onto your room fro a few extra hours for a late flight they do try to rip you off ($100 for four Hours ). Needless to say my wife and I didnt bother. They do have internet access and wi fi but they do charge for the privelidge. Overall it was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: foxypear
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed at the Jolly Maddison and after the poor reviews were very surprised. The reception area is lovely, staff friendly and rooms though small (as are in all major cities) was clean and comfortable the only thing missing being tea/coffee facilities. The bathroom compared to other city hotel we have been to was very large and well equipped. The hotel is in a great location for easy access to lots of major attractions and would definately recommend to friends and family and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “ideal "no frills" base”
Reviews.Author: emmatabg7
Reviews.Content: the room was a good size, massive bed and kept nice and clean. tv had bad picture and absolutley no view from the window (except brick wall that is) which made you think it would be dank and overcast outside. the reception were fine, some more helpful than others but all in all it was all we needed as a base for exploring new york.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Terp477
Reviews.Content: The Jolly is a very solid hotel for New York standards. Rooms are clean and well-equipped. Bathrooms quite spacious and rather newly done. The breakfast buffet which was included in the price has been a good deal. Most importantly, the hotel is in a convenient location, close to 5th Avenue as well as Grand Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “clean and affordable”
Reviews.Author: rguthmil
Reviews.Content: the rooms are outdated but the location is great and the rooms are clean. staff is friendly and the hotel is in great shape for what you pay. Got this from Priceline name your own price and it was well worth the gamble. Within a few minutes of Grand Central Station and other great areas.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: DrMike28
Reviews.Content: There are some negative reviews of this hotel.They are wrong. It is ideally placed for walking around Midtown New York. I stayed with my adult daughter. Our room was a little small. The decor was dated . There was a view of a brick wall. However you don't spend much time in your room - it was clean, and thoroughly cleaned daily, everything worked, shame there was no kettle to make a hot drink in the room. the staff were all friendly and very helpful, especially Deniz on reception. If you want a plush hotel pay more money and sit in the hotel all day ! This was well run, there were no problems at all and I would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “dump of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: edsullivan86
Reviews.Content: This is a dump of a hotel and the elevator broke down the other night and a human being was on it. It is totally dangerous

Reviews.Title: “BETTER THEN WE THOUGHT”
Reviews.Author: jeanpole
Reviews.Content: Having read some reviews on this hotel before we went we were a bit worried. We book a twin room but on arrival we got a small double room. We were expecting a problem getting moved. But we found the staff friendly and helpful. They changed our room the next day to a much bigger room. The room was cleaned daily. The staff were great thoughout our stay. Thank you Jolly Madison.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on place to stay”
Reviews.Author: WandererPreston
Reviews.Content: You write it as you see it. Just can't agree with some of the reviews on here. Greeted in a friendly manner at the front desk and promptly upgraded from superior room to junior suite at no cost. Room everything we could wish for, huge bed and stunning bathroom. Position excellent, central for all we wanted to do and just a ten minute walk from our arrival point, Grand Central. Can't comment on food as we ate out using some of the wide choice of cages and restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: jack_presley
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights (13-14 April) and was apprehensive having read other people's reviews but I had no problems and had a nice comfortable stay. I was a travelling alone but was still disappointed to be put in a room with 2 single beds and not 1 double. The room size was adequate and clean and the bathroom looked as if it had been recently refurbished and I had no problems with hot water. The temperature in NY was such that I didn't need either air conditioning or heat so I don't know how easy it would have been to adjust the unit in the room. The staff were pleasant and I had no problems with them (despite not being Italian!!). They were quite helpful actually. I didn't eat in the hotel so I can't comment there but there was a sign for happy hour in the bar from 5-7pm. The location was quite good, only 4 blocks from Grand Central Station and 1 block from 5th avenue so quite central. No free wifi which is a big gripe of mine and there was no fitness centre which i knew beforehand but would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: GLASGOWGIRLIE4
Reviews.Content: Hotel was much better than expected. Location is excellent, pretty much central for everywhere. We had a room on the 12th floor, it was ok, bigger than expected. Shower was great, bed is massive - no bed bugs! The room could get really hot & the air-con was unbelievably loud but to be honest, we didnt spend that much time in our room except for sleep. The hotel is clean and our room was cleaned everyday, plenty of fresh towels also given. We didnt eat at the hotel as they were loads of cafes, etc nearby. We were worried about the hotel staff as we read they could be quite rude and not helpful but we never had a problem with them. If anything, we found them really helpful, particularly Stefano at the front desk who went out of his way to help us. Everyone we dealt with was great actually, we met so many helpful New Yorkers! We loved every minute of our trip to New York and would 100% stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Extemely Ignorant Staff”
Reviews.Author: Lennonpa
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through my travel agent and got a good deal. On our arrival I specifically asked not to be places beside the elevator ... and guess where they placed me? I was moved the next day after I insisted on it. But we had to carry our luggage up and down to the porters who not once offered ANY help. Our second room was fine, no concerns. The staff at the front desk are extremely rude and are always looking at their computer screens ensuring they look like they are busy. The give short answers and are in no way helpful at all with dead-pan looks on their faces at all times. Breakfast is a rip-off! Don't bother! Go to the diner across the street! Handy location & room was fine .... but staff? could do with alot more customer service training and perhaps engage in conversation with those of us who are NOT Italian (which they favour)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location, a lot of potential to improve!”
Reviews.Author: namth90
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal through the British Airways website with this hotel. The price was a lot better for B&B compared to hotels in a similar location. It's on what you could supposedly say is a 'quiet' corner of Manhattan, a couple of blocks away from 5th and a few hundred metres from Grand Central, so not right in the middle of everything, but well within walking distance! We had a standard room on the 7th floor which overlooked the entrance. It's a very dated room, with green patterned carpets and floral bedspreads, CRT television sets and a rickety air conditioning system. We both found it awkward that there was a fully transparent window in the shower looking onto the street, with no blind to pull down. A very strange design I would say. Breakfast was plentiful the next morning, although it became apparent that this hotel was very popular with Italians and all the staff seemed to favour and chat to the Italians much more than Brits like us and an Australian couple who we were sat in the corner with. The dining room and the entrance foyer are very grand might I add, but a bit plain and tatty in places. It would be really wonderful to see what a couple of interior designers could do with this place. We left our bags with the porter on our final day and he asked us if we would like to book a taxi to the airport, which we agreed to and it seemed a bargain at around $30 to JFK Terminal 7 compared to the $45 we had pre-booked with BA! Well, when we got back to the hotel and collected our bags, there was a black stretched limo waiting for us outside, which we found very amusing and quite a novelty. Not sure if this was actually arranged by the hotel or not, as the porter and driver seemed very friendly and of the same nationaility. He also took us on a hair raising detour from the highway of what I presume was Brooklyn, and got us to the airport 3 hour ahead of our flight, which was great, but I'm still not sure if this was an official taxi or not, and I would definitely book one at the front desk or grab one on the street like normal.

Reviews.Title: “Water doesn't go to corner rooms”
Reviews.Author: scoobyscout
Reviews.Content: AVOID this hotel at all costs. The photo shown above is not the basic room. The basic room we stayed in had exposed wiring over the air-con, heavily stained carpet and bedding. The blinds in the bathroom were broken and dangling and when we had no hot water two days in a row and phoned maintenance we were told hot water doesnt go to corner rooms. When we phoned and asked if we could use another room to shower we were told NO they were full.... However we discovered if you run the basin tap for a while you eventually get hot water in the shower... The toliet is very very noisey but the actual hotel is in a quiet area and no issue there. Location is great and plenty of corner shops nearby. Plenty of taxis around. But found staff rude and unpleasant. I do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Lost_Lisa
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a week stay in Jan 2011, We found the reception staff very helpfull, They couldnt do enough for you. One our arrival we had a room on the six floor, We did have to move rooms due to water leaking in bathroom. The reception brought another key up to us No Problem at all. The second room( little dark) was of a good size two double beds enough space for a three people. The only thing we found was there was No kettles in the room. We ask reception who did give us a kettle. Breakfast was good choice. Rooms was cleaned daily .Hotel very close to Times Square, Empire State, Ground Cental, macys, Hotel is very central. We are hoping to return to New York and stay in the same hotel. We didnt eat Dinner at the hotel we found a dinner just across the road which we used daily for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “great central location, standard rooms, clean”
Reviews.Author: SCHDorsetUK
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from stay at Jolly Madison. Was a little concerned about stay after reading previous reviews about the hotel but have to say it was fine and no bed bugs! :)) Positives: Clean room, sheets and towels changed daily. Very good location, we found it easy to walk to most attractions. Very close to Empire State and Grand Central Station. Found lovely diner for breakfast just round corner called Blooms Delicatessen and Restaurant - great atmosphere, very american :) Negatives: Room bit dated, but hey you pays your money and takes your choice! for the price it was good, esp considering location. We had minor prob with shower and heating but these were dealt with and resolved straight away. Staff could appear kurt/blunt at times but felt this was just the New Yorker's way. Had a great trip, thought NY fab - recommend Empire State, Staten Island Ferry - free! and walk over Brooklyn Bridge - wow! great views, great structure.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: swdweeb
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as it was very close to our meeting location and appeared to be a good value. We paid $119 plus taxes. The person at the front desk acted put out that we arrived and spoke poor English. The television service in the hotel was not functioning the first night of our stay. Hot doesn't even begin to describe the temperature of the rooms. We each tried the air conditioners in our rooms , at night, in January... they didn't work. The bedding was worn thin. I had a FedEx delivery scheduled to arrive but I had to leave before my expected departure and before the delivery. When I asked the front desk (another person) if they could leave a note to have the delivery given to my remaining colleagues I was told that I would have to call the day time manager. He couldn't take or leave a message. Breakfast is a criminal $22 for rolls and coffee. The internet is provided separate from the hotel, I was afraid to check the price of it. You couldn't pay me to go back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “If you get a duluxe room your flying”
Reviews.Author: Smca1711
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived we were given a room on the 6th floor, the room wasnt a bad size but the radiator didnt work and the room was just full of electricity as the sparks from the bed clothes proved, you'd have thought we were at a disco. Every time i tried to turn a light on i got an electric shock. We went to reception the next morning and got upgraded to the 14th floor for an extra $50 a night which i didnt mind having to pay as the difference between the room on the 6th floor and the 14th floor well you would think it was a different hotel. It was very modern and the bathroom was lovely, the last 4 nights of our stay had no upsets So if your staying at this hotel id advise you to pay the extra for a duluxe room because its worth it!

Reviews.Title: “overall average stay”
Reviews.Author: confusedtraveller2
Reviews.Content: everything about this hotel is average even down to its location. Staff were polite, rooms were small but what you would expect for the price. If I were to choose again I would probably prefere somewhere closer to times square, although its only about a 15-20 min walk away. Seems to have mainly Italian guests but this didn't influence our stay. This was part of our honeymoon which was on our booking, however, this wasn't acknowledged either.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay”
Reviews.Author: Paradise_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I bought this on Priceline and having read the very negative reviews, did not know what to expect. The only negative was the tiny size of the room -- I have been in smaller rooms but not often. The positives were: pleasantly renovated clean room, excellent front desk service and location. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money and don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: traveler14609
Reviews.Content: My stay at The Jolly Hotel Madison Towers was disappointing. After reading some of the more recent reviews, I was hesitant about my reservation at this hotel. I decided to give the hotel the benefit of the doubt and just wait to see for my self when I arrived. These are my overall thoughts after staying there: I would NEVER pay full price to stay at this hotel. I booked the hotel through priceline, and I got a pretty good deal. Anyway, the room was small and worn. Noise traveled through the halls and walls of my room as if there were no walls. Just because I booked my trip through priceline, I felt like the staff took full advantage of that fact and overlooked any bit of customer satisfaction. The woman that checked me in was discourteous and argumentative. I originally asked for a room away from the elevators. When we got up to our room, it ended up being directly behind the elevators. So, I went back down to the desk to ask for another room. The woman insisted that the original room wasn't "next to" the elevators (meaning to the right or to the left of it). I was trying to politely explain that it was still near the elevator, but she continued to argue that it wasn't "next to" the elevators. Honestly, I felt like I was back in elementary school bickering with a stubborn little girl who always got her way! It was ridiculous! What ever happened to the idea that "the customer is always right?" We did end up getting another room, which I was thankful for and glad the woman at the desk was able to accommodate me in that way. On the positive note (and pretty much the only one I really have for this hotel), the hotel is in a GREAT location! So close to many NYC attractions and the subway line.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not worth the price and would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: sansommum
Reviews.Content: Really good location but that's probably the only positive. Rooms small, which wasn't too much of a problem but not worth the price paid. We had TV problems and had to call the front desk 3 times before they sent an engineer. Then the shower made a terrible knocking noise (pipes) so we had to move rooms (as they had to turn off the water supply to that floor to fix the problem). We went to a nicer and bigger room but once packed up had to wait at least 40 mins to move when they told us it would be 5 mins and that the porter would help with bags etc. We had to call the front desk and were told a couple of times that the porter had gone to the wrong room! Biggest complaint was that under the facilities this hotel offered a sauna and steam room, which was a big factor in us choosing this hotel, but on arrival found out that you had to have a $90 massage to get a sauna! We offered to pay just to have a sauna but they said no - talking about cutting your nose off to spite your face! When we challened reception they said the Spa wasn't connected to the hotel, but after asking why was the facilities advertised as part of the hotel the duty manager laughed in my husbands face! We couldn't believe it! We've been to the states a lot and never experienced such service.
