We found the front desk staff very rude, whereas the other staff expecially the porters were fantastic, they really went our of their way to help us- the Italians on the front desk were not nice. We visit New York every year but there's no way we'd stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wow...”
Reviews.Author: HalGOlathe_Kansas
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old, the rooms are small, the price is high, there's no coffee maker in the rooms, there's dust in the corners. The first room I was in the toilet didn't work until after maintenance came three times. The TV did not work on most of the channels and the staff said "We just don't get those." Then I ask why was it working when the night staff came up to look at it? The room I was in had a burn mark from a lamp on the ceiling. Housekeeping made the bed and the blanket had a giant stain near the top (it's important to note I had to REQUEST the blanket). If you can avoid this hotel, please do so.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff..... Dreadful rooms”
Reviews.Author: 1sensibletrader
Reviews.Content: We had a double room booked via Airmiles for my partners 40th Birthday. Prior to arrival I sent several emails asking about the availability of Airport Transport and the potential purchase of a bottle of champagne prior to arrival. I did not receive an email back having re sent them a couple of times. I rang twice at a 'business hours time' only to be transferred and on hold without reply on two (very expensive calls) occasions. On arrival after a 16 hr journey we were told our room was not available for a further hour as it had not been cleaned. So our room was not available till 1500 hrs. Room 1253 overlooked an interior brick wall, the air condition unit was extremely noisy and the furniture was simply old and of poor quality. Draw handles were broken whilst the carpets were very worn. The bathroom had been refurbished to an adequate standard but nothing special. Within the room we had a hand written note left wishing my partner a happy birthday....nothing more. There was no basic tea/coffee facilities within the room. On checking out we were charged for three drinks from the room bar which we had never had and a number of telephone calls which were not connected. In conclusion the room for our three night stay was very expensive for the standard received. It is important to state that the staff were extremely helpful, with good recommendations and advice. This is a tired hotel with some minimalistic modernisation.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value if booked off hotwire, priceline or travelocity”
Reviews.Author: jodywhite89
Reviews.Content: So i stayed here from october 25th to october 28th. The rooms are very small and outdated but the beds are comfortable. The bathrooms are small, but modern looking. The staff at the front desk are helpful and dont mind answering of your questions. The drawback is that there are no in room safes, but just a safe at the front desk. If you lose your key I think they charge you 100$. Internet is also available in the lobby. Also the elevators are a little slow. Overall I had a good experience here. The hotel was in a good location, and didnt have bed bugs when I WAS THERE (some reviews said it did). Dont expect a five star hotel, it is far from that, but its just a place to sleep, so I would recommened this hotel if you dont plan on spending your whole trip in the hotel (which you shouldnt, your in NYC ! :)). Hope this is helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to lay your head after an amazing day out”
Reviews.Author: Shona_Nic
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean, comfortable and welcoming. Staff assisted you if you needed it but did not push themselves onto you so you could really enjoy your stay. Location was ideal to get out and about in the city. Had read some disappointing reviews on TripAdvisor prior to going which left us a bit concerned but much to our delight they proved to be so very wrong. Definitely would stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Beware....”
Reviews.Author: ladygent
Reviews.Content: Had pre-paid for a twin bedded room as we were two friends travelling together. No twin rooms available on arrival (surprise, surprise) and the hotel was overbooked. We were offered wholly unacceptable alternatives on what can only be described as a 2* floor in a supposed 4* hotel. Needless to say we paid for an upgrade to a deluxe double double room, since we were given no other acceptable alternative, which was perfect but of course an unexpected expense. The trouble with a hotel room prepayment is that there is very little incentive to make sure the customer is happy. The staff were incredibly unhelpful with no evidence of " a combination of the warmth and elegance of Italian style" - just unacceptably rude Italian staff!

Reviews.Title: “A basic no frills hotel in good location.”
Reviews.Author: flurokitty
Reviews.Content: On arrival the taxi driver was unable to pull up to the hotel due to the road works outside but managed to drop us at the corner. We checked in and the front desk staff were nice enough but did tell us that we had got a really small room and there was nothing we could do to change it even if we wanted to pay more as they were fully booked. Now we were expecting a small room having stayed at tourist hotels in New York before so it didn't alarm us but when we asked about the free Wi-Fi we were told there was no free service and that it was 10 dollars a day (when we booked it said free Wi-Fi) he decided to throw it in though because in his words we had got a "sucky room". We got our room keys and headed up to our room on the 11th floor, at no point did anyone offer to take our bags no big deal as we only had carry on but I have never not been asked at a hotel before. We got to the room and to be honest it was far better than we were expecting you could walk easily all the way around the bed (we had a smaller room at the New Yorker) and the bathroom looked like it had been redone recently and all the fittings were nice. Basic is they only way to describe the room. There is a mini bar but it is locked and I believe you had to ask for the key. This meant no fridge and as a British tourist there are no tea/coffee making facilities which I found unusual. The toiletries were ample plus iron, ironing board, hairdryer and I am happy to report there were no bed bugs (we checked as soon as we got into the room) The main problem was the construction which happens at night right outside the window which makes it difficult to sleep even with earplugs. Housekeeping was good also the room always looked clean and tidy when we returned at the end of they day. We had breakfast in the room at $58 for 2 ($22 per peron plus tax and service) which was nice enough but not quite value for money although it came on time. Coffee, orange juice and some pastries is what you got anything else was extra it would have been nice if they had included some yoghurt or fruit. Checking out was easy also except when they tried to charge us for a bottle of water from the locked mini bar and we were told that left luggage costs a tip to the guy that tags your bag which is fine but I would rather they just charge as I am never sure how much to tip someone for putting a sticker on your bag and putting on a shelf. We were asked what time we were coming back and they guy asked us to tip him then because he would have gone by then. When we collected out bag they didn't offer to call us a taxi and when we asked about the shuttle bus to the airport they didn't know what we were talking about which is bad as it goes from round the corner. Pros Location - it is close to everything Clean Cons Noise Basic - room, shower and TV is all your getting for your buck

Reviews.Title: “Good location but expensive restaurant”
Reviews.Author: AeroScotland
Reviews.Content: The Jolly madison is in quite a good location a few blocks from 5th Avenue and you could walk to time square. the rooms were an ok size for price and clean. the restuarant staff were a little standoffish which put us off a little and you were only allowed one cup of coffee with breakfast which for toast and bacon and 1 breakfast cost £24 much better service in cafe accross the road . A couple of the staff were very helpfull others stayed out of the reception area talking.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, ok rooms.”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaGril83
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our trip on priceline.com and only paid $150/night which was less than half of the listed price for that weekend. For what we paid, I was pleased with the hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The bathrooms looked like they had recently been remodeled and were very nice, however, the rooms themselves were pretty dated and could use a remodel. The room was comfortable enough for the little time that we spent in it. The hotel is in a very convenient location, just a short walk to Grand Central and you can be anywhere in the city within minutes. Overall I would recommend this hotel to a friend if they got a good deal. Also, the candy at the front desk was very tasty :)

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment...”
Reviews.Author: carvalhorik
Reviews.Content: We were on the NH Hotel Jolly Madison Towers from the 30th Septmeber until the October 6th, and our expectations were high. However: - The staff of hotel (reception) weren't very helpful, because when we asked about some infos of the city, the 1st thing they do is to try to sell us the differents tours around the city (that aren't that special!!!) The infos they gave us were very vague and really not worth it. - The room wasn't clean. If you pay a price like this for a superior room you don't expect to have a room with a mole smell, curtain dirty, the floor with dust, windows that don't close correctly (the city has road works in front of the hotel from 8pm - 4am), you just can't sleep or rest with windows like that. - However, it's located in a great spot close to 5th Avenue and some blocks away from Times Square. In conclusion, we had high expectations, but ended to be a disappointment (we moved to other hotel for the last 3 nights! Not worth the money you pay for! if you need any add info, email us, we'll be able to help anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Camera Buia e Sporca da fare disgusto anche alla donna delle pulizie; Dark and Dirty to disgust also the cleaning lady”
Reviews.Author: anna_sempreviva
Reviews.Content: October 1st -3rd The room 602 was at the 6th floor looking at a courtyard. Ok we had only to sleep... but something went behind the bed and I have found hair, a dead bittle and all around the room wall on the floor there was a stripe of dirty dust. In the bathroom there were hair everywhere. We called the front desk and they sent a cleanig lady that was angry and disgusted as well. She did a good job, we gave her 5 $. The day after we complained at the desk and the guy said...But now it is clean is it not? I am Italian and the Jolly is an Italian chain, it is full of Italians most of them can not spak english therefore it is alway full and so the direction I believe do not care. My colleagued (danish) choosed that because believed in the Italian Style..........

Reviews.Title: “Decent but not really value for money”
Reviews.Author: CPH73
Reviews.Content: I got the room at $165 plus taxes through priceline which I found very expensive - thus the relatively low score. The standard of the room was a lot lower than usual US three-star standard, but I guess that's NYC.... The room was very small but decent and clean and with a nice bathroom. Internet should definately have been free!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price hotel”
Reviews.Author: Neil1969_8
Reviews.Content: Initial impressions of the Hotel weren't great with our small room with minimal daylight due to it facing into the courtyard. However it was clean and comfortable and the lack of a view was made up for being much quieter than a stret facing room, albeit our A/C unit made racket. All in all a good hotel for the price in New York, luxury it is not but you'll need to pay much more for that.

Reviews.Title: “a first class hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: derek135
Reviews.Content: great service,but the room could have been a wee bit bigger.The hotel is right in the centre of all the big sights.

Reviews.Title: “The rooom/hotel was run down and the staff didn't even greet us at check in.”
Reviews.Author: rwmccaffrey
Reviews.Content: Upon check in the front desk person didn't even say hello, they just stared at me until I said my name and that I was checking in. The room was extremely small even for a NY hotel. When asked if we could change rooms we were told that bookings through third parties generally got last choice rooms. The rooms and overall condition of he hotel were run down and in disrepair. Priceline rated this hotel as having 3.5 stars. What a joke. I wouldn't give it two stars based on the condition of the property and the lack of price value. If it weren't for its location this property would have a difficult time staying in business.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs - stay away”
Reviews.Author: bluetravels8
Reviews.Content: Went there - 4 nights, came home with bed bugs. This has cost us $4000 and counting. Spend the extra money and stay somewhere else. Also our toilet didn't work the whole time, and I asked for it to be fixed twice a day. They finally came to look at it the one time I said "please come in an hour, but not now".. instead they came 'now' and disturbed us twice.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in an above average location”
Reviews.Author: ianmc99
Reviews.Content: Firstly, we booked this hotel through the priceline bidding process and received this one after adding the ESB zone. We ended up with a rate of $130 + taxes for a mon-thurs 3 night stay in the middle of a busy summer week. The front desk check-in was quick and efficient. They took my credit card and did a pre-authorization of $25/night in case I incurred any charges. The check-in was efficient and we arrived a bit early but we were able to check-in no problem. Elevators were small but were pretty quick and were not a problem during our trip. We were placed on the 7th floor in a room directly behind the elevator. The green carpet was cheesy but after the reviews I was expecting astroturf. I didn't really care. We were expecting a small room so it wasn't a big deal when we saw it. We got a queen bed which was okay for us. The main room had some dirty mud spots on the carpet. The bed was indeed a bit saggy but we never seemed to mind too much. Make sure you tuck the mattress cover underneath the bed because if you move around in your sleep you may expose the dirty mattress. The television was really bad, it had really bad ingress on the lower channels and the remote never controlled the tv volume or power on/off. Again we only watched tv early morning or late at night, so not a big deal. The air conditioner did a good job of cooling the room however it occassionally had a grinding or electrical noise coming out of it randomly. You do need to watch the shower as water can indeed go everywhere. On the flip side, there was good pressure out of the showerhead. We had a room away from madison avenue facing a brick wall so outside noise was not a problem..we definitely preferred this. There were NO BED BUGS. We were a bit nervous going to sleep our first night to see if we would wake up with bites. The room service was good, the maid replaced the towels that we threw in the tub. There was no free wi-fi which sucked, they have a computer in the front lobby at a rate of $3.95 for 15 minutes. We had to use this to pick our seats for our flight. The location was definitely the hotel's best feature. 5 minutes to grand central, empire state and about 15 minutes to times square. The moonstruck cafe on the corner has a really good for breakfast. We didn't even go into the hotel's restaurant. We were satisfied with the hotel as it was clean and quiet. Overall the hotel is probably a 2* but the location was an important feature for us . I would only book this through a priceline or hotwire type website where you can get a good rate. If you are never going to hang out in your room then this is the perfect hotel for you. If you expecting some luxurious room and amenties...dream on.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 3*”
Reviews.Author: cixelsyd
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel through priceline (3* in the empire state building area), and found out that my accepted bid price was the same as the quotes given by the hotel website. We were made nervous by the mixed reviews, and actually called ahead to try to get a standard room on one of the higher floors, so as to avoid the dreaded shabby box that's reserved for priceline travelers on the 9th floor right next to the elevator. The lady I spoke to on the phone was friendly, and promised us a standard king room on the 14th floor. However, we were told at check-in that no standard rooms were available except on the 9th floor. Right away, I knew that they were trying to put us in the infamous "priceline room". To avoid this, one tip to priceline travelers: ask for a room AWAY from the elevators. This is what we did, and our request was honored. We ended up with a king bed room one room away from the elevators. The room itself was small and tired, and bedding looked worn. TV was antiquated, and the furniture must have been there for more than 30 years. However, the bathroom was recently renovated, and, albeit small, somewhat befitting of a 2.5*-3* hotel. Of course, I expected all of this based on the tripadvisor reviews, so that may have eased my disappointment. I accidentally injured my toe and had some bleeding from under the nail. My wife went down to ask for some bandages, but apparently there was no first aid kit at the front desk. You would think that's a basic requirement for a 3* hotel. We were able to sleep ok, once we got used to the noisy AC. We tipped the maid everyday, but still had to ask for new towels on one occasion when she just re-hung the used towels. The location was very good, which is the prime reason for my recommending this hotel to travellers. It's a 5 minute walk to Grand Central, and a few blocks away from the ESB. If you can get this hotel for under $140 per night, I'd say go for it and lower your expectations to fit a 2*-2.5* hotel. If you already booked here, don't panic. You'll be fine as long as you don't plan on hanging out in your hotel room all day.

Reviews.Title: “How did this hotel get its 3-star rating?”
Reviews.Author: Othello491
Reviews.Content: I booked my room on Priceline, so I understood the risks of not knowing which hotel I would get. I've had good experiences in the past with Priceline's rating guide, and I've found them to be quite accurate. The Jolly Madison Towers was certain the exception. The whole hotel from the elevators to the hallways to the rooms themselves felt drab and dreary. While everything was adequately clean, I got the sense that the hotel was on its last legs. Check-in was smooth and the hotel staff were quite friendly. My room, however, left a lot to be desired. It was small, but that wasn't a problem. I expect tiny hotel rooms in New York. It was dark and one of the lights didn't work (but the hotel fixed it quite quickly). The bathroom didn't have a shower curtain, so if you weren't careful, water would go everywhere. The air conditioning unit was very loud. If I had paid $50/night for this room, I wouldn't have had a problem, but I paid $150/night with taxes. While I know that $150 is pretty good for New York, I would have expected something that wasn't so tatty.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: vegmeg
Reviews.Content: I got a room at the Jolly Madison on Priceline about 2 months before our trip to NYC. The reviews were very mixed, but I hoped for the best. The lobby area is very nice looking, however check in took about half an hour due to a long line of customers. We were told we were being "upgraded" when I checked in. So was the guy in front of me, and the one next to me. If what we got was an upgraded room I would be frightened to see a regular room. There are signs in the lobby stating you can also upgrade to another room for $50... and the photos of the rooms look a lot nicer than what we got, so that might be something worth considering, and we may have done it had they not been booked the night we were staying. We walked off the elevator and were met with THE shabbiest looking green carpet I have ever seen in my life. That was the first clue that something was up. We walked down a tiny hall to our corner room. It was tiny. Really tiny. Like, we could barely walk around the bed to the bathroom, and the desk, chair, tv stand etc were all way too large for the space. The chair was covered in crumbs. The bed was lopsided. The air conditioner was horridly loud (but at least it worked). The tv was ancient. The bed had only thin sheets and a worn, sticky feeling comforter. Internet is super expensive. Our room faced Madison Ave, which is currently being worked on between 4pm and 8:30am every night. Their was loud construction ALL NIGHT LONG. We asked about switching rooms, but they had nothing else available. I could literally hear the street sounds through my earplugs and we were on the 9th floor, with the windows closed, and the loud air conditioner on. I would avoid this hotel if possible. Honestly, I would rather stay at a hostel than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate at the Priceline reduced rate”
Reviews.Author: Skidrowe3
Reviews.Content: Using the Priceline.com bidding system, my husband & I ended up at the Jolly Madison for $160/night, both weeknights. (I would guess that, for weekends, they might go lower. Priceline categorizes the Jolly Madison as 3 stars, and it is in Priceline's "Empire State Building Area.") We were nervous because we had never heard of the hotel and it had some poor reviews. In the end, it was fine. Not stylish, not fresh, but adequate. For starters, no bedbugs and the mattress was reasonably firm. The AC unit worked properly. The bathroom appears to have been redone relatively recently and thus was fresher & cleaner feeling than the room. The room wasn't especially small, for New York at least, and ours, which faced into a dark inner court, was quiet. (As of this writing, utility work is ongoing in Madison Avenue directly in front of the hotel. Work is AT NIGHT -- 8:30pm-4:30am -- and seems to involve a lot of jackhammers. A sign at the check-in desk indicated that the work should take 6 months and be finished in July, 2010. We were there in August, and the work appeared far from completed.) Note that the hotel's website (under "Rooms") first shows "Deluxe" rooms with gorgeous photos of chic, light-filled suites. You get this only at the premium price level. The rest of the rooms -- most of those in the hotel -- are like ours was. Scroll down to "Standard" rooms and you'll see a photo of the type of room we stayed in. Ignore the peppy flowers in the foreground and you'll see a perfectly okay, low-design room. The east side location is reasonably convenient. For me personally, as a tourist visitor, the west side, with its numerous subway lines and attractions, is preferred. But the Jolly Madison's proximity to Grand Central Station is terrific, and we visited the lovely Morgan Library for the first time because it's just a block down Madison Avenue. We ended up doing Internet work over our iPhones because the hotel's Internet rate is a usurious $10/hour.

Reviews.Title: “Good value if booked off Travelocity or Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: jodyw89
Reviews.Content: The Room - Small and clean, but definitely shows signs of wear and tear. The Bathroom - Extremely small, not a lot of room to maneuver around. The shower has a glass that covers the bath about 3/4 of the way so no shower curtain. But it is extremely clean and has a nice look to it. Location - The location was good. It was very close to times square and the empire state building. Its a good place if you want to go sight seeing. THE POSITIVES - the room was clean, there was no bed bugs -the tv had some good channels -the air conditioner worked extremely well -good location -internet available in the lobby (for a little extra) -the safety deposit boxes in the lobby (free) THE NEGATIVE - the maid actually turned off the air conditioner on one of the hottest days in the summer and opened the window!!!!!! -the fire alarm went off in the morning because the water heater broke and then the water was turned off , so no showers, no toilet and couldnt brush teeth (not sure how long this lasted for because I was checking out that day) - the elevators were slow and tiny - the view from my room was another brick wall - staff could have been friendlier This review is based on the fact that I spent about 130 Canadian dollars a night for a standard room with tax included. Overall it was a good experience and I would stay there again for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Surprise”
Reviews.Author: 420Traveler
Reviews.Content: When traveling, I like to look at myself as a realist. When I put a bid in for a NYC hotel for $100, I know that I'm not going to be staying at a luxury hotel. I get what I pay for. So after having my bid accepted for a $100 a night for two nights, I didn't want to have unrealistic expectations. Upon checking in, I asked to see the room or have a choice of rooms. The attendant seemed puzzled by this so I ask her if there were any upgrades available. I was moved from a standard room to a deluxe room for $50.00 a night. Though I never saw a standard room, the deluxe room was a pleasant surprise. My room (1755) was on the 17th floor and a corner room with three windows ... including one in the bathroom. My room faced E. 28th and Madison and I loved the view. The room also had some character, including a large bathroom with tub/shower and a little "nook" in the room that that had two carpeted stairs leading to it. I enjoyed my morning coffee there while I decided my daily plan. Though the room did have some signs of wear (marks from luggage, etc.) it was a delight and I fell in love with it. There were only a few rooms (six I think) on the 17th floor. This was the top floor and I would recommend staying higher if possible. There is a water main being repaired from 8:00 PM until 4:30 AM each day, though the air conditioning system blocked that out and I wasn't interupted. I was interupted by the housekeeping staff that talked loudly and we opening and shutting doors, but it was after 8:00 AM. In conclusion, I would definitely stay here again. There appears to be two hotels in one, which travelers should be aware of. The bottom floors are standard rooms and the top floors are deluxe rooms. You will notice this when the elevator opens as the carpeting color is different. Four elevators are available and rarely had to wait. There is a bar, which has a nice happy hour from 5-7 with 1/2 priced cocktails. Loved that! The service at the hotel wasn't poor. They weren't overly friendly, but weren't rude either. I've been treated like royalty at other hotels, but this hotel keeps things low keyed. This didn't bother me, but others might want the red carpet rolled out when they arrive followed by a glass of wine ... that just won't be the case here. I was disappointed in the doorman though. I never say him helping anyone with luggage or opening and closing the door. Wasn't really sure of his purpose. Subway is about a ten minute walk. Grand Central in about 5 blocks north where you can catch the S, 4, 5, and 6. The 33rd station is located about 5 blocks south where you can catch the 6 train. If you prefer a close subway line, you may want to look elsewhere. I hope this review has helped you. It's honest and from my heart. Give the Jolly Madison a try!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay, but not great”
Reviews.Author: MarkLBoston
Reviews.Content: The neighborhood is upscale but not New York's finest, and this hotel is the same. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The room was moderate size, clean, and adequately furnished, although there's some apparent wear. Twin beds were quite small and not the most comfortable of mattresses. Powerful A/C chilled one of the summer's hottest days. Old, small TV worked but not well, with a small channel selection that did include HBO and stations from Europe and Japan. Gleaming clean bathroom with nice array of toiletries. The desk chair was too close to the floor, making me feel like a kid at the adult's table. $10/day wifi was already my biggest annoyance, and it only worked on one item: since I logged on my laptop I couldn't use my iPad. I'm deducting one star for that alone. The Italian ownership has influences everywhere: most notices are written in English and Italian, and it's interesting to hear it spoken all over the hotel. Nice neighborhood: a short walk to Bryant Park and Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, really small room for two”
Reviews.Author: JAFINDLAY
Reviews.Content: New York needs every space but the Hotel room we had was really small and the air conditoning unit balanced on the window which didn't look too safe. Our Hotel had older resident's staying there as their home. One lady used to sit in the Foyer with her Nurse, they appartently stay there through rent control and cannot be moved from the hotel. I found it to be quirky it felt like being among real New Yorkers, the Hotel was very Italian, the staff and alot of the guests. The room was kept clean and it was the best bed I have slept in and had a really good sleep. The hotel was right in the center of everything and the Diner across the block on the left was great for breakfast, alot of locals had their coffee there. All in all the Hotel was small in the rooms but that's what we expected. The Hotel forgot to order our Cab for taking us back to the Airport and they laid on a limo what a way to leave New York in a Black stretch Limo . My children were over the moon

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless at the Jolly. We requested a...”
Reviews.Author: flylady114b
Reviews.Content: Sleepless at the Jolly. We requested a king sized bed and we were offered two full size beds. Bad start. Wait, it gets better. We were told no kings available. I guess they clearly saw how dissapointed we were, so, they offered an upgrade to a junior suite. We thought, ok, that's nice. The junior suite consisted of three chairs and a desk. And, we did get a king sized headboard, but a very very saggy QUEEN sized mattress. Wait, it gets better. We hear this noise outside like a train, but, no trains on surface streets on Madison Ave. We look out the window and see large steel plates. We begged for another room, offered to pay more and we were told, sorry, sold out. So, we go to dinner and as we returned, we saw large construction equipment outside our window. It will go on all night. What dissapointed us about this hotel, no one told us about this when we made the reservation or when they gave us the room. As far as the room goes, it does not look anything like the website. So, we give it thumbs down.

Reviews.Title: “No bells and whistles but it was worth the price and we would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: JCJ_07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are avid travellers and have stayed in 1 star establishments as backpackers to 5 star resorts and boutique hotels. For an impromptu trip to NYC for four nights, we knew we would have some difficulty in finding a great hotel for a great price in the middle of summer/tourist season in the Big Apple. After scouring for the best deal on several discount websites (I have used almost all in the past in some form or another), we ended up getting a really good deal on Travelocity's new blind bidding service. We ended up getting the Jolly Hotel. The reviews that I read prior to going were fair and here's what I can add to them: The Up Side: 1. The location is amazing. You are a five minute walk from Grand Central, a fifteen minute walk from Times Square and have Bryant Park, Herald Square and many midtown attractions very close by. 2. The room was clean, the linens fresh and the turn down service spot on. 3. Air conditioning was a little noisy but it ended up becoming white noise to my husband and I. With all the noise you get in NYC and the regular noise you get while staying in most properties, I do not see how the AC noise could be chalked up as a problem. 4. The staff were courteous and helpful with directions and a late limo to the airport! 5. The bathroom was just as nice as any other bathroom we have had in similar properties. The shower had great pressure. The floor and tiling were clean, new and trendy. 6. The room was not cramped. We had plenty of space for luggage, walking around and relaxing in the room. 7. We got what we paid for. If you are looking for 3.5 star hotel in Manhattan, I would not say this is it. However, I would say that this property is a 3 star and was worth the price we paid for it. At the end of the day, my husband and I knew that NYC is a city to be explored so unless you are there for business, you are probably not spending much time in your room! The Down Side: 1. The hallway was dated with green turf carpeting. This did not really bug me but it may be of concern to others. 2. Our TV's "box office" was out of service. Nevertheless, house staff offered to fix it for us. 3. Our bed was a little on the soft side and caved in. We advised the front desk of this and they took down our complaint. 4. No free WiFi. However, McDonald's, Pret a Manger and Starbucks are a two minute walk from the property and all have free WiFi. I would definitely recommend this hotel. We did not go for the upgrade even though we thought we would need it after reading the reviews. We walked in to our room and were pleasantly surprised as we had scared ourselves after all the bad reviews. Bottomline: We enjoyed our stay and if you are not too picky, you will, too!

Reviews.Title: “Go for the deluxe room and NOT the standard or sales rate!!!”
Reviews.Author: Phyl_intheCity
Reviews.Content: My sister got us our room through PRICELINE and was amazed at the $120.00 per night rate. Well we discovered the reason for the rate - green outdoor carpeting in the hallways and room, a very very small room with twin beds and no room to move and a shower that was coming out of the wall!! Also there wasn't a fridge but something the concierge said would keep things cool but not cold. And no safe in the room so you had to use a safety deposit box in the lobby and would be charged 100 US if you lost the key! To say we were disappointed was an understatement. The Whaler Bar is also a HUGE disappointment with threadbare chairs and carpeting and no one present. However our experience changed when we upgraded our room through the helpful concierge Denise. It meant paying an additional $100.00 US a night but we couldn't get over the difference. Our room was huge with a modern bathroom with a tub and shower stall, our double beds were incredibly comfortable and there was recess lighting, a functioning fridge and TV and huge console. Closet space was also not a problem and we were provided with a huge array of products in the bathroom as well as fluffy robes and slippers. Also a safe inside our room. So I recommend that if you're going to book here pay the more expensive rate as you'll be sorely disappointed if you choose the cheap rate!

Reviews.Title: “Far from "boutique" - decent room - shame about the wifi”
Reviews.Author: NMcPhillips
Reviews.Content: The hotel's facebook page calls it a "boutique" hotel. This is false advertising! There's nothing "boutique" that I can see about it. It's just a standard hotel with a slight Italian touch. On top of that, I'm paying about US$250 a night and I still have to pay extra for wifi! If I want wifi for my phone AND my laptop I have to pay twice. Come on guys, we're already 10 years into the 21st century here. Breakfast is $19. So I crossed the road and had excellent breakfasts at the Moonstruck café for less than half that price. I booked this hotel because I wanted to try something a bit different - bad idea - just another generic hotel. I doubt if I'll be coming back, unless I really can't find anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: HonestJane_10
Reviews.Content: Terrible poky dank room and hallways. No free internet service...in today's world where even Burger King has free wifi???. A stinky little fridge which was not cooling and had accumulated dirty water in it. I asked for the room to be changed or the fridge to be fixed - neither was done and for some strange reason they charged my card an extra $25 after i had signed my receipt. I would never go back and never recommend it - maybe for $50 a night but definitely not worth over $230 a night.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: Nancy2005
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in May; secured very good Priceline rate. Four blocks south of Grand Central Station; 15 minute walk to Penn Station. Feels like a European tourist hotel, in a good sense. No coffee maker in small room, but absolutely no complaints. Ask for room in interior (no view) while 38th St. construction continues. Hotel is glad to comply if room is available (and is for earlier check-ins).

Reviews.Title: “A Shopper's Paradise, and was that gunshot I heard at 2am?”
Reviews.Author: CazBexhill
Reviews.Content: This is a shopper's paradise with culture of course! New York is the place to be. The Hotel porter is very jolly and the Hotel lives up to its name it is always good having a base to start off exploring around a new city- plus New York has all the flavour of 1940's buildings, the famous sights of New York, Statue of Liberty, Central Park, Empire State Building and Times Square. I am a Londoner so I felt at home in Times Square it was just like the West End. The Hotel breakfast was very good and sleep factor excellent. The kids will love pressing the lift buttons as the floors keep going up. Ground Zero was very sad- but the spirit of New Yorker's still lives on making it a diverse city it is today.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location..Tiny Room”
Reviews.Author: FMMG
Reviews.Content: To be fair we ended up staying here because we were stranded in NYC because of the volcano. It would not be my first choice. We had to hunt around to find a hotel that was affordable for a few unplanned nights. The location is superb....just off Madison Avenue...with plenty of good value places to eat within walking distance. Scotty's Diner is great. Our standard room was tiny. The king size bed filled the room almost entirely. Hotel staff told us they don't turn on the air conditioning till summer !! The bathroom was a good size but needs some money spent on it to cover up previous attempts at redecoration. It was clean enough ... although not spotless. I could have done without the man coming to the room every morning to ask what you'd used from the minibar. Very old fashioned tv with poor reception. The lobby is very grand looking with a nice bar and desk staff were helpful enough. The hotel is owned by an Italian chain which explains the European feel to the rooms. It was ok but I don't think I'd bother to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice experience”
Reviews.Author: NYScamper
Reviews.Content: Was a little worried after reading some reviews but was pleasantly surprised. Easy walk from Penn Station. Staff was welcoming and allowed for early check in. Room was small but clean, neat and well organized to maximize space. Bedding and bathroom were fine(very hot water so be careful). Toileteries include shower gel, shampoo and shower cap but no moisturizer or hair conditioner. Concerned that our room was right next to the elevator but other guests were relatively quite and noise was not an issue. There will be street construction outside until June so inside rooms might be quieter but street construction only noted on one day. Rooms are very warm. Climate control during summer maybe an issue. Staff was very attentive when asked about problems with the door lock and TV. Desk staff appear to multilinqual and easily switched between languages.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel,great staff, great location,forget the bad reviews and see for yourself.”
Reviews.Author: caroline048
Reviews.Content: We booked through Trailfinders,then having read some negative reviews on this website felt apprehensive on our arrival. The front desk staff were helpful and frindly from the start,we were advised of night roadworks on Madison ave and given a room at back of hotel,no view but a great nighys sleep,even with the window open. Yes our twin room was a little on the small side but as you would expect in New York,and the bathroom made up for this,clean modern with a great shower. Bedding and towels were changed daily,not great for the environment, but great for guests. We had a 4 nights stay and the hotels location was great for walking to all major sights,Theres a very good diner within a 2 minute walk from the hotel which was open all day. We splured on a meal at the River Cafe,under the Brooklyn bridge,very expensive but worth it for the view back acrss to theManhatten skyline,also worth visiting is the Tenement museum on the lower east side. Do research before you go and check Broadway shows at Broadwayboxoffice.com for discouts,we saw Joan Rivers a a small caberet club,and the Iridium club is great for live jazz. Theres so much to see,be prepared to walk to get the best out of the city,although the open top buses are good value at aout $50 for a 48 hour pass for all 4 loops. Ican't wait to go back and would definatly stay at the Hotel Jolly Madison again.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: no1steveb
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights, to celebrate daughters 18th Birthday. Pleasantly surprised. I had done quite a bit of research into several Hotels before I chose this Hotel. To be honest I was brain dead after all that and one Hotel tends to blend into another. I chose this one for price, standard & location. Rooms were clean & adequate. Our party hqad a double & a twin. After two good nights sleep, it was spoiled by arriving back to their rooms at 0300 hrs on 2 consecutive nights. They weren't particularly noisey just the walls were so thin I guess. Didnt eat at the hotel , tended to walk accross the street to the Moonstruck cafe for our breakfasts - which were very good, altho there staff could have smiled more.. The Hotel is about 20 mins walk from Times Square - a bit dissapointing but it gets you out and evry street is like a film set. Otherwise its about a $7.00 ride to/from, which we did occassionally as weather was poor. Only 5-10 mins walk from Empire State. In terms of Taxi back to JFK we went for the service offered by the Hotel at a cost of $70 (inc tip) - $20 of which goes straight into the Concierges pocket as a "deposit"..and it seems like its his mate who comes in the "taxi". Still at least it wasn't metered and we had a slow jouney back , so a yellow cab could well have equated to that. All in all enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location. Pity about the night time roadworks.”
Reviews.Author: jbignal
Reviews.Content: This hotel came recommended by friends and, when we first arrived, we werent dissappointed. Exactly what they said. Fantastic location (not far from Empire State Building) and quite interiour for what we paid. The rooms were nice enough (nothing fancy). The only problem we had was on the first 2 nights there were roadworks on the road outside from 8pm to 4.30am. These are going on for 6 months (until July I think) and only happen Monday-Friday (Friday night included). When we complained we were told that there was a memo on the front desk. Nothing on the website though! As the hotel was fully booked there was nothing they could have done although they did offer us a small discount. The roadworks would only affect the cheaper rooms as the more expensive rooms were higher up and on the other side of the block. My advice would be to not book the cheaper rooms for the next 4 months during the week. Otherwise a lovely hotel, good value for money, great location and would probably go back there. Would just check in advance if there were roadworks!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sexypudz
Reviews.Content: JOLLY HOTEL, Great staff very helpfull! Standard room Very small so we upgraded and the room was very nice and lots space! Bathroom was extremly nice... Location was fantastic in the heart of new york right around the corner from empire state building! I stayed over new year and i must say the whole experience was AMAZING!! Thankyou Jolly Hotel... only slight niggle getting a taxi from the hotel was way too expensive to the airport to avoid like the plague!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, friendly staff, some people just like to complain!”
Reviews.Author: happytourist706
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I travelled from England to stay in the hotel for a winter holiday. I was a little anxious because there were some negative reviews but when I arrived it felt like people had been talking about another hotel. Yes, its compact and smaller than some hotels in the area but very well decorated and in a fantastic location - about a 10 minute walk from time square. The staff couldn't have been more friendly and constantly gave us information on what to do and where to go. They allowed us to check in early and held our bags for us when we checked out, as well as allowing access to safety deposit boxes free of charge. Small touches were nice too, like offering me an unbrella when it was pouring with rain outside. This is not a 5* hotel so the standard room is small but I prefer to call it cosy. The bed was enormous and the bathroom clean, bright and very adequate. I'd be lying if I said it was perfect. The television was basic and a little temperamental at times and we were unlucky in that we had a inward facing room which had limited natural light. But at the price we paid we were not expecting it to be the Ritz. For all those who are worried, I want to reassure you that this is not a hotel from hell by any means. We found it was clean, friendly and suited us perfectly. Tips for people planning to go: the hotel bar has a happy hour where drinks are half price, the prices are reasonable in comparison to other places nearby anyway to this is a great deal. Also, there is a pretty little diner opposite the hotel on madison which we loved and ate at every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, bug bites, poor furnishings, tiny”
Reviews.Author: LouiseNewMexico
Reviews.Content: I have traveled for business and stayed at the Jolly Madison Towers for a couple of years; I have noticed that the rooms were comfortable for the price. This last trip in November was one of the most unpleasant experiences. I, too had requested a certain type of room 2 months in advance. The first room they gave me had an unfinished hole in the wall around a new air conditioner-you could see the filth inside the wall and feel a breeze. The wall paper was peeling badly in the second room they gave. The third and final room was tiny, a double bed and fairly in need of a make over. This was to be my home for nearly 2 weeks. Every night there was jack hammering done on a sewer line on the street below (I realize this is not the hotel's fault-but it added to the unpleasant nature of the room). The first night, several groups of men knocked on my door thinking I was in their room. I kept calling the desk and they didn't "know" what I was talking about. half way through my stay, I was attacked by bug bites. I complained but the staff had blank faces. because of my long business hours and the holiday season, it was impossible to find another hotel. They would not change my room-said the hotel was booked. This was miserable. The furnishings of the room looked as if they procured them from a dumpster as they were scuffed and scarred with doors that would not close. While checking in or coming and going daily, the many "doormen" never lifted one finger to help with baggage or open the door for me even with huge amounts of work paraphenalia. Finally on my last day, the "doormen" were tripping over who would help me and call me a cab. I hailed my own cab and had the great driver come into the hotel and pick my bags up in front of the tired doormen wearing shabby uniforms.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience! - At the Jolly Madison "Customers are Always Wrong"”
Reviews.Author: Fabio_NY
Reviews.Content: I am Italian and as the Jolly Madison Hotel is an “Italian” Hotel chain, I am very ashamed for the memories they are leaving to customers. I thought my very bad experience was a sporadic bad incident but now, after reading other customers feedback, I understand it was not. During our journey in NYC my cousin and I were so disappointed about what we were facing at the Jolly Madison that we ended up with talking about their lake of professionalism and "very welcoming" staff several time while we were supposed to have few “thoughts free” days. While booking, I have selected the option "two beds", and I did it more than 1 month before travelling. While checking in I have been informed that the 2 beds room was not available; they did not apologize neither proposed a solution. I was explaining that I was on a trip with my cousin (a lady) and that what they were proposing (sharing the same bed) was really improper. They did not care till the discussion, in front of other astonished customers became finally embarrassing. Interesting that the Jolly personnel was switching from Italian to English language, depending to the customers close to the desk (Italian customers=they were switching in English language and vice versa!). In the end the solution was a small foldable bed (think about it), which was for them a permanent solution. With this bed open, the floor of the very small room was 100% occupied and moving inside was Impossible. Also the Air conditioning system was 100% faulty. Internet (I had to pay for it, while several hotels offer it as complementary) had such a bad coverage that I could not use it. Breakfast costs A LOT (the basic, not a la carte) and you are provided with croissants/jam/milk/tea. On the last day, while checking out, a helpdesk employee suggested us to talk with their manager to let her know about our story. This made the bad become worse! A lady on her mid 30s early 40s approached the desk… another supposedly Italian lady. She was very unfriendly and arrogant, and was pointing to not existing clauses on the contract (I am not kidding; she was pointing some lines of the contract and reading something else!!!). She was explaining it was “clearly” stated in the contract that the assigned rooms could be different, depending availability (not written in the contract I printed before starting my trip, but she was saying it was written over there… crazy or arrogant?!). No apologies at all, not friendly and a believer of “The customer is always wrong”. Of course she made paid my bill in full, included the late checkout which cost us 100 USD! To conclude, I leaved in NYC for 4 years, after then I am regularly visiting some friends, and I have tried several Hotels, but I never witnessed anything like the Jolly Madison. If you are Italian and you are scared to try out your basic English, and for this reason you book at the Jolly Madison Hotel, be aware that you will be speaking Italian with the Hotel staff, but this does not come “for free”. Read all the above and make your decision; I would not suggest the Jolly Madison Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “You have to check it our for yourself”
Reviews.Author: pmenon1982
Reviews.Content: Booked this property through Priceline. Of course, first thing I did after finding out the name of the property was to come to TripAdvisor and check out the reviews. Naturally, like everyone else on here, I was a little apprehensive and nervous to see what I would end up getting. When I got to the hotel, which has an excellent location, I inquired about upgrade options, and was bumped up to a junior suite for $50 a night. The room itself was nice, had a bit of a seating area, and a very comfy king size bed. The bathroom was absolutely enormous, with two sinks, a bathtub, and a decently sized shower. Very impressed. There was one night where I felt that the hallways smelled of smoke, something that my girlfriend commented on as well. Other than that, no real complaints. The bedding was changed daily, and the toiletries were refreshed daily. Never bothered trying out the breakfast or restaurant there. Oh, and I did pay for internet access, which worked for the first few minutes, and then went totally kaput. I didnt bring it up to the staff, as it wasn't too important to me (it cost me $10). All in all, I think you really need to check the place out for yourself, and dont be put off by the negative reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Have your own experience”
Reviews.Author: mswandererlust
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical, or rather anxious, about staying at this hotel after reading recent reviews. What a relief! The hotel was nicely decorated for the holidays. The lobby was spacious and welcoming. The location was great. The room was fine. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was nice. I have no complaints. I'd cheerfully stay here again. If you are a Rick Steve's budget traveler, you will find this hotel well past your usual standards.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here!”
Reviews.Author: skylark72
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the jolly over the weekend and had a great experience. I went to NY on business with my company booking the room for me. Needless to say, after seeing the reviews about the hotel I was a little nervous; but I did notice that most of the negative reviews were from people who booked through priceline. Since I work in the service industry, I knew that priceline customers are usually low-lives that want to pay the least amount of money for the most amount of perks, but when they get what they actually pay for they become the biggest cry-babies. My stay was great, with a corporate rate I got B-fast, Wifi, gympass, and newspaper all included. The staff was very knowledgeable, friendly and helpful. And the room was comfortable and clean. It didn't really look like the one on the website but I was told that the one featured on the website was their deluxe category, which obviously costs more. Because of the recession I couldn't upgrade, but still had an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “R u kidding me!!”
Reviews.Author: Lifeisajourney_30
Reviews.Content: We went for a weekend trip to nyc and booked this hotel through priceline... We r not picky at all (seriously), but I was compelled to write this review after some interesting experiences... We reached the hotel about 9 on friday night and I pulled up my car expecting a valet.. I knew that they had valet so I called the front desk and they said someone should be out shortly... i went around the block - still no one there- went inside the lobby and asked for Valet.. Finally someone came.. Not that bad - anyways we checked in - got a room on a high floor. It was like entering a sauna - opened the window, put on the AC - after a couple of hours I was able to go to sleep.... Oh.. did I mention that you cannot control the heat.. Anyways - day two - we were smarter and the window open - so at least we were able to sleep on satuday night (maybe we were just too tired and passed out).. On sunday we went out to Bryant park in the morning and came back around 11 am. I went to the front desk to inform that we will be leaving in about 30 mins and they can get my car. The guy actually asked me if we wanted to get our own car from the garage next block.. (and pay for the $35/night valet)... We were like - reallllyyy - he didn’t just ask that question... We had to wait forever for the elevators as well - they had 2 elevators working for 17 floors... NYC is great - so we didn’t really care - but please be prepared - I had really low expectations - but was still disappointed.. Happy holidays folks!!

Reviews.Title: “It takes effort to be this bad!”
Reviews.Author: Gashlycrumbtiny
Reviews.Content: It takes effort to be this bad. I am still in shock even though it has been two weeks since my stay. I used Priceline and chose a 3 star hotel for this area. What a mistake! I got this hotel and quickly read the reviews. I then called Priceline and said that based on what I was reading; this hotel did not seem like a 3 star. I was informed that I was not able to change my reservation, then assured that the rating was correct. While I was not completely convinced, I decided the damage was done and that I would just have to try to be positive. My first impression was a decent lobby. It looked warn but clean. I was feeling better at this point. The hotel gave me an early check-in and told me I was in a room with two double beds; which I felt was a good start. I got to my floor and could not find the room. After asking a maid, I realized the small door right next to the elevator was my room. I was really disappointed when I walked into this little, dreary space with two single beds. I hoped there had been some sort of mistake because the lady at the front desk mentioned two double beds. When I called downstairs, she informed me that she meant single beds. Oops. There was some sort of white stain in the center of the carpet and in some parts, the dirty cream colored wallpaper looked like it had been scraped off the wall by some sort of animal. I have a hard time believing this is a 3 star room. Maybe there are nicer rooms in this hotel but I did not have it. Surprisingly, my bathroom was decent. Though not very big, everything looked nice. At the time, I wished I could have moved my little mattress in there to feel better about everything. I did not feel like complaining so, I convinced myself that it was only for a short period of time. Plus, the internet seemed to work well and that was what was most important for me to work. I woke the next day to itchy skin. No close examination was necessary to see I had been heavily bitten by something during the night. I had little bites all over my right arm and upper right leg. I was so upset, I called downstairs and told them to move me ASAP! The man at the front desk told me to bring my stuff out of the room and check it downstairs and then return to the hotel at 3pm for my new room. I said this will not work since I am working in my room and that is why I rented a hotel for 3 nights so that I would not have to move. He said nothing as I walked back upstairs to pack. I worked at my computer, staying far from my bed until 3pm and then called the front desk to get ready for my room change. The man said that it was too late, there were no more rooms left. He said it was my fault because I had to get out of my room and then come back at 3pm. Since I did not do that, I lost the chance to move. Well… what can I say? I was a little more than mad. I threatened to go to the lobby and show everyone my arm and leg. He said that I should stay where I am and that he is sending someone up. A nice woman appears and asks to look at my arm and leg. She then tells me that this hotel takes bug bites very seriously and calls the front desk. I hear her tell the man downstairs that he is to move me right away. She apologizes for the inconvenience. They moved me to another room, the same style a few floors down. I slept there one more night before I realized that saving money was not worth the personal anguish. Even though I still had one night left at this hotel, I rented a 3 ½ star, upscale hotel a block away for the same price. Honestly, it felt good just to be out of there.

Reviews.Title: “Bit disappointed ;-(”
Reviews.Author: OAP20
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last Nov. with my family. Was Ok for all the time we spent in it! We had 4 rooms, each with a view of the windows on the other side of the Hotel and the roof below so was rather disappointing. One of the showers was blocked on our arrival but was fixed before night time. Small rooms but good bathrooms. Its in a great location for sightseeing and shopping. Staff were very pleasant. Yes, we discovered it was also residential and we found a litle lady sitting on the sofa in her slippers! Moonstruck on Madison was great for breakfast every morning. Chose a different Hotel this year for our weekend but in same location.

Reviews.Title: “Let this be your last resort”
Reviews.Author: victoria1141
Reviews.Content: This place was tiny, run down and dirty. The staff was rude and it was close to nothing that was open late night. It was better than Motel 6 but not much. oh and the elevator broke down.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: saxysid
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean room(though small), nice bathroom, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ecosse-explorers
Reviews.Content: only at the hotel for 3 days as I was in transit to bermuda. After reading the comments on tripadvisor I was a little worried. The basic thing that made this hotel better for me was the room was a deluxe (contemporary design with a big marble bathroom) No doubt costly on the rate card the room was clean, light, comfy bed. I was concerned about having a standard room that I was told was very small and run down, as the deluxe rooms had been recently renovated (not sure how recent) Bottom line is the room was very good, although it was hardly a crash pad, if thats whats required for a cheap and cheerful visit to new york! Didn't use the hotel for breakfast or any facilities so I couldn't say how they'd fair. A great place across the road called moonstruck ticked that box for breakfast until we found our feet. Id also say take a set of ear plugs as the car horns beep throughout the night and day which might affect light sleepers. So be prepared (no double glazing in hotel) Hope this helps someone to make a great stay here, but I do feel if I hadn't went for the deluxe room, I maybe would have wished to have choosen a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The worst stay of 100+ room nights in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Kenny353
Reviews.Content: See all prior reviews. I've had over 200 room nights in New York this decade and this was easily the worst of the lot. Lobby and elevators look great, but rooms are desperate - stuffy, inward-facing, aged, stained, green carpets and red bedspreads, overheated, terribly depressing. Even at $100 on priceline it was a ripoff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - shame about the hotel! :(”
Reviews.Author: globaltraveller72
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is great.. East Mid Town area very close to the good stuff, tourist, shopping, eating and drinking! However the hotel was poor, rooms very small and very noisy and very very hot, even for November no proper ventilation other than opening the window - you can't possibly sleep like this. You might if you're lucky get air con but don't expect it to do much. Note this hotel has NO restaurant and the bar which only opens from 5pm has a poor atmosphere and no one goes there from the hotel it seems! However plenty of restaurants and diners and better bars in the surrounding area in any case. Its supposedly listed as a 3.5 star place hmm optimistic at best. Also the prices for just 3 nights a bit too expensive but I guess thats what you pay for mid town Manhattan. The staff varied from helpful to seeming constantly annoyed. You might get a problem sorted easily or there might be hassle its pure luck of the draw. Desk staff did recommend excellent resturant for dinner and help us book some tourist stuff so the good ones really are good!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad rooms and bad cleaning of corridors”
Reviews.Author: Buda9
Reviews.Content: I Found a croachroak on my window and corridors are always dirty. The Hotel is very well located but need desperatly some improvements in decoration. Rooms are too small, you have difficulty in opening your luggage

Reviews.Title: “There was a cockroach on our wall.”
Reviews.Author: tpcperkins
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline and was pleased with the ~$200/night rate. The location was fine, but everythingelse was horrific. When we checked in, an elderly gentleman kept talking to my sister while I was at the front desk. The front desk clerk said to stay away from him. Comforting. Apparnetly, this hotel is also a residential hotel, which should be noted prior to your booking. Upon checking in, we discovered one of our window had a towel on the seal to keep the elements out. High class. Definitely not three star. My sister's bedspread had a stain on it, which you wouldn't notice unless you looked underneath. It was a substantial stain, not a small one. We sucked it up and stayed there. The next morning, we were woken up three times by maid service, even after repeated requests to leave us alone. The next evening, we ran into the room to change quickly after a day of shopping. While I was in the shower, my sister (a recently relocated NYC resident) killed a roach on our wall. She was like "it's just NYC, deal with it", but I was grossed out completely. We had limited time to make our dinner reservation, so we ran out. We arrived back in our room at 1am, so we stayed. We left first thing the next morning and checked into a better hotel. The better hotel was legitimately a three star, not some poser 1-2 star like the Jolly. Oh, and priceline and the Jolly both have declined ANY refund. I wouldn't send my worst enemy here.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Rooms rip off price €575.00 three nights”
Reviews.Author: AshoMC
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend trip to New York. Was recommended this as a 3-4 star hotel with 1800 Hotels. Rooms tiny one double bed with no room to move. Very stuffy by day and worse by night. We were offered an upgrade for $60.00 a night. 1800 hotels pushed this hotel to me. While it was centrally located it could have been a lot better. More like a 1-2 star. Very disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: TomasBillik
Reviews.Content: I have booked this hotel through Priceline.com, looking for something near Times Square. We tried to check in at 1 pm, hoping they they will have a room for us, but they didn't. They told us that we can leave our luggage there, which we did (after waiting for 15 min for a person who was in charge of the storage room). When we came back around 3:30 pm to check in, there was some kind of problem with my reservation so I was very politely asked to wait a few minutes until they will sort out the problem. At that time, the whole Alitalia cabin crew was checking in, so I was waiting for about 10 min until they sorted me out. The room was nice and clean, no complains here at all. Bathroom was awesome - very modern look. Location was OK too, just a few blocks from Times Square. Ideal for someone who needs to take train, as Grand Central is very close to this hotel. Overall, the stay was pleasant, and I would consider coming back for the price I have paid.

Reviews.Title: “Decently located crash pad”
Reviews.Author: Johninarlington
Reviews.Content: I also was disappointed to have Priceline send me here. I ended up spending just under $200 for the night, including taxes. The room I got was on the tenth floor facing the interior courtyard. The room was pretty clean but it was badly dated. The hotel, if it were done right, might be something like the Algonquin. A real classic from the early 1900s. But the Jolly Madison is not done that way. I'm not sure exactly what they mean by Italian style, either. I was excited before I arrived to read about the Whaler Bar. They should have jazz there on weekends. They don't. But I stuck my head in and it did not look particularly appealing. There is one good thing about this hotel: its location. It has good access to the Lexington Ave. subway lines. Times Square and Herald Square are also walkable. However, I don't plan to return. Next time I'll budget for a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent place to rest your head while staying in the Big Apple!”
Reviews.Author: Olaysha
Reviews.Content: As usual the reviews had me frightened and as usual those fears were completed unwarranted. I got a great rate via priceline but priceline bookings only allow for 2 twin beds. However, the front desk clerk was exceptionally nice to us and switched us to a room with 1 bed as it was our anniversary - and at no additional charge. I followed the advice of another reviewer - We were friendly and smiled and we were graciously accomodated. We booked a double decker bus tour through the front desk easily. I found all the front desk personnel to be very friendly and very helpful. Yes, the rooms are tiny, and a little dated but we weren't expecting the Hilton or the Ritz-Carlton. We needed a clean quiet SAFE place to rest our heads at night after walking around NYC for hours. The bathroom was immaculate and appears to have been remodeled - hot hot water and clean soft towels. No, the TV wasn't a flat screen but I DID NOT COME TO NYC TO WATCH TV so that was of no importance on this trip. I had no problems with television reception and it served its purpose. The bed linens are of an older style not the duvets that you tend to see in chains like Marriot and such but I found no suspicious hairs or burn holes and slept quite comfortably for the few hours that I was in the room each night. Housekeeping did a great job of keeping the room neat. The toilet sits very low to the floor but was perfect for me because I'm on the short side. The hotel was really very decent and economical since we were only actually in the room to shower and sleep. I love flat screens, duvets, and contemporary decor but did not want to spend a ridiculous amount of money on those things when there are so many other things to do with your money in New York. If you win this hotel on priceline, don't be alarmed. It will be fine. Hotel is very close to the Empire State Building and many other attractions. Ask the staff for help on directions, tours, etc. They are glad to help. For the price, it was right in line with our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Good location Comfortable hotelConvenient”
Reviews.Author: Happytraveller013
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located on 38th & Madison. Great rate. Friendly staff! Anthony greeted us at the front desk and was very friendly and helpful. Room was small but very comfortable for a weekend in the city. Room was quiet. Moonstruck on Madison Diner across the street was good for breakfast at 6am on a Saturday . 10 minute walk to Grand Central.Room had blow dryer and iron &shampoo etc..TV was fine.Convenient Will definitely go back.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable upsell”
Reviews.Author: travelteamNy
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I arrived for a girls get-a-way on September 26th. We arrived at Penn Station and walked to the hotel. Easy to find. We had breakfast at the Moonstruck diner (right across the street) which was recommended by others on line. Wonderful food, great price for NYC. We knew to ask for an upsell at check-in. We reserved the basic room on priceline, but really wanted the suite. No problem since we checked into the hotel by 10am. Room ready for us after a no-hastle upgrade discussion. Dropped off our bags and took the subway to the Metropolition Museum of Art, then did a peddle cab tour of Central Park before returning to hotel. The suite was spotless, with a king size bed and a full soaking tub and stand alone shower in the bathroom. The sitting area had a loveseat that opened to a full size bed, so the room could handle 3 people people with no problem. No TV in the sitting area, but it was ample for us to have breakfast there in the morning. The staff was helpful...........just a rude maid who refused to answer our question.........we thought it was a language probelm, but she said she understood us, just chose not to answer (?). We did get what we needed from the housekeeping supervisior. The hotel seems to be a favorite of Italians visiting NYC........seemed to be repeat folks, since door man and check-in staff seemed to know them by name. No bus tours when we were present, so can't say if at other times it is a tour hotel, but I doubt it by the level of service we did receive. I would have no problem staying here again........it was a good find for location and cost for a few days in the City.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: macy78
Reviews.Content: Qutie a nice hotel, the room was a good size but it could have been a bit cleaner. Really good location. The service was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Pulven
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews I was worried about going to the hotel but I needn't have bothered! All the staff including the receptionists were friendly and helpful. We had a problem with the bathroom on the first day (the shower was broken) and this was fixed within 15 mins of reporting the fault. The room was big enough for us as we only used it as a base. The location is fantastic and the Moonstruck diner across the street is an absolute must for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: aimee00
Reviews.Content: As a regular traveller i have stayed in many hotels around the world in many different stars! I stayed in this hotel over 40 times with work and know it inside out litterally! The location is perfect for all the sights and shopping! The hotel is not so good though! If you can afford to stay in the deluxe rooms they are beautiful. The standard rooms are not good! This hotel is old, dirty, safe, in desperate need of redecoration. the staff are generally unhelpfull. apart from the doorman who are fab! There are many cafe's and restaurants around the area. it takes apx 10 mins to walk to times sq and apx 2 mins to the empire state. Overall I would say this was a definate 3 star hotel. I would definately stay here again for location if the price was right but I know not to expect much!.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SKZBoston
Reviews.Content: I have MS so am mobility "challenged". I had to travel to NYC on business with my wife. The hotel handled my needs adequately. The location (and cost) can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: Mommsen
Reviews.Content: Stayed there over the Memorial Day Weekend, my first stay in NYC. Booked over Priceline's name your own price for a decent price. The staff was very friendly at Check-In and Check-Out, didn't really need them other than that. I got a room at the end of the 7th or 8th floor with big windows. Yes, the rooms and bathrooms are small, but I expected worse for NYC. It had a barely functioning AC (could get a problem if it gets really hot, was ok for me) and a fridge that was filled but had still some space for your own bottle of water/beer. It was not one of the cleanest rooms I have ever been in, but very ok. The bathroom was actually spotless. Would definetly return, especially for this price at that location.

Reviews.Title: “Matchbox sized room...NO value for the price!!!”
Reviews.Author: Deevah
Reviews.Content: Our room was immediately next to the elevators. Walking in, you come to a too big for the room sized desk and chair. The 2 beds in the room were so tiny that I was afraid I would fall off if i so much as moved a muscle! There was barely any room to put our belongings. I have stayed at many hotels in the NYC area and by far this was THE worst!! NEVER AGAIN!!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: folgema
Reviews.Content: We booked on Priceline, and felt like the front desk staff had an attitude about it. They were the only rude people we encountered during our visit to NYC. On the other hand, the valet staff was very nice. I think this is the first time in my life I've ever been treated the way the front desk treated our party. But...we weren't in the hotel long, so we didn't let it bother us. The location was very convenient, short walk to Grand Central or Times Square, and the neighborhood was safe and comfortable. Room was small, but bathroom was roomy. Bed was comfy, nice and quiet. We seemed to be the only American's on the property, the other guests were Italian and friendly. Nice place to crash after a long day of sightseeing, and with priceline, the price was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at a great price”
Reviews.Author: budlit2595
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent from Calgary and would recommend this hotel for a short inexpensive trip to New York. We spent 5 nights here and would stay again in a minute. The location is superb. 10 minute walk to Grand Central, 10 minute walk to Time Square and easy bus or subway trip to any of the main attractions. The rooms were small but very clean and the staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: spacebabe78
Reviews.Content: we booked the hotel on booking.com for a special price and it was ok, but I would have been a little dissapointed if I would have paid the recommended rate for a standard room. The room was small but very clean. Nice towels, mini bar and a nice view on the empire state building. Also the might have nicer designed rooms. But all over it was nice. Hotel is also close to Grand Central and there are several restaurants around.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: malibert
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here a few days before arriving - needed a hotel for one night near Times Square. The rate was good and the hotel looked unique. There was a minor issue with my Orbitz reservation, which the staff resolved quickly and then I was upgraded. The room still wasn't very large, but this is NYC. I could see the Empire State Building from my room, the bed was comfortable, and everything was very clean. The AC was a little noisy and the elevators were a little rickety, but those are pretty minor issues for $150/night.

Reviews.Title: “OK,for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: Yesman78
Reviews.Content: Had a 3 day shopping trip in Jan,we landed 1 hour before the plane went down in the Hudson,so there was quite a bit of panick with people from back home texting us.The hotel is is in a very good location,within easy reach of everything,Grand Central was only a 10 minute walk away.It was really cold,to be expected in Jan.If you are planning a shopping trip ,try and go in the spring. The hotel itself was ok,the front desk were very helpful.The room didnt have any Tea/coffee making gear(we took our own),or any curtains?!Just had some nets up! It seems to be getting more expensive everytime we go,also the £ is rock bottom to the $ Been to NY 3 times now,done it to death...So its off the holiday radar for us for a few years.

Reviews.Title: “Great no-frills hotel in convenient Manhattan location”
Reviews.Author: SeattletravellerUW
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here on our first trip to New York. We were on a budget and this was the cheapest place we could find (Quikbook.com had a good deal) and our friend recommended it to us. It did not disappoint. Our room had a large King size bed and a view of the city. The room was very small but we were sightseeing all day and didn't need anything larger. The room and bathroom were clean and it was nice and quiet at night.
