The location couldn't be beat - it's in a side neighborhood that you were far away enough from the main streets and didn't have to deal with noise but close enough that it's only a few short blocks from Times Square. Our room came with free breakfast every morning which was unexpected but very good, with cold cereal, oatmeal, yogurt, eggs, fruits, cheese, meats, bread/bagels and pastries. You were seated and waiters would bring out espresso as you ordered it, which was very nice. There were a couple times we had to wait to be seated but not long. Because this is an Italian hotel there were a lot of Italians staying here that didn't speak our language and the front desk people had accents but were helpful nonetheless. The beds weren't super-comfortable but we were so tired from sightseeing all day that it didn't matter to us. For a great, no-frills hotel in a superb Manhattan location, I would definitely recommend this hotel and hope to come back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: lindasernoff
Reviews.Content: I wish to commend Vera, the hotel manager, for the outstanding job she did booking rooms for family and friends for my daughter's wedding in Manhattan. The hotel accommodations were excellent. The staff's professionalism was first rate. Everyone had an excellent time. The location was perfect for the weekend's festivities. I have stayed at the hotel on other occasions and have always enjoyed my time away from home.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel convienient & affordable for nyc”
Reviews.Author: michele091880
Reviews.Content: this was a nice hotel & the staff is fabulousquiet affordable for nyc! we were kinda of a large group in town for a wedding & the staff were very accomidating

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Fine!”
Reviews.Author: 2wheeltourist
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by the client I was in town to visit. I booked a standard room at $171.00 per night and got just what I expected. The room was somewhat small (not bad for NYC), but was clean and fairly quiet (again, quiet for NYC). The only problem I experienced was the poor selection of TV channels and the lack of wireless internet. They say they have it, but none was found. (Not a show stopper since I always carry a Verizion Wireless Adapter). But since I was there for business I spent my evenings in the room working so the lack of TV was a drag.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris71London
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel purely on location as we were going to a concert at Madison Square Gardens. What a good choice! 15 minute walk and the hotel was clean, tidy and reasonably priced. The room wasn't massive but then who stays in their hotel room when in NYC other than to sleep!? Good value - Good location - Good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “For the same price, stay somewhere else !”
Reviews.Author: MB25Houston
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Jolly Hotel Madison towers in early December for a seminar. I had "prices" through the organization that organized the seminar so decided to stay there. The only pro : the location. All the rest was awful. I asked for a non-smoking room and although the room was supposed to be non-smoking, it was reeking ! I would get smoke through the ventilation system. So I was left with the choice of sleeping in the smoke smell, or the cold (with the window open). The curtains that had probably been white once were filthy grey and had probably not seen a washing machine in years (I had no idea curtains could get this color). The heater was falling apart, and heating the room like mad (good given that I had to leave the window open). The room was so tiny that I could not open my suitcase, let alone access the closet ! The wifi was paying (not cheap) and accessible once every third time. The bed was uncomfortable. The corridors were noisy. There was a line at breakfast cause the restaurant can also accomodate so many ! Once I waited for 30 minutes. The breakfast buffet is not very good - but has everything. The lunch was good the first day, but terrible the second (only sandwiches with bad bread). Last but not least, there's no gym ! For a hotel that priced, that's really too much... Obviously, nobody even offered to help me with my luggage...

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: pharkess
Reviews.Content: Myself & my wife stayed for 4 nights , along with my daughter and her husband. I must admit that reading some of the negative reviews made us wonder what we had let ourelves in for, but we found to our delight that it was an excellent choice of hotel. Our room was spacious , although my daughter and husband requested a "smoking room" which was smaller . both with a large double bed, excellent bathroom , toilet etc , with well stocked toiletries , which were replenished along with fresh towels each morning, complimentary newspapers each morning, both rooms were very CLEAN ! I found the staff very helpful & courteous, and spoke perfect english. Our location could not be better, one block from Empire State building, a couple of blocks from Macy's & Lord & Taylor within 10 - 15 mins walk to Times Square & a excellent Irish bar "Mulligans" only yards from hotel. All in all a great place to stay in New York...and yes it looks exactly like the website ...fab place ! will definetley re-visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect theater-weekend spot!”
Reviews.Author: SomervilleReisender
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Priceline and got the room for $128, about half of the usual cost. Though I didn't choose it specifically, it turned out to be a great place to stay during a weekend filled with theater visits. The hotel is about a 15 to 20 minute walk to Times Square; just a few blocks from The Empire State Building, walkable to Penn Station and Grand Central as well. The room was quite serviceable; the bathroom actually seemed more updated than the rest of the room. The basic room was quite reasonably sized for New York; had all the basic amenities, including an extra space heater that came in handy during this cold weekend. The staff were pleasant and helpful when approached. This is an Italian hotel chain, so the reception staff were all bilingual, which must be very helpful, since the vast majority of other guests in the hotel were Italian tourists. I spent the weekend seeing three amazing Broadway shows, so didn't ask much of the hotel. My only complaint was that the Wifi, for which I had to pay $10 per day, was extremely slow. This service was not provided directly by the hotel but rather through an contracted company.

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off!”
Reviews.Author: shoegal99
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel for 04 nights after camping across America so was in need of a bit of luxury, this is not what we recieved!!!the location was ok but id rather stay in times square as i did previously the year before!the lobby looked pleasant, but when we arrived at our room we had to breathe in literally to fit in, we had to squeeze ourselves with our cases in, there was no room to walk around the beds or anything...the beds were 2 of the smallest single beds in the world which in America standards i expect 2 double beds!2 days we put the do not disturb sign and both days the cleaners knocked and banged our door even forcing themselves in luckily we had the safety hatch on as we saw the door opening awakend from our sleep, both times we complained nothing was done as it happened again.overall for the price this hotel charges its ridicolous i stayed in the edison previously in times square half the price and alot better!!!!

Reviews.Title: “good location and price”
Reviews.Author: janefromcairns
Reviews.Content: hotel in new york are so expensive so we got this for 270 - which i still think is too much !! it is in great location close to subway and everywhere .. staff not too friendly 0 maybe that is NYC however nice king sized bed with fridge and coffee maker .. very good breakfast with espresso .. is Italian owned so lot s of Italian tourists ... staff speak Italian .. hence the good coffee. however for the first three days we were unaware of the free breakfast - on check in i asked and they said no .. 2 days later i found out .. not impressed at all !! the air con was very very noisy... street noise was minimal for nyc.. pretty good stay

Reviews.Title: “Give this hotel a miss!!”
Reviews.Author: Vmaxgal
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New York, but we are seasoned travellers, having visited Europe, Central America , the U.S. and Canada and stayed in many hotels with different ratings, but this was one of the worst especially at $1,300, 00 plus for 4 nights. The room was on the 7th floor, it was clean but very small, no in-room coffee , no safe and no instructions as to where to find the ice-machine. The T.V. reception was terrible, we only wanted the News Stations but could only receive the local news . There was only a child-size chest of drawers for clothes, (the closet was big). There was no fan in the bathroom, the wall-paper was peeling off in several places and the tub took forever to drain. Our worst experience was Beakfast, we went down on our first morning and having read that the 'continental breakfast' would cost us $35.00 we opted to have the 'sides', two pieces of toast each , one cup of coffee and a glass of orange juice, we were still charged the $35.00, when we complained we were informed that the 'sides' were extra add-ons to the continental breakfast, ( this does not make sense), we complained at the front desk and the young man said that he would "look into it", when we checked back later he informed us that there was nothing he could do and that we would be charged the full amount, needless to say for the next three mornings we went across the street to "MoonStruck", a great little deli and had a fabulous full breakfast for less then $10.00 each. We found the reception staff to be surly and not at all friendly, they even gave us the wrong directions to catch the Airport Shuttle, these people are paid to have this information at hand. The female receptionest was quite rude to another guest who was only making an inquiry regarding City Tours. I guess if we had been Italian we may have been treated as guests instead of being made to feel like intruders. I will say that the 'bell-hops' were very helpful and pleasant. I would would not recommend this Hotel to anyone planning a trip to New York, which incidently is exciting and vibrant, we will return, but not to the "Jolly Madison".

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Deluxe Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Flightgirl3
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Jolly Hotel Madison Towers for four nights, the first night we had a dated room on a lower floor which was adequate but quite small and a bit old fashioned. Then we upgraded to a deluxe room on the 16 floor and the difference was amazing! The room was modern, bright had a huge bathroom, great air conditioning, and a safe. The staff were friendly and very helpful making restaurant recommendations and bookings for us. The hotel was very central and we felt very safe walking around the area at night. I would definitely stay there again but in a deluxe room from the start.

Reviews.Title: “Good Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zefron
Reviews.Content: The main reason we booked this hotel was due to the price! New york city has some of the most expensicve hotels in the US, and we dont really believe in spending thousands for a 2 week visit especially if your just using the hotel room to sleep! However we were really surprised by the quality of the hotel. The lobby and common areas were excellent, really clean and well maintained. The hotel reception staff were great and very helpful. We stayed in a standard room and had two double beds. The room itself was clean, although a little small but what do you expect for the price. The room had a tv and air con, which is essential in NYC during the summer. The room was a little dated but the bathroom was great, it clearly had been newly done. The rooms were cleaned each day and new towels were given. The hotel does have safety deposit faciliteis but there are only available at the reception in a small litlle room, but the staff were great and we used these each day, to keep money and passports/flight tickets. The hotel is really central and you are within walking distance to the empire state building, in fact some rooms in the hotel dlook directly at the empire state. The walk is aprox 4minutes to the empire state and only 7mins to madison square gardens! The area around the hotel was quite safe and we had no problmes walking home at night around 2am, which was really good peace of mind! All in all, a great stay for the price and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel...if you get the right price”
Reviews.Author: jacktripper
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in Aug, 2008. I chose this hotel because of its proximity to Bryant Park, as we were there to see a concert the next morning. The lobby is fairly welcoming. It seems as though they are slowly renovating the entire hotel. Our room was very small, with really nothing special to report. It was adequate. If you get this hotel on a very good price, lets say, under $240 then, take it. If this price is higher, you will have many other options that I believe are much better.

Reviews.Title: “Don't look down”
Reviews.Author: WorkingMamato2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great price for the location. It is not a terrible place to stay, but it could use some work to bring it up to a top notch place. The bathrooms are beautiful and clean. However, the rugs in the rooms and hallways are absolutely filthy. There were stains all over my room's rug. I cringed every time I had to walk on them. I was promised a view when booking and all I got a view of was another room across the way and a trash dump below. And, this was a deluxe room. Like I said, the price is great for the area, but I don't think I would stay here again...rooms themselves are just too dirty. It doesn't really matter to me, but the TVs are seriously outdated...don't believe the website that promotes flatscreens.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: griff08
Reviews.Content: First, you can't beat the location of this hotel. A 5-minute walk south of the hotel brings you to the Empire State Building, and a 5-minute walk north of the hotel brings you to Grand Central, Bryant Park, Times Square, etc. The breakfast at Moonstruck across the street was great, and cheap ($15 for 2). We arrived on July 4th, so parking on the street was free until 8am the next day. Valet parking is $37, but there are numerous parking lots around that are much (at least $10) cheaper, if you don't mind walking a little bit. The hotel lobby and restaurant were absolutely beautiful. The lounge area was comfortable and cozy, even if a little expensive. I wouldn't exactly call the hotel employees kind, friendly or helpful, but they weren't downright rude. They just acted as though they were busy, even though there wasn't anyone around. The bellman watched us struggle through the front door with several bags in the pouring rain, and then asked us if we needed him to push the elevator button. Our room was on the 8th floor. If you book your room on Priceline, you can expect to stay here. Check out my photos of the view outside the window - you will see it's NOT the Empire State Building. It's a smoking floor, and we had a smoking room even though we don't smoke. Only the hallway was smelly - our room did not smell like cigarette smoke at all. We had a king-sized bed, and it took up the entire room. Literally, to get from one side of the room to the bathroom, you have to climb over the bed. There was a nice desk with stationary, NYC info, and a spot to plug in the laptop. The tiny TV had poor reception. The room was just not "feng shui" at all, and if they took out the desk and rearranged things, the same tiny room would have felt a lot larger. The bathroom was cute, with a half-glass wall instead of a curtain, nice showerhead, good pressure, and plenty of toiletries. The only problem with this is that the shower didn't drain AT ALL, so by the time two of us were done, there was about 2' of dirty water in the tub. Yuck. All in all, I would stay here again, but only for the location - not the ambiance, the service, the room, or the price. I didn't have a terrible time, but I guess I just expected a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations did not meet up to standards”
Reviews.Author: xoklb
Reviews.Content: Front staff not very helpful or attenative at check in. Carpets were not clean outside of the rooms. Heavy smoke odor/stale on the entiere 8th floor for which we stayed on. No one explained the free continental breakfast therefore we incurred over $100.00 room service on something that was suppose to be included into our room price. TV was outdated and not many channel stations. Cleaning service was good and checked on our rooms each day. Saturday afternoon where they say you can find anything in new york however we wanted a cocktai within the hotel. To limited in hours of operation for the whaler bar and lounge. No paper deliverd to the door, kind of thought this would be standard considering many lower scale hotels offer. Cleaning service did a good job within the room. Carpeting outside room in bad condition, areas where is it had been streteched and their were even areas where you couldtrip on.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to stay in NY”
Reviews.Author: TheDuchess
Reviews.Content: We arrived back yesterday from 5 days at the Jolly Hotel Madison Towers. We had a great time. Our bedroom was on the 12th Floor at the side of the hotel overlooking 38th Street, It was a lovely sunny room, very quiet and clean. The maid changed the linen and towels every day. The bathroom was lovely, with plenty of very nice complimentary toiletries and masses of hot water day and night. Air conditioning was very good and gosh we needed it at 38 degrees ! The hotel receptionists couldn't have been more helpful. They booked taxis, cars, and tour buses for us and we used the free safety deposit boxes. Nothing was too much trouble. They even checked us in on line for our flight home.The doormen were stars, rushing out and getting us taxis , giving us directions and looking after our luggage for us. Thank you Eddy and Manny As two women travelling on our own , we felt very safe and secure at the Madison Towers, we were in easy walking distance of the Statue of Liberty, Macy's , 5th Ave, Broadway , Times Square, Bryant Park and Grand Central Station. We even walked to Central Park, and back about 2 miles town. Do book yourself a two or three day pass on Gray Line Bus. We did a two day for $86 each and travelled all over uptown, downtown, Central Park, Harlem etc etc as well the Night Tour and visiting the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island. Go online to book your Theatre tickets to get a discount., we saved 50$ each on Phantom of the Opera. Visit Gordon Ramseys at the London Hotel on 54th Street for lunch $45 a person but get dressed up as its smart dress code. The food is sublime. For breakfast go across Madison Ave to the corner with 38th street to Moonstruck were you can eat full English for $7 including coffee and juice. Amazing value, great food and open 7 days a week. Hotel is probably the best value in New York for location. Just a word though , don't forget to get lots of $1 bills as everyone in New York expects a tip. It makes up the salaries of waiters and hotel staff, but even some shop staff expect you to leave your small change. Can't think of anything else to say except GO !!! Stay in the Jolly Madison Towers and you are in the middle of all the action. NYC is fabulous and everyone should see it at least once. ( I am already saving to go back !!)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kristineLA
Reviews.Content: Just returned from New York and stayed in the hotel for 3 nights. My colleagues and I really liked our stay here. We all had Deluxe Rooms on the 15th and 16th floors. They look like they are newly remodeled. My room was right next to the elevator, so i was dreading my stay, but the elevator doesn't actually make that "ding!" sound when someone calls for it or when it arrives, so it turned out to be a non-issue. I had a king sized bed and 4 king sized pillows. The room is a very good size, particularly for NY. I looked forward to going back and relaxing at the end of each work day. There is sufficient desk space to work, but I tend to work sitting on my bed and the lighting was more than adequate. They offer wireless internet for a fee (kind of pricey in my opinion) which is reliable. My main complaint is with the toiletries. Although they give you lots of stuff, they do not give conditioner and most of the shampoo/shower gels smell a bit masculine. I had the same issue with my hotel in Milan, and as I believe this is an Italian chain, it must be their norm. As for the hotel overall, it is in a good location. It's easy to catch a cab or walk to many places. Lots of good places to eat and drink nearby. Also a Duane Reade nearby if you need snacks/meds/conditioner. Starbucks is only a few blocks down, but you can get a capuccino at their daily breakfast. Just be prepared to stand in line, as they check everyone off their list as they seat them. One last note... I don't think they have remodeled all of the floors, so if you can afford it, definitely try to get one of the newly remodeled rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: TillyAnn23
Reviews.Content: A group of 6 of us stayed in this hotel over memorial weekend, and I have to say, there was nothing I could complain about. The rooms were very spacious & clean. No problem with noise. The staff were great, no problems there. If we ever decide to visit NY again, I would definitely stay there again, and would have no problem recommending it to anyone, in fact, already have!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sweetybyrd
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in a few hotels in NYC and this is a good hotel for the money. It has been updated, so you see some of the 'old' in places. But all in all, the room we got was exactly like they show on their website. The only complaint I had was that the light in the bathroom wasn't strong for shaving or makeup. The bathroom was beautifully designed in spite of that. There was no mold in the grouting. It was very clean and roomy. There is a huge glass shower, separate bathtub, a very long counter with the sink. The room was quiet, which is IMPORTANT to me. We used valet parking and the attendant was fast and courteous. Though the people at the desk did not smile often, they were efficient and got you what you needed. We didn't eat there, because there were so many other interesting restaurants in the area. I wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: SusanWelford
Reviews.Content: A friend and I had six nights here recently and were very satisfied with our choice of hotel.The staff were friendly, the situation excellent and room larger than we had expected. Our bed linen and towels were changed daily and the room kept very clean All our requests were met and we enjoyed a quiet room overlooking back courtyards. A bonus was the Jazz evening on Wednesday held in the Whaler bar. The diner opposite the hotel on Maddison avenue was excellent and the small Italian restaurante a little further along Maddison avenue served superb evening meals at an affordable price. All attractions were reached easily by walking or taking the Metro 3 blocks away at Grand Central station. This was our first trip to New York and we were more than satisfied with our choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great, lovely Hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Tati_B
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at the Jolly Hotel Madison Towers and we are very happy that we booked this hotel. Our stay could not have been better! It was our first time in NY and therefore, we searched for a hotel, which is located close to main attractions. In addition, we searched for a cheap hotel. We booked through Priceline and got this amazing hotel. I have to mention that we booked the cheapest hotel room and got an upgrade when we checked in, so we could stay two nights in the great Deluxe Rooms. Also, we checked two hours before regular check-in time (3pm) without any problems. The staff was very professional and kindly. We had this stunning view direct to the Empire State Building from our room / bathroom, which was great. And you really don't need to take a car or a taxi to get around, because everything is so close. The best thing was the amazing bathroom. It was just brilliant! So, I don't know how the cheap rooms look like, but the lobby as well as the deluxe rooms, are a stay worth. I would always recommend this hotel, witout any doubts.

Reviews.Title: “No'Jolly' At Jolly Madison”
Reviews.Author: Glasgowgal07
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving, we entered an empressive lobby, to be confronted by a not so empressive receptionist. Customer service is not priority in this hotel. We has originally booked a double room, but were given a twin room. When asked if we could change rooms, we were told in no uncertain terms, and bad english, that everyone gets what they are given on arrival! After extensive discussions which turned to arguements we had to admit defeat. There were stains on the carpets, the wallpaper was peeling off the bathroom walls, there is only one ice machine, located on the 4th floor, and when leaving (checkout is 12pm) We had several visits from housekeeping asking for the room. When checking out, there was no thank you for staying at the hotel, no thank you for paying our telephone bill, and no real acknowledgement we were there. Only positive thing, is the hotel is central to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Jolly”
Reviews.Author: thisisthetruth2
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner are just back from a weeks stay here, and believe me. There was nothing Jolly about this place. After reading several reviews, i was slghtly worried, but still open minded. On arrival, we thought the lobby was quite smart. We were checked in by a Miss Fodeniz, who never raised a smile, or said any sort of pleasantaries. We were advised that the ONLY room availible was a twin bedded room. Obviously this is not what we wanted, and after much arguing, i was told that you get what you get, on arrival. I offered to pay for upgrade, however they were unwilling to do this. We had to accept this, as we had no other option. The room was dated, wallpaper in bathroom peeling, stained carpet. Rooms do not have a safe, and although official website states they have room service- the only offer this for breakfast. Whaler bar in back of lobby is small, overpriced, and the twice a week jazz nights are way to loud for such a small space. Perfect location is the only plus point. One ice machine located on the fourth floor, for the whole of building. On check-out we again were dealt with by Miss Fodeniz, again no smile, no goodbye, this appears to be the normal customer service here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: momosrt
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it was the best priced one we could find for our weekend in NYC. Then, I read the reviews and got a little nervous! Those fears were completely unfounded. Reviews said the staff was less than pleasant. The man who checked us in couldn't have been more pleasant. We arrived around 11am and knew check-in wasn't until later. To our surprise, the room was ready! Every person we met while checking in and checking out was more than pleasant. I don't know if the other reviewers who said they were rude were perhaps not pleasant themselves but basic kindergarten rules apply...treat others as you would like to be treated and everything is fine. Our room was on the 15th floor. It was newly remodeled with a beautiful new bathroom. There was a view of the Empire State Building from the bathroom window. Toiletries were ample. Everything was clean. The only down side was that the room was a bit warm for our liking but for us, we used the room only when we were sleeping so we just slept with fewer blankets. The free breakfast was great. Cereal, juice, coffee/tea/hot chocolate, pastries, hard boiled eggs, fruit, cheeses & Italian meats... We were plenty satisfied before hitting the big city. The location was great. One block to the left was 5th Avenue. Then, it's just a few blocks to the right (hotel is at 38th Street) to all the major 5th Avenue shopping/sites. Very safe location. All in all, a great place to stay. I've been to NYC many times and have stayed in "fancier" named hotels (the famous one by Central Park is one I've stayed at and they were nowhere near as friendly as the folks at Jolly Madison). I can tell you from experience this is one fine hotel. You won't regret making your reservation at the Jolly Madison.

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: toshin
Reviews.Content: The positive is the location. If you book a remodeled room, you are OK. All remodeled rooms are on the 14th floor or higher. They are small, but nice. From the 12th floor down is awful. The hall carpets are torn and buckled. The 4 rooms I was shown were all worn and dirty. Under the TV's had not been dusted, under the beds were dust balls, the corners had built up dirt and the woodwork was banged up and chipped. You can hear everything going on next door and in the hall. And that is true in the remodeled rooms too. They said the entire hotel is going to be renovated. It can't be soon enough!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel shame about the bedrooms”
Reviews.Author: irishdollIreland
Reviews.Content: when i saw this hotel in the web site i was instantly pleased it looked modern and the rooms looked fantastic. when i arrived i was really pleased the door man and staff was lovely but whenever we got to our room what a shame. the room we thought we had booked on the website was not the one we got, in fact it was really old in decor. i was so disappointed as we had paid £200 EXTRA for what we thought was the luxury room. when ever we explanied to the lady at the front desk she was not at all helpful. disappointing to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again; a solid mid-town Manhattan hotel choice”
Reviews.Author: mjohns7861
Reviews.Content: After searching for a few days and struggling to find a decent hotel within my price range I stumbled across the The Jolly at Madison Tower. The price and location were right. After reading some reviews with some concern I found my recent four day stay at The Jolly enjoyable and I would not hesitate staying here again. The hotel is extremely well located right on the corner of 38th and Madison. You can walk to the theatre district in 10 minutes or so. There is not an immediate subway stop but have stops you can access within 3-4 blocks at Grand Central and Bryant Park. While the hotel has some age on it, the carpeting and lobby furnishings indicate some updating will be in order in a few years, I found the entrance pleasant, clean, safe, and professional. The lobby features a computer you can use for $4.95 per half hour if you need to check e-mail or you can pay a fee for wireless in your room. The bar The Whaler is also in the lobby and while I did not get a drink there, I poked my head in and it seemed very pleasant. The room itself was very comfortable and clean. The bathroom was well appointed and the shower worked well—solid water pressure and hot water. The bed was very firm—almost like cement. I prefer a firm mattress, so this may not be for everybody. Also, my room faced Madison Avenue, and you do get some street sounds. I suspect if you are the lower floors this may be something to keep in mind in requesting a higher floor or a room on the interior. The room was well appointed albeit the furnishings were a bit dated but again the room was clean and large by Manhattan standards. The room also had a spacious closet and a small little dresser inside the closet. It is also worth noting this hotel has four working elevators that are extremely efficient. I never waited more than 20-30 seconds for an elevator, no small feat in a Manhattan hotel. As an interesting side note, this hotel is owned by an Italian hospitality company that draws a heavy Italian and European clientele. You will see signs, newspapers, tv channels, etc. all in English and Italian. I also highly recommend the diner across the street called the Moonstruck. Not fancy but excellent food. Overall, I found The Jolly at Madison Towers to be a pleasant surprise and a hotel I would recommend to my friends without hesitation. It offers a nice midtown location, reasonable rates, and good place to base your sightseeing or business activities in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: vancity02
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 14th floor. It was renovated, bathroom was really nice and clean. We tipped room service $1-2 dollars a day and she was so kind and replaced everything each and everyday. Anthony at the front desk is extremely helpful. Good location, we walked to Times Square during the night and returning around 2am, you feel completly safe because of the police presence everywhere. Totally would stay here again, because price is awesome, location is great and if you get the top floors the rooms are really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Small but OK for my needs”
Reviews.Author: YVRSweetheart
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via a special package deal through a travel agent. When my travelling companion and I arrived, I found the hotel room to be small. We were booked into room #751 right next to the elevators. The room looked out onto the interior courtyard and contained two single beds, a desk, desk chair, TV on a stand, a night stand, and another arm chair. The closet contained a chest of drawers that did not fit in the main space. The bathroom was small, but clean and it had been updated. All in all the room was clean and workable for our needs, (we spent most of our vacation out seeing the city, not stuck inside) especially since we paid $120.00/night as part of our package. If I was into spending alot of time in the room, I think that I would have found it too small. Day #1 the TV remote didn't work very well, and our window was broken (despite being closed, the upper pane kept slipping open). At approximately 1 am we finally got frustrated with the window and called the front desk. A Security Officer showed up after two calls to the front desk. The gentleman was very nice, but he was unable to fix the window. We ended up having to change rooms at 1:30 am to room #951. It was a litlle frustrating, but the new room's windows were fine. The evening's activities ended with the intermittent noise of toilets flushing and water running which we could hear very loudly through the walls. Day #2 The shower had a partial glass pane that the extended only 2 feet from the wall and allowed the water to spray all over the floor. The only way to prevent a flood was to shower in the corner all hunched over. After that the hairdryer made alot of noise, but it didn't give off any heat to speak of. Day #3 and #4 we got used to the loud sounds of toilets and water and all in all the beds were confortable enough. The staff members were nice and the hotel felt safe. I would probably stay somewhere else in NYC if the price was right, but for the money the Jolly was alright. Oh, and the Moonstruck diner across the street does offer a good, relatively cheap (especially for New York) breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - all you need for a short break in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Meeeeeeeeeee
Reviews.Content: I was extremely worried about staying at this hotel having read some of the reviews featured on this site, but I can safely say that we had no problems at all. The room that we stayed in was clean, tidy and surprisingly quiet. The bed was big and comfortable - there was a hairdryer, iron, TV & access to the internet should you need it. Yes, the room was quite small but you are in New York! Surely you should be out exploring?! The location was great, a stroll from Grand Central Station and The Empire State. You didn't have to go far to reach Times Square either. We actually walked everywhere - up to Central Park, even down to catch the Ferry to Liberty Island! The cafe Moonstruck is on the corner for great breakfasts. I can also recommend a bar called 'The Australian' - 20 W. 38th St. (5th & 6th Aves.) Good food, good prices - for those of you wanting a pint of Foster's they have it, plus many other beers! All in all the hotel was absolutely fine and we enjoyed every minute of our stay in NY!

Reviews.Title: “Larger than average affordable NYC hotel”
Reviews.Author: HostingLady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Jolly Madison for 2 nights for a family wedding. NYC hotel rates are always outrageous and we wanted to try to make this particular trip to the city as affordable as possible. When I stepped into the Lobby I was a tad nervous about the conditions of the hotel but much to my surprise our standard room was more than adequate. The room was spacious for New York standards and the bathroom even more so. I found the room to be quite clean the only complaint was that the room doors all seem to slam shut which if you are a light sleeper can be jarring in the middle of the night. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and quality in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: KittenMama
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I regularly stay here when visiting our corporate office nearby. The rooms are adequate to good (the traditional rooms are a bit dated but nice enough and the new rooms have a nice modern feel). Breakfast is included in the rate we select, so that frees up our per diem meal budget for lunch/diner. The breakfast room offers a very nice European continental buffet but you may also order from the menu. I have stayed at much less desirable properties in Manhattan. Once we found this, we have stuck with it. Comfortable and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Price, Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: travelfooldc
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the internet price. Centrally located. Desk staff seemed a bit cold, but yet they were very helpful (we were expecting a FedEx delivery). Bellman was very helpful and courteous. Room temp was hot. Opened window and it eventually cooled off. The hotel was clean. King size bed was comfortable. Asked for non-smoking room. No smoke smell on the floor -- that was nice. We stayed on the 10th floor. That floor is due for a makover. Room was small, but bigger than rooms in hotels at Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “hotel was fine,,,stop moaning!!”
Reviews.Author: colin126
Reviews.Content: me and the wife stayed here when we visited nyc for her 40th birthday,,rooms were clean,bed was big,had no probs sleeping, and to be honest,when you go to new york you dont really want to spend much time in your hotel room do you?? only for the needed things,like sleeping and that.... with all the famous landmarks that are to see,the room is the last place you want to be,unless your a hermit!!!! so get on with it,stop moaning about a decent hotel and go enjoy your stay in the best city/island in the world!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “As Expected”
Reviews.Author: airdrieexile
Reviews.Content: No surprises and value for money when booked way in advance for this average, though ideally situated NYC hotel. Door/desk staff helpful and to the point and although room very small it was clean and tidied daily to an acceptable standard. No view or sunlight from window so if that's a concern make sure you ask beforehand what you want from the room. Would not recommend spending any money or time in the bar but why would you given where you are? Only real issue which may prevent booking again is the noise made by the maids cleaning and opening/closing doors in adjoining rooms. This would go on for approx 2 hours daily and more or less forced you to get up despite the 'Do Not Disturb' request.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as they say”
Reviews.Author: vespagal77
Reviews.Content: As someone that booked through a package at a travel agency I knew I was going to get a very basic standard room. And I went in with that expectation and it was only a little worst then I thought it would be. For the first time in 20 years I was sleeping on a single bed, room right next to elevator, no TP and I found out the next day a crack in the hose for the shower that sprayed down the bathroom. I called down for some TP and it never arrived so the next morning I ask them if I could upgrade, for a fee of course. Well it was like night and day between the two rooms and I think I really appreciated the deluxe room more after staying in the standard one. The room was great and the service was better not sure if it was just the staff that was on at night or what not. Again my room was right by the elevator but I admit I didn't hear it at all but I was on the 17th floor. I found the staff helpful and the doormen great. Be careful about getting back to the hotel. I'm pretty sure they get a cut if they talk you into a towncar and it's sooo overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here at your own risk!!”
Reviews.Author: AyHJay
Reviews.Content: I have frequently stayed at this hotel as my company was contracted to use it. Fortunately, the contract has now ended and from January we will be staying elsewhere. I have probably stayed a total of 20 times and each time, dread returning there. The staff at the hotel are downright rude and uninterested in guests; many of them can't even manage a smile. The 'Happy Hour' in the bar is anything but; on one occasion I ordered a drink twelve seconds after happy hour finished and was curtly told I would need to pay full price. The rooms below floor 14 are tatty, badly maintained and sometimes dirty. On my last trip (25-28 Dec) there was rain water coming through the ceiling (even though there were rooms above mine) and we watched mice running across the floor in the breakfast room. In the summer, many of the air conditioning units in the rooms we had either didnt work or were so ineffective that it wasnt worth switiching them on as they are so noisy! The breakfast has improved recently and a couple of the breakfast waiters are the only saving grace amongst the rude and unhelpful staff in the rest of the hotel. My tip if you're thinking of staying here - DON'T!

Reviews.Title: “A very bad trip”
Reviews.Author: penut1218
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I were going to NYC for the night to see Grease. We needed a place to stay.Someone had recommended the Jolly Towers. So we booked it. When we got to the hotel the bell hops watched us stuggle to open the heavy door with our bags. When we went to the front desk to check in we were not greeted with a smile or a word for that matter my husband had to start the concersation. When we finally got our key we threw our bags in our room and went out to walk NYC. Upon returning to our room I went to turn the heat on when I noticed it was not working. SO I opened the bottom of the heater to find a sock or towel not sure. Then I went to move the curtin to look outside and there was an open yougart on the ledge. I made my husband call down to get us another room. The same lady who was there when we checked in answered and was rude again. She did get us another room. She sent a bell hop up with the key and he took our bag. When we got to the newer room the bell hop stood in the middle of the room waiting for a tip. My husband told him he could leave because he was not getting a tip from us because of how displeased we were. Thats when I got scared the bell hop yelled at my husband and then cursed all the way down the hall. I was truly scared. My husband then went down to speek to a manger who was willing to look into it but only offered us breakfast. When we returned home my husband e-mailed her with all the details. She said she we would here back from her. Well we did 10 days later.All we have been offered is a free upgrade for our next stay. I never want to stay there again. Ever

Reviews.Title: “I Had Know Need to Worry”
Reviews.Author: car6443
Reviews.Content: My mum and I were booked into the Jolly Madison because the hotel we wanted was fully booked. After reading many reveiws I was dreading going, to the point that I returned to the travel agents to try and get another hotel. Well I had know need to worry the staff were polite and friendly. The room wasnt big but then your only sleeping there, it was cosy and very clean with the bedding being changed daily. I would however warn of the prices of the mini bar, in short if you want a drink there is a store around the corner that sells alcohol. There is also a grocery store around the corner which sells hot coffee, chocolate and tea which you can take back to your room. Then there is Moonstruck.... very nice meals at a good price. If I was to return to New York I would go back to the Jolly Madison, as well as having a lovely stay there it is so close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “You only get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: SharonbHewett
Reviews.Content: My daughter (aged 10) and myself stayed for 4 nights at the Jolly Hotel Madison Towers in November 2007. I read a few reviews before booking and decided I should book a deluxe room (an extra £125 for a total of 4 nights) .... well..... I tried very hard to find fault with this hotel .... and sorry I couldn't!! I took advice from previous reviews and avoided breakfast - so no problems there. Our room was wonderful - 15th floor with a view of the Empire State Building. Looked exactly like the photos on the website. Tea & coffee in the room. Beautiful bathroom together with toiletries. Lots of room for luggage and shopping. Requested a non-smoking room - so no smells of cigarettes! Reception was very helpful - but then we had no complaints and doorman/porters were very pleasant and cheerful. Free umbrellas, free local phone call from reception. My daughter and I travel abroad at least 3 times a year for holidays and I travel abroad on business fairly regularly, our overall experience was very good with this hotel, it certainly met up to our expectations. Ideally situated in walking distance of everywhere in central Manhattan. Only disappointment from our trip was that most of the shows on Broadway were cancelled due to strike action from stage hands, but this is nothing to do with the hotel. Would certainly go back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Didnt deliver its promises”
Reviews.Author: N1NKN
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a girls weekend in New York, hotel booked for its central (ish) location which was great and walking distance to most places Broadway/Times Square, Central Park and of cours Saks, Bloomingdales, Burgman, Taylors (on the door step) and Macys. The room we were given (a twin) was extremely small not enough space to lay both cases on the floor never mind our shopping. Wardrobe too small to hang anything other than 5 or 6 items no longer than a jumper. Bathroom did the job and on the plus side the house keeping are spot on and the cleanliness was great. The restaurant was shut (apparently had been for 2 months) so although breakfast was catered for no room service or lunch/dinner service. The bar was also closed in the day time. Apparently to clean the chimney (3 days as from when we left!!!) again no food available at the bar. Great deli on the corner of the block with fab pastries and food for breakfast and dinner as is Moonstruck opposite for a good cheap breakfast. For a budget stay and central location this hotel is OK but far from its advertised 4*'s.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location / Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: santo71
Reviews.Content: DATE: between October 23rd and october 30th Before going i've saw the reviews at tripadvisor and, sincerelly, i didn't knew in waht to believe, cause as usual, what can be good for me it can be disaster for anyone else. The concierge was nice, very professional. The room was, at the first sight, very small compared with other hotels in same range, i've stayed in the past. After being there a couple days We get used... I could say that only for one person was OK. I was on the 9th floor on the corner of Madison avenue with 38th street. Nice view over the empire state building. But I saw that they have smaller rooms..... ask always by larger rooms!! The rooms were clean, but I should say that probably they need to change some furniture.. Very old!! The breakfast was ok.. Some missing scrambled eggs were noted!!! In resume, was ok for trip business, confortable enough. Very good location

Reviews.Title: “My Room Was Good”
Reviews.Author: FarAwayTraveler
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3-night stay at the Jolly Madison. Overall, it was a good experience. The hotel is in a nice neighborhood, within walking distance of Penn Station. The Javits Convention center is about a 15-20 minute walk. Times square is 10 minutes by foot. My room was on the 15th floor. It's my understanding that the higher floors are renovated. Even on the 15th floor, you can hear some car horns honking, but not too loud. This is New York City. It's par for the course. Jolly is an Italian chain, and you can see that in the room decor. The bed is low to the floor. The TV has an Italian channel (they sure love variety shows in Italy). My comment about the TV is that some channels don't show very good reception. It's time for HD. Lucky for me, my room had no odors. The bathroom was very nice. Lots of marble everywhere. There was a basket of toiletries, including a toothbrush and toothpaste. Water pressure was good. My only complaint is that the shower fixtures must be European (3 controls instead of two). Of course they have the mandatory shower wand that I've always encountered in Europe. I stick with the regular shower head. FYI the room had a separate bath. I paid $1100 for three nights, including tax. For a busy week, that's a great deal. I would give the Jolly Madison 5 stars, but the TV reception wasn't great, and they don't have a restaurant. The bellman did recommend a steakhouse two blocks away (Frankie & Johnnies).

Reviews.Title: “Give Jolly Madison a big fat miss”
Reviews.Author: elizabethpaige
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in October 2007 for which our travel agent (Flight Centre) charged us $840. The room we got was small, shoddy and reeking of smoke. We complained to the desk that having paid such a lot of money we expected a decent room. They told us travel agents only have access to their standard rooms - they agreed to move us the following day. Of course we had to pack up our luggage and leave it in their storage room for a half day while they readied another room. The second room while bigger was also not worth what we had paid. WORD OF CAUTION: The hotel website is misleading. Instead of a modern deluxe room with a view of the Chrysler building you'll probably get a dated smoke drenched shabby room with a view of three inner sides of the hotel and views into other rooms. The breakfast room hostess kept guests waiting a long time because she preferred to prioritize room phoned in room service orders rather than guests who actually made the effort to come to the breakfast room. Her lack of etiquette, not even a 'Sorry to keep you waiting' and the 'sniffy' attitude of our table waiter was a pain. An attached restaurant (entrance off Madison) charged $12 for a ham/pineapple/feta cheese/pepper sandwich, consisting of dry bread (no butter or mayo) with offputting slabs of boiled ham (I was thinking black forest), a bit of feta cheese and red pepper but no pineapple at all. The waiter ignored the pile of ham at the side of my plate when he took it away. My advice: Give the hotel and restaurant a big fat miss - only then will the realize they need to smarten up.

Reviews.Title: “Very relieved”
Reviews.Author: Chelseagirl47
Reviews.Content: Having booked this accommodation through Trailfinders, I must admit having seen the reviews on Tripadvisor to being a bit worried. Trailfinders assured me that they send many people to this hotel each year and don't get any complaints and I am not going to complain either. Check in service was helpful and friendly and our room was fine. Slightly in need of redecoration but perfectly clean and enough room to lay two suitcases on the floor. We had breakfast at the Moonstruck across the road which we would reccommend. The Hotel is perfectly situated for sightseeing and the fact that I could see the empire state from my bedroom window was a bonus. Another bonus was being able to leave our suitcases with the bell hops so that we could do some more sightseeing before setting off to the airport.. The hotel offer a limo service to take you to the airport and it is worth the money. I would stay here again if visiting new york.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: GmanScotland
Reviews.Content: Clean room with some friendly staff. Perfect for tourists as you'll never be in it. However, the jolly hour or happy hours was anything but. The bar man was a right grumpy sod and the drinks were more expensive than normal bars and tasted awful! Website does not give true representation and it certainly was not an Italian Boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghSatisfied
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just spent a week in NY, staying at the Madison Towers. We had been booked into it by Trailfinders, but were a little worried by some of the reviews on TripAdvisor. We can only speak of the room we occupied, but our experience was a good one - adequate room size (you only sleep there), excellent housekeeping, pleasant staff, Moonstruck across the road for breakfast, good central location, acceptably priced for NY. This is a standard middle-of -the-road hotel, giving fair value for money, and in the absence of any clearly better offers we would happily return to Madison Towers.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: barbs20
Reviews.Content: I satyed at the hotel at the end of July with my mum. We were on a five night trip to New York and spent 3 nights at this hotel. Had read loads of reviews before booking this hotel, but it was in a good location and thought i could get over the small room. We checked in quickly after a long flight and were looking forward to seeing the room. We were in a corner room on the 2nd floor, it was huge, with a huge king size bed and 2 easy chairs and a large bathroom. Service was excellent, i am very particular about food, but they catered for my needs at breakfast and the italian resturant attached to the hotel was very nice, even though the menu was a bit limited. All in all a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised!”
Reviews.Author: LuckyCardiff
Reviews.Content: Having read other reviews of this hotel we were apprehensive of what we would find however I only have good things to say about this hotel! Staff were welcoming and most went out of their way to help with any questions we had etc. It was ideally placed for exploring all areas of Manhatten with 5th Ave and Broadway being a block away. The hotel was clean and inviting with excellent daily housekeeping service. If we could have changed one thing it would have been the lighting in our room. There was only a bedside lamp and a desk lamp so it was difficult to examine our shopping after a day of pounding the stores! At the end of the day it made no real difference as we literally only used our room for sleeping as we were out and about from dawn til dusk! We would definatley stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: MrH9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Jolly at the start of a tour of north America. The whole stay was very enjoyable with extremely helpful reception staff, especially with booking tours and a generally friendly attitude all round. Room was clean with a big comfortable bed. The continental breakfasts were good and had a wide selection. This hotel is close to Grand Central station, the Chrysler building and not too far a walk to the Empire State. I would definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: oilslick
Reviews.Content: I booked a standard room at Madison Towers through Priceline at $110/night. What steal for Midtown Manhattan. After reading the previous reviews, I was prepared to expect a 50/50 chance of things being good or horrible. Upon arrival, I noticed the lobby was small, but very nice. The pictures of the lobby were pretty accurate. When we checked-in, they complimentarily upgraded our room to a suite! I couldn't believe our luck. The room had a separate living room area with two armchairs and a desk, a marble bathroom, and then a separated sleeping area. The suite was on the small side from what I would expect from a suite, but everything was very clean. If we hadn't been upgraded, I am not sure how the stay would have been according to past reviews. The best parts about the hotel are location (4 blocks from GCT), cleanliness, and generally courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: annetteskye
Reviews.Content: We decided to have a two week holiday in the States, 1week in Vegas where we got married and had the most fantastic week, the second week in NY and it was a week from hell due mainly to this hotel. On arrival at the hotel I thought from the outside that it didn't look bad, once I got into the lift I changed my view, the lift was shabby and the carpets were frayed, bunched up and filthy. Anyway back to my story.... We checked in after a long flight from Vegas to be given a room that only me and my suitcase could fit into, my husband and his were going to have to sleep in the corridor due to the room being tiny. The window was loose and had tissue strategically placed down the sides of it to stop it banging. Underneath the room were excessively noisy generators. About to cry I informed my new hubby that over my dead body would i stay in the tiny, dingy, noisy room and I wanted to find a different hotel. Him, ever the optimist went to the front desk to ask for a different room. Suprisingly enough there weren't any others available other that 1 on the top floor for an extra $75 a night. We looked at the room and on first impressions it looked much better than the first room we were offered. It had been modernised but it smelt of damp, the carpet was wet and looked like someone had been murdered on it, stains and dirt every where and the wall had ' Gill woz ere' scrawled on it. Due to been so tired we took the room and never took our shoes off in the room all week due to the state of the carpets and didn't unpack either because of the damp horrible smell in the room...We did find an Irish bar round the corner though and proceeded to get hammered everynight before going back to the room to ease the experience. The guy in the bar in the hotel (which is dark, damp, depressing and I swear I heard some squeeks coming from behind a plant pot) said the hotel often gives shabby rooms to the English as we do not complain, whereas the Italians and Americans do and therefore get the better rooms. If you are given room 966...walk out. If you get room 1756 look for the blood stains on the carpet..they are not too hard to spot...good luck!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: wenhamhome
Reviews.Content: I'm just about to check out of the Jolly Madison Towers. I travel a great deal and this experience has been well above average. I paid $105 per night for the room on Priceline and when I arrived at 12:30am after a terrible travel day, I was warmly greeted and upgraded to a superior room which is gorgeous. State of the art Italian style. Everything is spotless. Beautiful marble bathroom, room decor lovely and oh the bed was so comfortable! The staff could not be more helpful. The breakfast was very good and the restaurant staff friendly and accommodating. I had read the reviews on TripAdvisor and was quite concerned as to what to expect but I need not have worried. I concede that it is geared towards Italian tourists but no one made me feel ostracized or uncomfortable. I would definitely recommend this hotel for location, friendliness and convenience and will certainly try to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hol in NY”
Reviews.Author: orr27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during a break to celebrate my partner and friends 40th birthdays, (we were 2 couples). I have stayed at this hotel before and whilst I agree with other reviews that it is looking a bit shabby in some areas I have found it clean and comfortable during both stays. This time they upgraded us to a superior room at no extra charge and it was good to have that bit of extra space. We all found the staff to be very friendly and helpful and never once rude. The only exception to this was the restaurant manager who wanted to charge us $257 for a bottle of champagne!! Needless to say we declined to be told that he was the manager and could charge us what he liked. I did speak with the hotel manager as this spoiled an otherwise really nice stay, and would have rated the overall experience higher if it had not been for this incident. Great location

Reviews.Title: “OLD / Tired - Rooms nothing like on the Web !!!”
Reviews.Author: TonyBK
Reviews.Content: Been going NYC 12+yrs, always try differenent hotels. On the web it appears this hotel has nice / modern rooms!! NO...they have just a few small amount of renovated rooms....most are from the 80's old, dirty and shabby! I viewed a few rooms, trying to find one that might be ok - they were all gross! They shoudlnt be allowed to advertise this hotel showing only modern rooms. Worst stay I have ever had in NYC. The room I got was extremely small & didnt even have a safe in it. Difficult to put into words how annoyed i was with the site of the rooms there. The Bar: Geeez - like going back in time.....dark and with a strange smell (mould??). Never again to that one.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Location”
Reviews.Author: Cristina>Neil
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Jolly Madison, excellent locations: 5 minutes from the Empire State Building, 3 minutes from 5th avenue, 10 minutes from Times Square. Breakfast was included that is quite rare for NY hotels. The room was small (if you open the suitcase you are not able to walk in the room), the carpet was a bit old but the room was clean and the bathroom looks like it was just been remade. I would expect someting nicer considering it is a 4*

Reviews.Title: “Good base for seeing the city”
Reviews.Author: tjh78
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel our room was not ready; we were asked to wait and were subsequently upgraded to a superior room. The room was spacious with a large bathroom; it was clean, well presented and came with all the amenities you would expect (TV, iron, hairdryer etc.). The hotel is in a good location for seeing many of the sights, the shops and transportation links. I have seen previous comments about the staff at the hotel - yes, they weren't overly chatty but were helpful and attentive when we needed them. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for travellers to NYC; I would certainly stay there again but would probably pay the extra for a superior room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent New York City Option”
Reviews.Author: ehm1217
Reviews.Content: I found the Jolly Madison to be a delightful change from typical NYC hotel offerings. True the hotel doesn’t offer the luxury some of the bigger names might offer, but it's not as costly either. The room (junior suite) was a decent size by NYC standards and the recently remodeled bath was very nice. Service throughout our stay was fine. Hotel restaurant (5 Terre) was also very nice with superb food -- a bit quiet but again a nice change from the normal noisy eateries found in NYC. A frequent traveler to NYC, I'd never heard of this hotel and found my way there only because a meeting I was attending was held there. The 38th and Madison location is ideal for tourists and businesspeople alike -- a quick walk to the major midtown destinations (theater district, Times Square, Grand Central, Penn Station and so on). I had some concerns given a few of the more negative reviews here, but I didn't experience any of the issues these folks seem to have suffered from. Overall, if you want a nice New York hotel in a good location that won't break your budget the Jolly Madison is one to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it seems”
Reviews.Author: Angie1973
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Jolly Hotel for 4 nights yes it is a great hotel for location but don't expect much more. When we arrived the man at the desk said we were upgraded to a superior room well if ours was superior god help the people staying in a standard. Yes we had a queen sized bed with clean sheets but the bed cover was dirty. The bed took up most of the room leaving hardly any space for us let alone our bags. Some off the staff were pleasent others didn't seem to know much about anything. Again I will say you didn't have to get a taxi anywhere from this hotel location wise it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: JTVancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in January, booked through a package deal. Having been to New York several times I was used to small hotel rooms with no views. But this was smaller than my bedroom at home and faced someone else's window. There was no room for luggage with only 2 feet of floor space around the bed. It was also extremely noisy as we had to leave the window open as our A/C didn't work. The bathroom was quite nice it matched the decor of the lobby but not the shabby hallway and room. Our room and hallway of our floor needed a serious makeover! The hall and our supposed non-smoking room stunk like smoke. The staff was very rude, would literally walk away from the door rather than hold it open, never a greeting was we came and went throughout the week. We noticed that their Italian guests were greeted warmly, helped with getting taxis and directions. It was located close to subway and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our short stay”
Reviews.Author: BantamsBradford
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Jolly for 3 nights, after reading some of the reviews we were very worried about staying here, especially as we had friends staying in the Helmsley. We were pleasantly surprised, the staff were very accomodating, we stayed in a standard room which was very clean and comfortable. It was a little bit small but we did have 4 large suitcases as we were going onto a cruise therefore needed lots of luggage. The bed was huge and the bathroom was brilliant. We had a great view of the ESB. We cannot understand why some people complain as who wants to spend all their time in their hotel room? We will definitely stay here again as the location was great and it was excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and city.”
Reviews.Author: linzinewcastle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the jolly madison from the 10th of april til the 15th. Overall i was really impressed with the hotel all the staff were really friendly, the hotel is in a great location everything is in walking distance. There is a great diner over the road called moonstruck which i would highly recommand the food was nice and a good price. Before i went i emailed the hotel and requested a room with a view of the empire state building and thats what i got when i arrived. I would definatly recommand this hotel and will be going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: MarkBBathEngland
Reviews.Content: Having read numerous reviews on this Hotel it was a case of a leap of faith as to what we would find. Our faith in them was fully justified. On our arrival they were friendly, professional and welcoming. They couldn't do enough for us with regard to information and general help. Staying on the 12th floor at the back kept us away from the street traffic and whilst the room wasn't huge, it was ample for the amount of time we spent in it. After all, we didn't go all that way to spend time in a hotel room! Ok, you could have had more in a higher rated Hotel, but that would have cost! For what we paid for a room in a major international city, we had good service and vaue for money, the location is great with all major attractions easily accessable on foot and they even looked after our bags from check out at 9.30 am until we collected them at 4.00pm free of charge. We will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: MiddlesexMia
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to N.Y stayed at the jolly, after reading reviews before we went, i was a bit worried about what we were letting ourselves in for, BUT was a great hotel very friendly staff, fantastic location i would recommend this hotel to anybody. Only one thing to be careful of,check your bill as they tried to charge for using the mini bar in the room but after speaking to reception and stating we had not used anything they apoligised and credited our account. But overall the hotel was great and the staff more than helpful. would i go again YES.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anon27
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. All the staff were very friendly. In a great location, easy to walk to grand central station, and times square etc. Bar was lovely, spent many an evening in it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Looby100
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the hotel for five nights at the end of Feb 07, we found the hotel to be clean, comfortable, friendly and in a great location. New York was a little overwhelming on arrival and it is difficult to know where to start but a friendly door man was more than happy to give us some great advice and tips on getting around. Our room was of average size but maybe felt a little small due to the enormous bed! ......The bathroom was very modern and the room was cleaned to a high standard daily. We took advantage of the hotels private car service back to JFK, this took away the worry of being over charged by a taxi and I would recommend it, with the driver was ready and waiting for the time we booked it! (The hotel also offered secure baggage storage on day of departure) If you are looking for a fair priced hotel offering comfortable accommodation close to all the main sights of midtown (Empire state, Grand central, Rockefeller centre) then this place should be just right. I was somewhat worried by some revews I had read about the jolly madison but you get what you pay for and as long as you are not expecting a five star hotel for your money then Im sure you will find this a perfect place to rest your head after a hard day sightseeing! Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Hotel a must”
Reviews.Author: julia93
Reviews.Content: We have just returned to England after staying here. Staff really helpful. Beautifully clean. Ideal location with Times square, Broadway, Empire State building almost on the doorstep. Nice relaxing bar. We also had a meal in the restaurant one evening and it could not be better. We will return to this hotel next year could not fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel location”
Reviews.Author: LondonShoppingHeaven
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from this hotel after a 4 night stay. I booked this via our airline website as the location and the 4 star rating was what we were looking for. I reviewed the hotel on this site a few days before we travelled and it did give some concerns, and I tried to change my booking. I am glad to report that the hotel was good, the staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was bigger than we had expected, it was clean and had everything that you would expect from a hotel of its kind. The location was terrific for us, between Times Square and Macy's and a stones throw from Grand Central Terminal and the Chrysler Building, which incidently you can get a coach to and from any of the airports for $27 return which is a good deal. We had a magnificent view of the top of the Empire state building from our bedroom, arriving in the early evening, this did give the 'wow' factor to the hotel. Have only one moan, the rooms were so very hot, and the temperature outside was between 22 - 38f , colder at night, which meant we had the window open and the street/traffic noise to contend with - with New York being what it is, it is never quiet! (Maybe they need to renovate the AC/Heating system?) Would stay there again, no problem. Nice bar in the hotel with a 'Happy Hour' 5-7 (half-price drinks with free antipasti, nice! Great diner opposite as reviewed on this site, great breakfast and good service at Moonstruck. Have a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “The NOT so Jolly Madison Towers”
Reviews.Author: JANETBAYVILLAGE
Reviews.Content: HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE. My friends and I had an absolutely horrible experience and were treated terribly by the staff at the NOT so Jolly Madison Towers. We will never stay there again and have made sure to tell frequent travelers to the area to also steer clear of this hotel. We Were guaranteed a reservation and when we arrived late at night exhausted were told room types were not guaranteed even with a reservation. Staff and Manager tried to give us a tiny room with one bed to share with 3 people!!! After arguing for over 45 minutes and showing them a printout of my reservation, they still tried to charge us for an extra cot and for another person!! They were not one bit accommodating and were extremely rude. They told us they were booked and after finally giving up all of the sudden they had the two bed room I had originally paid for in the first place. Needless to say our Friday night was pretty much shot. For folks in the hospitality business, they are not so hospitable! I would strongly advise staying elsewhere! Oh, and they also got my bill wrong and added extra charges!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience though I can see where people could have hated it”
Reviews.Author: froggybrain
Reviews.Content: Initially booked a superior room through the company travel agent for $185 but found the same room on the hotel website for $165. You should note that this hotel does not list on expedia or travelocity it seems as if a lot of the great independent hotels in NYC do not list on these websites) so you may find a great hotel at a great rate by looking up independent hotels by name. I arrived late on Friday night for my weekend booking and was immediately upgraded to a deluxe room by a friendly italian at the front desk. Another note: the hotel is shaped like an H so the rooms are oddly shaped. We happened to stay in a room ending in --60 which is the 2nd smallest room on the floor. There is another room which ends in --66 which looks to be even smaller and I don't think they would be able to fit a queen sized bed in there (so perhaps this is the much maligned standard room occupied by priceliners). The room itself was beautifully designed, just like the website images though it was showing signs of wear and tear -- namely worn carpeting and slight dents and scuffs on the walls. The bathroom was by far my favourite part of the room, it was seperately heated so that it always felt nice and cozy after a shower. Like most old NY buildings, an occasional clanking noise is heard in the pipes. My boyfriend joked that it sounded like a gremlin trying to get out. The only bad service we received was when I called '0' (customer service) to inquire about luggage storage on our last day and was abruptly told "no" and hung up on before I had time to say thank you. This is my first boutique hotel stay (I usually stay in mid-end hotels) and thought it was well done. I can see how people could have had bad stays because there really appears to be no marker of quality. It is just a matter of what your expectations are (and since this site is full of bad reviews that will lower your expections, you'll no doubt be happy with any small sign of good customer service that you may receive).

Reviews.Title: “Awful - unless you can afford the deluxe rooms”
Reviews.Author: lb78
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 weeks for business in December 2006 - worst hotel I have stayed in worldwide. My colleagues tell me the deluxe rooms are ok - due to our long (and frequent) stays we often get upgraded - but being December, they were fully booked (how?!) and we had to settle for 'superior'. It might be ok for a couple of nights but for the following reasons I am trying to get the hotel removed from our "approved hotels" listing: - No safes in rooms - only safety deposit boxes at reception, for small items only - Very small rooms (even compared to other hotels in NY in the same price range) - Beds are uncomfortable and badly made - I had to remake the bed almost every day just to get a smooth mattress surface, and to enable for the blankets cover me above my waist (I'm only 5'6" - this should not be too hard to achieve)! I also got backache from the mattress for the first time in my life (I'm only 28). - Laundry is frequently late, with items missing, always has to be called for (it is never in the room when you return). My colleague had his returned at 11pm, and was woken up by staff banging on the door who then demanded at tip! Why they can't return it in the day like all the other hotels we stay in I don't know... - Keys are notoriously unreliable and need to be inserted several (I'm talking 50-60 times) into the door before you can enter the room. Even the staff have problems with this (when I admit defeat and they come and help me) and twice they had to call the maintenance person to let me into my room. Yet they refuse to acknowledge that there is a problem with the technology. - Breakfast is minimal - but nearby delis are plentiful. - Housekeeping frequently forget to replace certain items like bathmats, small towels etc. There are plenty of other hotels for similar rates nearby - I advise you to go elsewhere unless you are just looking for somewhere for a night or two and won't be bothered by the above irritations - as I agree that the location is good. I will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: oli-bob
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed at the Jolly Madison Towers in January 2007. We loved it. we thought it was clean, friendly and excellently located in NYC. We were amazed at how easy it was to orientate yourself from the hotel. The staff were happy to help, as it was our first time in New York. They provided us with a map, which allowed us to find our way around as if we had been there before. THe hotel, as said above, was truly amazing. Cannot wait to return to the Jolly Madison Towers early 2008. Althought some reviews discredit this hotel. I feel that you would have to be mighty picky to find faults with the Jolly Madison, after all, your in NYC you do not spend time in your hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: RUNABOUT919
Reviews.Content: A Friend and I stayed here and were both were very impressed with the place. The staff was friendly and the hotel exceeded my expectations by far. The place was immaculate and so beautiful upon entrance. I am the type to be very picky about cleanliness...I look behind things and in corners, and I did not see any dirt anywhere.
