I can't wait to go back to NYC with my husband and we will most certainly stay at Jolly Madison. You can't beat the price, location and the quality.

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect”
Reviews.Author: Megan B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just this past weekend (Friday-Saturday). The service was excellent & the staff polite. The room was small but we got everything we asked for - clean, non-smoking room with king sized bed. Plus a cool view of the street below (not a dumpster or alleyway). We had driven into the city so the staff parked our car in a nearby garage as soon as we arrived. And when we left later the next day, our bags, which had been in storage because we needed to checkout before noon, were neatly placed & hung in the car. Even the car itself was warmed up (it was a sub zero weekend). I would definitely return to this hotel. It was small overall but it certainly exceeded my expections (I often stay at five star hotels) & served us well. I also loved the fact that we were able to walk to just about everywhere we needed to be (i.e. theater) If you are looking for grand, your best bet is to look elsewhere. But if you are looking for a cheap, comfortable, clean place to hang your hat after a busy day in the Big Apple, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “stayed here 3 times already”
Reviews.Author: floseimann
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 times already, i worked for JollyHotels in Europe so i always got Staffrate and a nice room with a good view ! The perfect location for a stay in NYC, im going to New York again at the end of February 2007, unfortunially i dont work for Jolly anymore and the normal rate is too expensive for me ! Maybe the still offer me a better rate, we will see ! I would recommend this hotel to my friends and would stay there any time again ! It is also worth a stay at a normal rate. Look at my pics to get some impessions of this hotel,

Reviews.Title: “So Bad we left!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dmprin
Reviews.Content: We booked our rooms on priceline for a long weekend stay in NYC. I was nervous due to some reviews I had read online about problems at this hotel. I have been to Italy and figured since they were an Italian chain I would be ok with a small room, etc. We checked in and one of our rooms was a good size room, a view down to the street with a giant dumpster ( I can deal with this after all it's NY ) The room across the hall was cramped, dark and dingy. In other reviews people said the bathrooms were nice. Not the case, there was mold on the tiles and did not feel clean never mind look clean. The bed was like a banana, a full bed for two to sleep on. We asked to be moved and the staff was very rude. I was down in the lobby and overheard many italians checking in and they seemed to get much better service from the staff. We asked twice to be moved to one of the renovated rooms and were told they were booked. Finally we were offered a room but would have to pay another $150.00 per night. There was no room service menu, although it states online they have it I never saw it. There is no gym or workout room, we had to pay $25.00 a day to go to a gym close by. The carpets in the hallways and rooms were peeling themselves up as if they were begging to be removed. We left a day early abandoned 2 fully paid rooms, pricelined from the lobby for two more rooms and finished our stay at the Sheraton Towers in times square. I have NEVER left a hotel before. Don't stay here! The sheraton was soooo nice after being at the Jolly.

Reviews.Title: “Many Pro's and Con's”
Reviews.Author: Luna159
Reviews.Content: I actually stay at this hotel quite often but only because it really is very convenient for my purposes. Otherwise the con's outweigh the Pro's. Pros: -The Deluxe rooms are beautiful if you can afford them -Food at the restaurants is delicious -You can hear live jazz at the bar -extremely convenient to all midtown locations -very easy to get a cab outside -rooms usually clean, no bathtub mold, clean smell, I have never seen any insects -I find the beds comfortable, but I like hard beds! -hotel is mostly quiet -you can get really good last minute rates NOW For the Cons: -Standard rooms are ridiculously small, like when you sit in the bathroom you feel like everyone in the hall can hear you! -The Standard and Superior rooms are just too darn dark. -the room decor with the hideous orange florentino bedspread is depressing -a request for extra towels can take an hour or usually they never arrive -staff is really rude as people say. even though I am a frequent client, I never get a "hi, how are you". -Its true that they treat Italians better. My first time there, my room was not ready. There was also three Italians whose room was also not ready. They were invited to sit in the lounge and were given a free drink. I was summarily ignored. anyway.... -air conditioners usually dont work or will freeze you. -if you find a room at a really really cheap rate, its usually next to a linen room where someone is slamming the door all night. -mini-bars are not cold enough and alot of the snacks are outdated! -Often TV's and radios have horrible reception -In the morning, you had better put up your "do not disturb" sign because the guy who refills the mini-bars POUNDS on your door and doesnt give you a second to respond before he barges in. -If you book a Superior, be wary as they will stick you in a Standard and charge you the same price! I think its 50/50 how your own trip will go.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Suzieg18
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Jolly madison towers at the end of April this year. We booked the holiday as a package through United vacations and we couldn't fault one thing about it. The staff were so friendly and made us feel really valued. I booked the trip for my partners birthday and faxed the hotel a week before we arrived to advise them of this. When we arrived there was a special birthday greeting which was a nice touch. The hotels location was great, we could see the empire state building from our room, it was an amazing view. We could get to all the main sites so easily as the sightseeing bus and tube were just around the corner. I would definatley stay at this hotel again if we return to New York.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL IN GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: MILESATUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to receive mixed reviews on this site, but I am glad to say that myself and my partner had a fantastic stay. We stayed in a superior room, which to be honest, would be like an average room in any other hotels. This hotel offers standard, superior, delux rooms and a penthouse suite. I believe the standard rooms are very small and in need of a lick of paint. If you have the choice, book a superior room and you won't have a problem. I think a lot of the negative reviews of this hotel were from people in standard rooms. We had no trouble from the staff; always very helpful and courtious. Manny (one of the doormen) was particually friendly. The hotel will retain $25 a day on your credit card as a security guarantee, but will refund that in full at check out. The hotel is in a brilliant position (madison avenue & 38th Street). 5th avenue is 2 minutes walk, empire states building is 8 minute walk, time sq about a 10 minute walk. We walked everywhere, and the hotel is in a great safe location. We had breakfast in the diner opposite called Moonstruck. Great food and service. Would recommend you take your breakfasts here, as the hotel's breakfast is expensive and average from what i have been told. You must take a horse drawn carriage in central park (at north end of 5th avenue) which is $34 for about 20 - 30 minutes carriage ride. Plenty of shopping in 5th avenue, great atmosphere in times sq and macy's is a must. Our first time to NYC. You feel safe, never threatened, people are great. Will go again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect In Every Way!”
Reviews.Author: josiasmason
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Jolly Madison. First off..it's a great location, minutes from the Subway, Grand Central and a quick cab right to the airports. We arrived early in the day and of course room was not ready (it was 11 am so did not expect it to be). We had booked online at Quik Books and booked a room with two twin beds. When we arrived at about 6 pm to check in they informed us of our good luck that we had been upgraded to a junior Suite. Small little living room (they came and made up the little sleeper sofa), big bedroom with king bed, huge bathroom with glassed in shower & huge tub. Lovely bathroom amenities, in room internet availability. Called concierge to ask about Gordon Ramseys new restaurant and she promptly called me back with the phone number I requested. Bellman was fantastic, held our bags and flagged down a cab on Madison Ave. for us. Beautiful bar with a fireplace. There's a little Bistro right next door as well. I highly recommend this place...especially if you can get an upgrade! Very nice front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “A huge relief!”
Reviews.Author: quijano
Reviews.Content: Arrived very apprehensively to the hotel after reading the negative remarks. We were happily suprised. Staff very pleasant, rooms and bathrooms spotlessly clean, although on the small side. Our rooms had no natural light, but with the lights on were ok. Air conditioning worked (was necessary in November!), although noisy from the inside and outside where the vents are. However, the hotel is in the middle of NYC and the noise didn't bother us overmuch - the situation is much more important, and the Jolly was in a perfect location for shopping and tourism. Breakfasted across the road in the Moonstruck deli (opens at 7 am for the jet lagged). I would certainly go back there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bckrSTHLM
Reviews.Content: The Madison is a nice small hotel. THAT IS; IF YOU BOOK ONE OF THE NEWLY RENOVATED MODERN DESIGNED ROOMS. The bar is boring. GREAT location, friendly staff, nice room, GREAT bahtroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great city, great location, hotel disappointing”
Reviews.Author: DustMite
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in mid-town off Madison Avenue and very near to the Empire State Building, the Chrysler Building, Grand Central Terminal and the NY Public Library etc. We booked a standard room, as we didn't anticipate spending much time there. We expected the room to be a bit dark, because of other high buildings around - and it was ! Thankfully, we only slept there ....... well, we slept intermittently. . Our air con was inadequate, so we resorted to keeping the window open but we were at the back with what must have been the very noisy air con shaft. The room was rather shabby and definitely in need of redecoration. The wardrobe was just an odd shaped cupboard with barely enough room. Tea and coffee-amking facilities would have been extremely welcome, rather than a mini-bar. Thankfully we we were "room only" - breakfast was disappointing and very expensive ..... dried up pastries, croissants etc and canned fruit. We found Burger Heaven nearby and breakfasted like kings for a fraction of the price - smiley staff and fresh fruit salad ! However, we had a fantastic time in New York and would go again tomorrow if we could - but not to this hotel. D & L Cambridge UK

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Chevette
Reviews.Content: I was visiting New York with my husband for my 50th birthday. When the bell boy showed us to our room he joked that spider man didnt really exist. As soon as he opened the door I realised what he meant. The room was so close to the next building that you had to have the light on even during the day. I went straight to reception and they agreed to upgrade us. The next room was slightly bigger and on a corner which meant there was daylight. However the previous occupants toe nail clippings were still on the bathroom floor and their used tissues were under the bed. When my husband pulled back the counterpane he found a scattering of pastry crumbs on top of the sheet which also had a hole in it. The hotel is very very tired and shabby, the carpets in the room and corridors are very dirty, rucked and frayed. No way is this a four star hotel,apart from the cost. Avoid the bar as well which is not only dark and dingy (probably to hide the dirt) but a whisky and coke and pint of Samual Adams beer cost $17. This hotel certainly gave me a birthday to remember!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bad service at Jolly Hotel Madison Towers”
Reviews.Author: shipshoveller
Reviews.Content: The room was very small, one suitcase just about filled the available floor area. A curtain was missing, the air conditioning was ineffective and extremely noisy. It was quieter to open a window! An 11th floor window should not be able to be fully opened. The hair dryer did not work and the replacement sounded like a motor bike. A light bulb didn't work and the room was not very clean. It was impossible to get a good night's sleep and there was a general impression that the management just don't care.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: NewYork1974
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site, I was very concerned about staying at the Jolly Madison. I wouldnt be put off by these bad reviews as I had no problems at all with this hotel. On checking in, I was upgraded to a Superior Room with a view of the empire state building for no charge. The rooms were ample size, clean and the bed was huge. All of the staff at the hotel couldnt have been any friendlier with us throughout our stay. The staff even went out of their way to sort out a problem i was having with a trip that id booked though a third party company. I wouldnt normally bother with writing a review, but after the magnificent time we had at this hotel, ive feel I need to give it the credit its due. I paid $245 per night. Stayed 1st - 6th October. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pests not guests”
Reviews.Author: Holly87
Reviews.Content: Our 'great Italian welcome' consisted of a full scale row between a male and female receptionist. Unfortunately it was a sign of things to come. The front desk staff [doormen and receptionists] were sulky, condescending, rude and obnoxious in varying measures throughout the week [with the notable exceptions of Jose and Eduardo]. On our last day we ordered a cab from the front desk to the airport for 5.45pm - it never arrived [we had been told by a doorman that it would be double the price from the street]. At 6.00pm we told the doorman that we had to leave as we were in a hurry to catch our flight, I went outside the hotel to hail a cab. The driver was putting our cases in the boot when Roy and two Italian looking doormen approached him. They said something to him which made him apologise profusely to them, the driver then told us he wouldn't be able to take us to the airport afterall. I looked and all of the doormen had gone back into the hotel. We went around the corner and got a cab there - which turned out to be the same price as the hotel had quoted - not double at all. We were lucky in that we didn't experience any other problems while we were there, but the staff are very cranky. Even asking for access to the safety deposit boxes is an issue. Location is great - rooms were okay [they don't deserve the three stars], didn't have any meals there as I'm sure I'd have choked to death on the atmosphere alone!! The barman was as rude as the doorstaff, really felt that we were interrupting his star gazing when we had a gall to ask for a drink! An unbelieveable when you consider that service staff in the states allegedly rely on tips to survive!!

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hazedave
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BID 3 STAR MIDTOWN SOUTH!!! Or you may get this barely 2.5 star hotel. I have pricelined rooms since day one of priceline. I have stayed in cities all over the world, and never had a problem. I have booked at least 10 rooms in NYC this year and have had wonderful experiences. That is until I received The Jolly Madison Towers Hotel via a $120 bid on priceline. When I walked in, I knew it was trouble. The lobby was dingy, the walls marred with scratches, pictures askew. The front desk pleasant enough. Get to room and see two twin beds. Now, I had called and requested a double, and I know there is no guarantee. HOWEVER, when I saw the condition of this filthy room, the softness of the beds, the threadbare bedding...I figured the hotel would accommodate with a double. Wrong! I was told totally sold out, etc. I had my laptop with me and asked why I could still get doubles online for that night through their website. "Well sir, you did bid via priceline, and this is what you get" Fine. I sucked it up, figured I'd only sleep here. Went out for evening. Came back to find a hallway filled with Chinese menu's, (nice security letting people upstairs to place take out menus under each door!) and crumbs ground into the carpeting. Wait, even better...there was a mouse nibbling away on the crumbs. Key card doesn't work, I go back to the front desk. Told what we saw. The condition of the room, said I am not sleeping on the floor, want to move. Guy at desk actually fakes hitting a button on the computer, says we're sold out. I lean over and look at screen and there is NOTHING there. I say you're faking looking up rooms. Do not insult me. He knew he was had at this point, and set about to just stand his ground. "Well sir, you pricelined this, and that's the room you get for that!" If you want another room, it's $100 plus tax." I demand to speak with a manager. He says none on duty (it was 12:40 AM) I said, then I want to leave a message. He FAKES pushing a button or two, then pretends to have a conversation with a manager. It was the most obvious fake conversation. He comes back "Yeah, it's $100" I said, let me speak to the manager. "I can't do that sir, he just told you the answer. He will not talk to a customer” I said, let me talk to him now, or else. He refuses to call back (since he never made a call anyway) Then proceeds to tell me that perhaps in the future I shouldn't use priceline to book a hotel room, to be ensured I get a good room. I just about lost my mind here. The Italian temper took over and I contained myself (well more like my girlfriend did) I rather strongly said if the hotel participates in priceline, I am still entitled to proper service. We left lobby after I let out a little more anger (I know at this point being nice was getting me no where) He was now faking calling the police. I told him send them on up to my room, I haven't done anything wrong. Needless to say, no cops came. We get in room, A/C was loud as can be. The mattresses were from 1980’s and best of all, we found bugs in the room. That was it. We packed up and left. There was no one at the front desk, so I called this man and told him we were checking out. Got his name and have now filed complaint with priceline, The Jolly Corp and my credit card. Bottom line: STAY AWAY! Being lied to about room availability, made to feel like a second class citizen, fake phone calls. This was single handedly the WORST experience I've ever had in a hotel, and I stay in many a year. Still flabbergasted.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Bems
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to NYC so wanted to be somewhere central. Position was excellent. Able to walk to most places. Having stayed in many Italian hotels in Italy I was disappointed with the standard of this one. Our two teenage sons were give a room with an air conditioner which sounded like a 747 taking off. (As we had arrived in the middle of the heatwave, the air conditioning was essential). When we asked if they could be moved, the girl on reception was extremely unhelpful and said there was nothing wrong with it. We stood our ground and they were moved to a much better room. Our room was tiny and dark. If we had been staying any longer we would have asked to have moved. For the price we were paying, I felt it was poor value and certainly not worth the four stars. Some of the staff were very helpful and friendly, particularly the doormen but a couple of the reception staff were really disinterested. We were three weeks in the US, three days in NYC and we stayed in many different sorts of hotels and inns - this was our least favourite.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Clean & Cool”
Reviews.Author: Basementjackal
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews about this hotel I was quite concerned. I had bid on this hotel at Priceline and thought that I was way underbidding when they took my offer. The hotel room was micro small with 2 twin beds; the view was of 4 brick walls. The bathroom was the nicest part of the room; it was a typical hotel bathroom only it was done in marble. The air worked fine (Several reviewers have said the air didn't work) My wife even complained to me that I was keeping the room too cold! The hotel staff was nice enough however we didn't ask for anything. We were on the 10th floor and I felt like the hotel was very safe. There were no closets and nowhere to put luggage though, not even any drawers. We stacked our luggage in the corner of the room. Overall I would say that this hotel is not 3 stars as it is rated it is probably 2 stars but for the price I paid I was completely satsified. ($75.00 per night) The hotel is close to everything, and my wife and I were not in the room much anyway. I would stay there again and could reccomend it to anyone who just wants a safe, clean place to rest before exploring the city. If your looking for a place with alot of amenities and space go someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: katypaul
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews was a bit nervous on arrival however pleasantly suprised. Reception staff friendly and helpful. The room was large enough, clean, cool and had all facilities with a huge bed! The lifts were fast and the location great! Free safety deposit boxes although in reception for valuables.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: Capitol_Explorer
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel through priceline-- and I felt as if I was treated like a second class citizen for paying a reduced rate. Beyond the other reviews that state the rooms are small and the beds are less than comfortable (all true), my phone in the room and TV did not work. Upon bringing this to the attention of the front desk, they were less than helpful. I think the icing on the cake was that I noticed I was the only one on my floor without a morning paper. When I asked about this, I was told "your room does not get one." I think the location is fine -- close to Grand Central, but not necessarily in the middle of the most exciting neighborhood for tourist, probably better for business. The decor of the hotel is inviting and with it being an Italian hotel change, there are a lot of foreign tourists, which adds to the atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your credit card statement”
Reviews.Author: Bernard35
Reviews.Content: Stayed st this hotel in June 2006. The basic rooms are appalling - small and depressing and to be honest the hotel chain (Jolly Hotels) should be ashamed of them. We obtained an upgrade to a deluxe room which was of a standard you expect from such a hotel (in the UK equivalent to a 3/4 star hotel. The basic rooms do not even warrant one star). Service at reception was OK but nothing to write home about but it is true the hotel is in a great location. The worst aspect however occurs AFTER checking out. My subsequent credit card statement included a charge by the hotel for something I know nothing about (in addition to the agreed additional charges). Even worse the hotel failed to reply to e mails requesting a refund and e mails to the hotel chain head office in Italy have so far not produced replies. Fortunately my credit card company are taking it seriously and have credited my account. BUT what about the hotel - why have they done NOTHING and how many other people have been overcharged this way? Perhaps those who have will notify this site so we can approach the police!! BEWARE

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel for the price, good location”
Reviews.Author: MarkieG
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed here from jan 9th 2006 to jan 16th 2006. We booked through Uk travel agent Thomson and asked for a superior room. When we arrived check-in was fast and efficient. The bell-hop helped us with our bags as we had 2 large cases each but he insisted on carrying them up and not using a trolley. When he showed us our room we where at first quite dissapointed as we had booked a 'superior' room based on the information provided on the Jolly Madison's website. The pictures showed one room but the room we first got was not that room. We gave the bell-hop a $5 tip as this was a recommended price i had read before visiting NY. As soon as i had had a shower i went down to reception to mention the fact that the room was not the room we had paid for. his records apparently showed we had booked a standard room but the invoice i showed him from Thomson stated superior. The staff there was on a whole friendly even though at first nothing could be done regarding our room. We had a call whilst we where out, after staying in the standard room for one night, and a message was left to say that a superior room had became availible at no extra cost so we called down to have our bags moved. Even though we should not have had this trouble to start with i was happy that something had been done about it. The standard room is very small in size and harldy had space for our cases but the superior room was perfect in size and i couldnt have asked for a better room for what we paid (£700 each). We didnt eat or order room service in the hotel as we where always out in the city with it being our first time in America, let alone New York. We are definately going back to New York but not til September 2007 due to work commitments. I have started my research for a hotel now but am strongly considering going back to Jolly madison as i had no major complaints. My only problem was that if we had assistance from a bell-hop or concierege in anyway they would almost request a tip from you. I do believe in tipping but not on a compulsary basis. If i receive good service then i will tip but if a person is just doing their job and offers me nothing extra then why should i give them extra money. Like when i was leaving the hotel one morning one staff member held the door for me and my girlfriend and then held his hand out for a tip. I just walked off as there was no way he was getting money for that. Overall the hotel is nice. Little things like paint cracking off (on the roof) in the bathroom is apparently expaected in NY hotels, the hallway carpets looked rough around the edges, there was a strange smell about the hotel (maybe damp), the air con (which we had on all the time even though it was winter) turns itself to heat during the night so every night we both woke up due to the heat in the room so ended up sleeping with the windows open in the snow. See Pictures attached also.

Reviews.Title: “great location, views, linens”
Reviews.Author: ramblegal
Reviews.Content: hotel upgraded me to a deluxe corner room with a view of the empire state building - I hated to leave in the morning. frette linens & robe, marble bathroom, electric kettle with a selection of teas, flat-screen tv, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: pmorena
Reviews.Content: Was attending a state conference held at this hotel and recent reviews made me question how good the accomodations would be but I was delighted to find the staff, the room,and the continental breakfast were all top notch! And, if you're not eating at the hotel, there are delighful and reasonably-priced coffee shops and grocery stores right around the corner. Be sure to order cappuccino - both from the hotel's continental breakfast or the local shops - Yummy!

Reviews.Title: “City that never sleeps - neither did we!!!”
Reviews.Author: PAEWirral_England
Reviews.Content: The room we were allocated was at the back on the 10th floor over the air conditioning shafts - too noisy to open the window, too noisy to have the air conditioning on. Room was suffocatingly small. I complained straight away and was told there were no other rooms that day but they could change the following morning - just leave the bags and go out for the day. Came back to a bigger, birghter but much noisier room on the 7th floor - couldn't understand why they had moved me to a worse position even though I asked. They had one other but it was deluxe on 14th floor and would be $100 extra per night - when I looked it had a vent shaft just outisde the window - still noisy. We kept the room we had but were we sorry. If you are going to stay here, please ask about the construction work on 38th street. There was a block opposite our room that was having the insides ripped out during the day and at night - from 12.00 - 3.00am - the crushers came and compressed the concrete, metal and debris from the days demolition. This is in addition to the usual NY noise, traffic, horn blowing, emergency vehicles, etc. It made very little difference whether the windows were open or shut as the double glazing is not very good. When I complained again they said there was nothing they could do about the noise and New Yorkers didn't like it either. Found pharmacy that sold sleeping tablets which did help. There was not one single minute of the day or night that you could just relax. This is the first time I have been to New York and if I returned I would stay somewhere quieter, like a platform at Grand Central Station!! On the plus side, the guys that carry your bags are very cheery but this isn't the main reason why you would choose to stay in a hotel is it?

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel for 'Trailfinders'”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Standing on the corner of East 38th Street and Madison Avenue, (a 10/15 minute walk from the Empire State Building and Macy's on 32nd Street) this was a fairly central location for the aforementioned Empire State and Macy's as well as the Chrysler Building, Times Square, Grand Central Terminal to name but a few - All within easy walking distance of the Hotel. The staff were genial and friendly. The concierge on duty the day of our departure, Jose, organised a stretch Limo which we shared with another couple as our airport shuttle to Newark. It actually worked out slightly cheaper than a Taxi would have cost. Our room which was on the ninth floor overlooked the gap between the buildings at the rear, with the corresponding noise from the building's ventilation systems when the window was open (which it had to be because of the heat in the room). I never thought to try and upgrade to a room with a view or one with air conditioning as I have read in some of the other reviews. For this I can't really blame the Hotel although it might have been nice to know that the option was there. The room was clean for the most part although there was a little dirt on a pillowcase and a couple of hairs on the sheets that we could not account for. We got the distinct impression that the bed linen had not been changed but we couldn't swear to it. Other than that the room was fine although quite small. Using Trailfinders as we always do on medium-long haul trips we expected a little more for our money and it is for this reason more so than any other that we felt a little hard done by, as Trailfinders has always provided us with our expectations worth, in the past. But maybe such is the way of it with New York Hotels!?!! However all this said, it was a great location and what problems(?) there were, they did not deter us from enjoying this incredible and wondrous city.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Elise2929
Reviews.Content: On arrival at this hotel it looked ok, good location, the staff weren't overally firendly, the reception area is small and the hotel doesn't flow, it was a bit weird trying to find the bar. The rooms are very small and was put by the lift on a smoking floor, very noisy!. As the rooms are small and the standard rooms are situated around the inside of the hotel, they are dark and the airconditioning units are at the base of the atriu and can be noisy. Request a room on one of the higher floors to get a bit more light. The room were quiet but the air conditioning unit was under the window and didn't make a difference to the feel of the room which at time was very hot! Bathroom was nice but didn't make up for the standard rooms. If possible pay the extra and upgrade. The hotels web site doesn't show the standard rooms and there is a reason why, was overall disappointed in this hotel for New York!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again, convenient and clean”
Reviews.Author: odyssey21
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 20th to 22nd April 2006. Got an upgrade (but no view of Chrysler building) which was nice, although not sure how much more special it was than a standard room. Large number of Italians here as it is part of an Italian group. Staff helpful particularly the concierge. Didn't eat in the hotel (including breakfast). French style bistro next door was great for breakfast. Paid about £150 per night room only, which wasn't bad in NY at the minute. Room fairly spacious and very clean. Only critisism was the aircon which was needed during the night but was noisy. Easy to reach Empire State (superb view) and 5th Ave shops as wellas walkable to Briadway shows (15 mins). Went to Dirty Rotten Scoundrels with Jonathan Pryce and Norbert Leo Butz which was fantastic, a must see!! Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: crooked_77
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 days over valentines week and this included the blizzard of NYC! Staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. We asked to upgrade to a deluxe room at check-in with a view of the Empire State and were offered 2 rooms to choose from by the friendly reception staff. Both were really chatty and seemed happy to be working there, bantering with each other as to which of the rooms had the best view! The doorman/concierge helped us with our bags and he continued to chat to us when he saw us throughout the rest of our trip. Sol(?) on Reception, who'd helped us upgrade, chatted to us about the best places to go to eat/drink and shop on our first couple of days there and always said hello when he saw us. The doorman organised a cool old lincoln to take us to the airport (miles more expensive than the train had been to get to Penn Station on arrival but what the hell, we were on holiday!). Hotel room was a decent size for us and kept immaculately clean by the friendly daily maid service. Our TV remote was broken on arrival, when we asked for a replacement Sol had a working one in our room before we'd returned from the local food shop (literally just downstairs). It's in a great position on 38th & Madison, which is about 5-10 mins from Grand Central on 42nd (get a metrocard!) and the Empire State/Macys etc on 34th Street. It took us about 20/25 mins to walk to Times Square and there are tons of great restaurants/bars on the doorstep. Central Park in the snow was absolutely amazing (and was recommended by Sol at the hotel). I'm really glad we chose to stay there and would do so again in a second. New York as a city is amazing and I think we found the perfect base to enjoy it from!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: travelworks
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Jolly Madison Towers with my husband and 10 year old daughter March 20-24. Our room was on the 6th floor looking into the air shaft between the buildings. What we lacked in view was made up for by the lack of noise - we never heard any street noise at all. We were in a standard room with two double beds, and the room was quite adequate for our needs. I would estimate the size of the room at 14 ft. by 20 ft., with the TV atop a cabinet containing the minibar. The room also had two small chairs with a small table between them, and a fairly large desk. The closet also had a small chest of drawers for storage. The bathroom, while small, was pretty marble. Our room was always clean and there were plenty of towels, but you must ask for washcloths. We should remember that Jolly is an Italian chain, and is pretty much the Italian equivalent of a Holiday Inn. The staff was always courteous and friendly. Manny, one of the doormen, was extremely kind to our daughter and very helpful with suggestions and recommendations. Most of the guests seemed to be Italian business people, not many tourists. The rate we paid for the room included continental breakfast daily, served in restaurant on the mezzanine. It was typical European continental including breads, meats, cheeses, tomatoes, fruit and sweetrolls. Being on the corner of 38th and Madison was very convenient, 4 blocks from Grand Central, 8 blocks from Times Square, 4 blocks from the Empire State Building. All in all, our stay here was very good and we would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fantastic time. Upgraded for a small price to a deluxe room with an amazing view of the Empire state building. location was great, in walking distance to almost everything. if not Grand central staion was just a couple of blocks away. we did have a problem with the heating not working but the heater in the bathroom was really hot and we were offered to change room but as we were settled we said we'd prefer to stay where we were so they gave us a small portablt heater which was all we needed. the room was a great size, big enough for both big cases and plenty of shopping bags. couldn't fault the hotel or the staff. would go back!

Reviews.Title: “not so great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: picture makes it seem special, but its pretty generic. one gripe: no curtains on the windows. had to rig up blankets on the windows in order to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: just back from a 5 night stay at the Jolly Madison and had a great time. On reading previous reviews I had become concerned if I had chosen the right hotel but I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The door staff were a friendly welcome, check in couldn't have been easier, the room and bathroom were a little on the small side but we spent a minimal amount of time in them so weren't bothered in the slightest as they were cleaned impeccably every day. Reception helped us arrange our bus tour of NY, the door staff gave us a great suggestion for somewhere to eat breakfast( P.S. diner - 1 block east )when we asked for somewhere reasonable and we went back every morning of our stay. Hotel itself is 2 blocks from Empire State where you can get the open top bus tour from, 5 minute walk from busiest part of 5th Avenue and Times Square - and a 5 minute taxi ride from ANYWHERE on the island. Couldn't have a better time, sure it was mainly the destination that made the holiday but having a comfortable place to go back to after a long day does count.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading other people's reviews, we had mixed expectations about what to expect. We were made aware of the fact that some people thought the rooms were small, so this give us the advantage of asking beforehand for a good room if possible. We were not disappointed, the location was excellent and we found the staff at reception pleasant and helpful. We would definitely recommend it to other people. We booked this hotel through Hotel Connect, who were the cheapest operator that we came across.

Reviews.Title: “Made to feel like pests not guests”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Jolly Madison ecstatic to be in New York for our Engagement.After a long flight tired but excited things soon went down hill! we showed reception our booking confirmation which the Girl on the desk dismissed & said "we have'nt got any confirmation of this booking" she then offered us a standard room instead of the deluxe room we booked until they sorted it with the company(Lets go 2).This was fair enough until we later found out our credit card was blocked for $1,200 $300per night for a standard room!!!!!!! subsequently meaning if we wanted to purchase anything we could'nt!!!!!!!! saving grace was we are'nt married yet so we have seperate cards not joint names.Whenever we asked the staff for anything we felt like we had just taken there months wages,they were very unhelpful.besides the hotel being 99% bad the porters(Eduardo especialy)& 1 male receptionist who told us the attractions of New York were the only thing that will help tourists.we were made to feel like we came off the street to sneak a room for a few nights.rooms were clean,towels changed regular but would avoid hotel at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for great price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our brief stay at Jolly. We booked through Priceline for a great price, then read some not-so-nice reviews. But we were pleasantly suprised by the decent room size, quite clean everything, quiet/calm feel, great location and GREAT price. The front desk staff gave us no problems and bellman were very helpful. They will charge $48+ for valet parking overnight (we were charged $54 for having a large car), but we expected that in NYC. We walked to much (Empire State Bldg, Times Square, Rockefeller Cntr, Madison Sq. Garden) and took public transit to the rest (Grand Central Station is only two blocks away). We will stay here again and highly recommend it. Not at all disappointing for 3-Star hotel in such a location!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and thats about it!!”
Reviews.Author: Moots2004
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here from 5th - 10th Jan. Got an upgrade to a "superior" room by mentioning that it was a trip for both our birthdays. The room was clean if small but then it is New York and most hotel rooms are small. The "superior" room is what you would expect a standard hotel room to be, so make sure you try and get one of these at the very least. Doorman were really great and very helpful, rest of the staff were rude and didn't offer any help at all. Drinks in the bar were very pricey ($16 for a beer and G&T!! + tip!! which the barman did not deserve!!) didn't make a return visit! Location, location, location is what this hotel excels at. Use it as a base. Eat and drink out (as we did) and you will have a great time. Empire state building, Grand Central Station, Chrysler building, Times Square & Rockefeller Centre are within a 15min walk (some are closer than that.) Designer shops on fifth ave are a 45min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: lucaerrante
Reviews.Content: Good midtown location, rude and unfriendly staff, tiny rooms, even smaller bathrooms, no business center, unadequate value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChristiNY
Reviews.Content: We traveled to New York City for a concert at MSG. We could have booked a cheaper hotel but looked around for something nice to treat ourselves. We found this hotel and booked two nights with their "amore special". This special was supposed to include the room for two nights, champagne, roses, A free dinner for us and continental breakfasts brought to our room in the AM. When we first checked in we noted the room was a little smaller than it looked in the photos and the bathroom was nothing like they showed it in their online ad. We had dinner the first night downstairs after a long trip around 8:30PM and then retired to the room for the night. The next day breakfast was outside the door (like the special said it was supposed to be) and we lounged around and rested until leaving about 4pm to go out to dinner and attend the concert. We came back from the concert at around 11:30pm only to find that the door to out room was ajar and the lights we had turned off were on. We also noted missing things, like a CD player with a CD in it and a bottle of perfume which was taken out of the bag in the bathroom. Security was called and my fiancee went down to report the break in. The security guard came to the room and while he was there a woman across the hall opened her door to tell the security officer that she had heard someone going in and out of the room about an hour before we had returned from the concert. There was no way it was housekeeping because the bed was not made up nor were there any new towels or bathroom items added that we used that morning. We had all of our credit cards with us and nothing else seemed to be missing. we were told that we would be called about the break in. The next morning, breakfast was again outside the door and we hurridly got ready to leave and went to check out on the TV as we usually do when we noted that we had been charged for our dinner, both morning continental breakfasts which angered us. We had to leave or we would have missed the train so we called the office and were told to call the next day and they would take care of it. We called and wrote to the hotel. We emailed them and faxed them. Nothing. We were never even apologized to for the break in and we were never reimbursed for the dinner and the continental breakfasts (Coffees, danish, juice charged 32.00 each AM) I am still trying to get them to reimburse us for the dinner and the breakfasts because it was supposed to be included in the package but I doubt we will ever hear from them again. We spoke with people who had stayed at the pennsylvania hotel across from MSG and they paid less than half of what we paid and had better rooms and service. I highly recommend that if you go to this hotel, that you check in and make sure they have the package marked and do not leave by dicharging yourself by the TV services. I am so dissapointed in this hotel and when I have called, I have been told very sarcastically that they cannot help me on the phone and I have to write. when I write, they do not respond to my letters. There are plenty of other hotels in the area which are cheaper and nicer and do not take advantage of their clients. The Jolly Madison did a "switch and Bait" and I did not expect this from a hotel of this size and ratings. Very very poor service and do not assist their guests. Also, while we were there, the phone lines were down and no calls could be made from our room except to the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Laurence Zing
Reviews.Content: My wife, myself and our good friends booked to stay here in December, to celebrate my 40th Birthday. My wife and i were upgraded to a luxury room which was roomy and well equiped. There were problems with the TV reception, but we were not in New York to watch TV. I couldn't quite get the heating to work to the temperature which we would have wanted either, and with outside temperatures never above freezing, extra warmth would have been welcomed. Generally it would be unfair to rate this hotel other than above average. There was an issue with a bar bill which was not ours but this was credited after some discussion with the staff at reception. Location was fantastic with shops and sights well within walking distance. Good all round although possibly on the pricey end of the market, but this is a big city so it is expected.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: Vistar
Reviews.Content: Our business team reserved 5 deluxe rooms for 2 nights. All rooms were sparkling clean, decorated with quality European furnishings, comfortable beds, starched sheets and terrazo tile shower/baths. The rooms were small. One of our group commented that he was going to put his leather desk chair in the hall to have room for his suitcase. Because of the cross traffic possibly bound for the Mid-Town tunnel (see below) our 10th floor outside room with view was pounded by street sounds. Others in our group had inside rooms and no noise problems. We didn't sample the adjacent restaurant (coffee shop) but we did try the hotel's small bar with fireplace and we were treated to music from a 4-piece jazz combo with Italian singer. The staff were very accommodating, responsive and friendly. This is an above average hotel located on the East Side one block above the Mid-Town tunnel (very convenient location). We would return. Price paid: $303 USD

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights mid October 2005. Finally writing because previous reviewers helped me.Modern, small, stylish double room with modern bath/shower. Hi-speed internet access( did not use) Terrific location, modern amentities, excellent rate. (Have noted that rates vary widely by date). I believe we stayed on 7th floor in the back. (Other reviewers commented on floor location). Italian owned and most other guests were European. Bellmen very gracious and helpful. Desk staff almost surly and engaged in their own conversations. Only US hotel of Italian hotel chain and they have put money into facility. Good "coffee shop" in hotel ( ate several meals there) and attractive high end restaurant as well (did not use). Overall, my guest and I enjoyed our stay, would gladly return and highly recommend it if price is competitive at the time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Reddish1983
Reviews.Content: This to me was a fantasic location walking distance of times sq, central park, empire state building. we had the amazing veiw of the empire state right through our window. I would definately stay here again. Bar and restarant are also lovely, a warm and friendly atmosphere. The room wasn't huge but we were hardly there...bathroom was well equiped and maids came in everyday to clean the room. Fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “surly staff, inadequate facilities”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The only decent thing about this hotel is its location. We found the staff rude and unhelpful, often too busy chatting to each other to attend to us, while we waited at the desk. Other Guests we spoke to weren't allowed in the bar for 3 nights due to Christmas parties. There was no early morning coffee was available - we wanted to set off by 7am. No in-room safe in non executive rooms. The room we were put in was dark and dingy with dripping taps so we moved to one a bit better, after much argument. We had read reviews about the unprofessional staff but chose to ignore them to our detriment. Please be wiser than us and stay elsewhere. New York is fantastic and this hotel is an island of rudeness in a city full of wonderful people and sights.

Reviews.Title: “exellent holiday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my husband, myself & four friends have just arrive home after staying at the Jolly Madison hotel, 22nd east, 38th street New York, from the minute we arrived we were made to feel welcome, the rooms were clean, and we had a king size bed, the only thing missing were tea making facilities, from our bedroom window we could see the Empire State Building, we were in easy walking distance of central station, Macys, rocker fella centre and many more attractions, the staff were very helpful, explaining how to get to different places nothing was to much trouble

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel to stay in”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: just come back from a 4 night stay at jolly madison, the hotel was lovely, clean,hotel staff were friendly and very helpful offered to book tours etc,stored luggage on last day,room was nice view unusual but didnt need view was out exploring sights.didnt eat in hotel but theres a great deli round the corner from hotel so got drinks food from there.would definetly go back there its a good location for exploring ny,its a nice area with lots in walking distance have read other reviews so was a bit worried but doubts unfounded as had a wonderful time in new york cant wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Great time had by all”
Reviews.Author: Diane123
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to this hotel for my 40th birthday. I have recommended it to other friends traveling to New York. Although the rooms were small, they were clean and nicely furnished. The hotel is perfectly situated for sightseeing and walkable distance to times square and the empire state building. We had a wonderful time in this fantastic city and cant wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “A great base”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon for 3 nights. Checking in was easy and quick. The room was nice and clean and had enough space for a short stay. The location of the hotel was brilliant, everywhere was in walking distance. Didn't have much to do with the staff as was only really in the hotel to sleep but they all seemed to be polite. The hotel bar is expensive, but it is New York. We went on to two other places on our honeymoon and this hotel was the only one to recognise that we were on honeymoon and left us a bottle of bubbly in ice in our room for when we arrived. If we were to go back to New York we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for a short stay, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: vlapinta
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the negative comments about this hotel, unless there is a real differance between rooms on differant floors. We stayed overnight for a quick visit on buisness. We found the front desk to be very curtious and friendly. We asked for a nice room and they put us on the 11th floor. The room had 2 double beds. Decorations were nothing special but it was clean and the bathroom was all tiled and very clean. It is an older hotel but they defiantely refurbished the room we were in. The location is excellant and you can walk to the Empire State building, Grand Central, Times Square. If you are looking for a large luxurius room this hotel is defianately not for you. If you are looking for a great location and a clean room for a short stay go for it! We paid $110.00 through priceline. You can't beat the price!

Reviews.Title: “It's a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a week . I would not recommend it but if you have to stay there , the food in the French restaurant next door is better , cheaper and you will not have to stand arguing your extras bill while waiting for your cab to the airport . The Yugoslav staff's supposed lack of knowledge of the English language means you will get nowhere .

Reviews.Title: “No MTV but...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: ...that was our only misgiving. The staff were efficient, and the room and bathrooms were a good size, clean and unobtrusively decorated. The hotel itself is quiet, and ideally situated for midtown and lower Manhattan, with an excellent selection of breakfast and evening meal outlets mere steps away. After mixed experiences with both cheaper and more expensive Manhattan hotels, we'd be strongly tempted to go back to the Jolly - despite its peculiar name!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly placed!”
Reviews.Author: weejim
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights in a junior suite (free upgrade $200pn), rooms were big for NYC, clean and well funished. The Hotel is in a great location for sightseeing, although Murray Hill is a bit quiet if you want nightlife right at your doorstep. On foot only 5 mins Grand central, Empire state, 10 mins Times Square. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: sydzap
Reviews.Content: Just returned from trip April 01 - 08 2005. Was a little concerned after reading some of the reviews posted about this hotel but can honestly not fault the place. Extremely clean and tastefully decorated, the staff were friendly and helpful and upgraded our room on request (free) as we were there to celebrate my husband's 30th. The room we had on the first night was absolutely fine on the 4th floor but then we were given an upgrade to the 15th floor which had a close view of the Empire State Building! All for asking politely if we could have a roon with a view! The location was ideal for us as first time visitors to NY, it was 2 minutes to the Empire State, and close to all midtown attractions. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “very fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: joisey-joe
Reviews.Content: a very fine hotel - pleasant rooms & people - no complaints at all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel February 17th - 21st 2005. We had absolutely no problems whatsoever. Reception kindly upgraded us to a delux room from a standard for free upon arrival- during check in! The room was very spacious, huge television, big bed, mini bar, gorgeous marble bathroom with a lovely deep bath - which you will need after miles of sightseeing around new york!! The location of the Hotel couldn't be better very close to lots of major attractions. Only minor problem we encountered was electric shocks from the lifts - literally every time we went to press the buttons we got a shock!!! Would definately stay in this hotel again without hesitiation - you cant ask for more!!!

Reviews.Title: “Above average for the price”
Reviews.Author: twilson140
Reviews.Content: Despite some mixed consumer reviews of this hotel -- some were good, some weren't so good -- we went ahead and booked it to give it a try. First, the place was very clean -- and that can be worth a lot when you're travelling on a budget to NYC! Yes, it was small, but not cramped. We feel "cozy" is a much better word. Not that we needed them much, but the staff were all as friendly as one might expect. I loved the Italian feel of the place; everthing was written in English and Italian. When we were in the room, I could pretend we were back in Italy! But we were in NYC and there is ALWAYS something to do in that city, so who cares about how big the room is! We really didn't spend much time in the room, so it was big enough to get a very comfortable night's sleep. My one gripe is that our room was a standard and the bathroom didn't have a tub, which was fine, but what were we going to do with the bath salts they gave us!! And speaking of the shower, and this has been the case in other hotels we've stayed at in NYC, there's no place to put the soap, shampoo, and/or conditioner but on the floor! A simple soap shelf would be most useful in the shower. All in all, we think we may have found a "home" in NYC. We'll definitely go back to the Jolly Madison!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: ALIRICH
Reviews.Content: I was concerned by the comments which i had read before our trip however could not find fault with this hotel. The rooms were clean with daily towel change and were an average size for a New York hotel. All staff were helpful and friendly. A good location, close to Empire State Building and other major attractions. We stayed here in Dec 04 and would return again!!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rmorrison
Reviews.Content: We where concerned from reading the reviews of the hotel, however we found all the staff very friendly and helpful. The room was not massive, but afterall this is a city hotel and that is what we would expect. The towels where changed daily , the shower did not leak. We had a side view of the empire state building, and the hotel is in walking distance of all the main sights. We may have paid over the odds for the transfer back Newark airport, but we where concerned about trying to hail a cab at 5.00am in the morning. Good hotel for the price, and nice bar area with a roaring fire.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room!”
Reviews.Author: SM_LB
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Madison Towers on the 6-10 December. Room was TINY! Had to climb over the bed to get to the bathroom, spoke to the reception staff (very unfriendly!) and they told us we had already been upgraded to a superior room. Room was tatty, and towels not changed daily even after we had to clean the bathroom floor everyday with them because the shower leaked. Bed was tiny, think it might have been a single room??? Location was good, about 5 minutes from the Empire State building. Be careful getting a taxi back to the airport, always choose a yellow cab whatever the porter says!!! Works out cheaper :-) Would not stay here again, much better hotels in New York for the price we paid!
